Won't be going back. Zero stars, if I could."
"Terrible customer service. Called in, waited 45 minutes. Guy at counter, hate his job. No one said hi, no one helped. Had to wait, never returned."
"Negative star, no question. Horrendous customer service. Not a single soul acknowledged my presence, despite everyone else getting attention. Never again."

"Workin' on a quilt, needed some help with the colors. Found a woman named Gail, asked her for assistance. She let out a big sigh, walked over to the section, and said this is all we got. Asked her if I could find more online, she shrugged and said 'I don't know, you'll have to look.' So I left and took my business elsewhere."
"Rice crunched, beans lacked zest, tortilla clung, chicken dominated burrito. Grumble."

"Ate here with seven others. Overpriced, even for Vegas. Quality lacking. Dumplings microwaved, unevenly heated, no flavor. Pho thin, meat fatty, tough. Shrimp fishy, mushy. Poor service, empty restaurant. Beer glass dirty, previous beers' foam dried on glass. Wonder if anyone's tried the $175 birds nest soup."

"Hark! What woeful tale doth this pizza place bring?
Their site, a snare, doth charge unwary feet
For each order made, a fee they do impose,
A tax on hunger, and a bitter dose.
And should thou choose to wait, alas!
'Tis oft an hour, or more, they doth amass,
Even at two, when sun doth highest sit,
Thy stomach grumbles, and thy soul doth flit.
But fear not, for their pizza, though not great,
Doth fill thy belly, and doth sate thy fate.
Yet, is it worth the trouble and the strife?
I say, good sir, 'tis not, and thus I end my life."
"Starbucks costs double the norm. A medium drip coffee runs $4.20. I dig Starbucks, have it daily, but c'mon."
"Tried giving this joint another shot, but it still didn't pan out. Overpriced grub and crummy service. That's two strikes, pal."

"This Michaels in Charlotte, fair citizens, doth leave much to be desired. The store itself doth appear in disarray, with shelves both empty and disorganized. And, alack, the cashier who did attend to me did seem most vexed at her task. In truth, I do prefer to venture forth to Hobby Lobby, or wait until my travels take me to another, more well-appointed Michaels. Forsooth, this store doth lack in both selection and hospitality."
"Back to the shop with the CRV, A/C blown again. Two years since last fix. Bad luck."

"Disappointment hit hard at this joint. Naan and tandoori chicken, that's what I ordered. Came in a puny white box, but that wasn't the worst of it. Chicken was yellow and pink, no char marks, no flavor. Onions, raw and uncooked. Photos looked great, but reality bit hard."

"Service stunk, one star for that. Wouldn't seat us, bullshit reason. We wanted outside, she said sunny, we said okay, inside. She said 15 minutes, place was empty. Two other women showed up, got seated right away. What the hell?"
"Terrible courts. Dead spots everywhere. Don't play here."

"You gonna make me sit here and repeat my order twice 'cause you're too busy laughin'? People waitin' patiently out here, and you forget my fries. Not the biggest deal, but I paid for 'em. Give 'em to me."

"Menu looked promising, but the prices were steep. Food was mediocre. No excuse for the cost. Main courses arrived before apps and salads. Even if they were slammed, that's no excuse. Disappointed in every way. Won't be back unless absolutely necessary, and even then, we'll eat elsewhere first."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth unfold,
Of Oxygen sessions sought, yet none to hold.
A local, I, with frequent visits made,
And referrals, too, my friends did persuade.

An $11 can of Oxygen, I did purchase,
Yet, alas! The horror of no exchange, did pierce.
A poor experience, indeed, it was,
That left me vexed, and in disgust, I did pass.

They cared not, for my plight, it seemed,
And thus, a loyal customer, they did lose.
Oh, fair warning, dear friends, take heed,
For Oxygen's services, are not worth the deed.

And lo, a better option, I do say,
A "Tens" unit, at medical supply, doth way.
A massager, for half the cost, doth bring,
A wise choice, indeed, for those who would cling.

So, heed my words, and shun Oxygen's grasp,
Lest thou be fooled, and thy gold, they do clasp."

"First off, I changed my mind. Maybe that's why the customer service went down the drain. My apologies. 
I came in for an oil change and a wash, and they tried to sell me an exterior and interior cleaning. Initially, I said yes, but my husband convinced me otherwise. 
I told them, and they adjusted the bill. I paid, but now my car's sitting outside, unserviced, while the mechanic's snacking on red hots and shooting the breeze with his coworkers. 
Look, I might've messed up their plan, but I'm still the customer. That's right."
"This spot, on this night, was a real bust. I don't reckon I'll be back. Total buzzkill, late night edition."

"Fie upon these crowded halls, where shoppers throng and time doth flee! For naught but empty shelves and endless queues didst we find, a woeful sight indeed. Alas, poor footwear, how art thou scattered and scarce? A plague upon this shopping spree, a fruitless venture, say I."

"Target's always a strange trip. Crowded, sure, but that's not the half of it. Cashiers, they're the real issue. Like zombies, man. Soulless. I've been plenty of times, and only once did I get a decent one. The rest? They don't even look at you. You show up, they scan your stuff, and that's it. No words, no eye contact, nothing. Not even a robot's courtesy. It's like they're dead inside."

"In town for work, three colleagues and I stopped by for lunch. Small, clean joint. Server not too friendly, but that was just the beginning. Two of us ordered the same thing, third and fourth chose differently. Waitress returns, tells us they're out of what two of us wanted, and several other items. Sandwich I got came with bean salad. Passed on that. Sandwich was cold, drenched in pesto. Never got a chance to send it back. When she brought the checks, our glasses were empty. Let her know it was cold. She didn't apologize, just took my plate. Ended up taking 20% off my bill. Figured she should've charged me only 20%, considering I ate half the sandwich and skipped the bean salad."

"A woeful tale of wretchedness and disarray,
This place doth call itself a store, yet naught
But chaos reigns within its walls, I say.
The order we did place online, a mere
Scavenger hunt it was, alack, to find.
Told first to seek the computers' aid,
We chanced upon a sign that did imply
Our router might be found in networking's shade.
Yet lo, the employee did say, 'twas not
In computing's realm, but at the cashier's spot.
And thus we sought the cashier, in haste,
To claim our goods, but oh, what woeful fate!
The cashier, in confusion, didst demand
A manager, to sort the mess, to understand.
And when at last our order did appear,
The cashier did ask for payment, quite queer.
Forsooth, they do not charge the card, it seems,
Until the purchase is complete, in their schemes.
Lastly, a request for bags, didst we make,
But nay, the cashier didst reply, 'twas not their task.
Yet still, we coaxed her, with gentle words,
To place each item in its own small bags, as birds.
Thus, with much ado, we didst escape the place,
With purchases in hand, but naught in grace."

"Skip this joint. They'll rip you off, sure as sunrise. Friend of mine went in, knew squat about cars. Customer service clowns made prank calls while she waited. Then they slapped on the wrong tire size - four of 'em, could've wrecked her struts easy. Why? Beats me. \n\nAnyway, that's when I realized they botched my tire job too. No spare for six months, my bad for not checkin', but still. Tire was busted, hole big enough to drive a truck through. Never again, Discount Tire's managed by cavemen."

"We tried the hotel buffet, voted number one for six years running. Thirty bucks a head, not cheap. My husband and I aren't big on buffets, but we gave it a shot. Turned out to be a bust. Food was flavorless, nothing stood out. Except for desserts, that is. Maybe the elderly crowd likes their grub bland, but we sure didn't."

"Bought a Groupon for Aveda, thought I'd give it a shot. Picky about my hair, so I went for a deep conditioning treatment and pedicure. Girl doing my services was quiet, shy. Started with the deep conditioning, took 30 minutes under the dryer. She did my pedicure while the conditioner sat in my hair, didn't even cut my toenails. File them, they were still long when I left. Horrible two-hour experience. She talked about her boyfriend most of the time. Back to the station to dry my hair, told her to blow dry until damp, then use a ceramic brush. She didn't listen, neither did the instructor. After 1.5 hours, my hair was still damp and wavy. Disappointed overall, especially with the lack of supervision from the instructors. They came over twice the whole four hours I was there."

"Labor Day weekend, cousin's wedding on the Strip. Hotels were pricey, so I settled for a joint in the $90 range. Room was decent, casino and restaurant not bad. Free WiFi too. But, it was in a shady neighborhood. Outside hotel, separate casino. Felt like a dive, heard everything from the neighbors - TV, toilet, even their bed creaking. Trashy. Told management, they refunded one night, not bad."

"Terrible experience from the start. Sat at a Formica table, away from the Asian crowd, with no tablecloth or silverware. Ordered sizzling seafood, got five shrimp and a bunch of mystery fish. Husband got crispy duck, but it was old and dried out, couldn't even bite through it. Asked for cashew chicken instead, and they burned it. Then they had the nerve to try and charge us for all three meals."

"They ripped us off, man. Took us for a ride, literally. Shoulda been a five-mile trip, but they stretched it out to three times that. Forty-five bucks, gone. Didn't realize till we hit the hotel, checked the map on my phone. They musta thought we were clueless. Called 'em up, some chick answered, like I was the first to ever complain. Told me to write a letter. Like that's gonna do anything."

"Went to the place last night with the kids, eager to take on the 502 Fry challenge. Website said it was a real deal, but when we got there, the joint was dead. One guy working, ignoring us for five minutes straight. Told him we were there for the challenge, but he just kept jabbering on the phone. Didn't even give us the courtesy of a "be right with you" lie. We bailed and hit up Metro Pizza instead. Maybe we'll try the Tropicana spot next time. Decatur location? Terrible customer service."

"Nineteen, that's the magic number. That's when you'll find yourself at this bar, and you'll actually enjoy it. But don't bother with a fake ID, especially not one from some 21-year-old entrepreneur who's sold a dozen of them to desperate kids. The bouncers can spot that crap a mile away, and chances are, that 21-year-old is a regular here anyway. Now, I know what you're thinking - what about the vomit? Yeah, it's usually everywhere at Brother's. Just don't expect it to be in the toilet, that's all."

"Terrible service. Waiter was a jerk. Took forever to get our check and water. Finally got someone else's attention. Waiter came over, sassy and full of excuses. We ignored him and left. He yelled something snarky as we walked out. Food was typical Vegas crap."

"Alas, how swiftly doth the atmosphere deceive!
For though it be great, yet doth it quickly dwindle.
I came here oft, and with joy did partake
Of rolls most wondrous, ere they did change the menu.
Now limited and lacking in delight,
Doth make me shun this place, where once I did revel.
And lo, the happy hour, how variable it doth seem!
When business doth flag, they do shut their doors,
And on the weekends, naught but disappointment doth await.
Unreliable, indeed, this place doth prove to be.

And slow, oh so slow, the wait staff doth move,
As if in slumber, or in idle reverie.
The food, it doth sit, a full five minutes long,
Awaiting its fate, like a prisoner in chains.
I didst think to take it up myself, in ire,
Like Larry David, in his show of curbed enthusiasm.
But alas, I didst refrain, and didst not stir.

Yet still, this place, the closest to my home,
Doth hold a special place within my heart.
For though I may not come here anymore,
My love for sushi doth never depart.
And so, I shall seek out Kobe Sushi Bistro,
On S. Rainbow, where my hunger shall be assuaged."

"Back from pickup, lousy service. Employee pushy as hell, wouldn't take no for an answer. Twice now, orders screwed up. First time, they claimed no mistakes, kept me on hold for ten. Second time, sounded pissed, manager came quick. Place sucks, avoid it."
"Sat in the parking lot for 20 goddamn minutes, waiting for my fast food. Not a single other car in sight. Finally, I gave up and drove off, hungry as hell."

We hit up Gordon Ramsay's joint in Vegas. Figured we'd give it a shot. Had the onion soup, prime rib, and bangers and mash. Basic stuff, you know? Should be hard to screw up. But man, it was a disaster. Cold soup, fatty meat, and the wait staff was slow as hell. Not worth the cash, let me tell you. Maybe Gordon should swing by and check the place out. It ain't doin' his rep any favors, that's for sure. Could use a little TV magic, if you know what I mean.

"Awful coffee, way too expensive. Cheap interior design, overall a waste of time and money. Smoothies are fine, pastries are decent, but don't let the exterior or logo fool you. You'll pay top dollar for poorly made drinks from uncaring staff. Avoid."

"Went to Betsy's with Joy, who's a milk-cream-sugar-flavorings fanatic. She wasn't impressed. Small servings for the price. I had sorbet, too sweet. Sticking to Scoops and Carini's. Got an email from the owner/manager asking how to improve my review. Said they're training staff to give bigger portions, but some aren't doing it right. Also, looking into changing the recipe. My response? Train staff properly before putting them on the line. You can get a half-gallon of premium ice cream for the same price as two tiny scoops at Betsy's. Not a fan of sorbet, prefer frozen yogurt. Didn't see any."

"Tried it twice. Once for dinner, once for breakfast. Dinner was mediocre. Breakfast was a disaster. Eggs Florentine had a measly amount of Hollandaise, unripe tomatoes, and barely any spinach. My husband detested the turkey bacon and his toast was burnt to a crisp. The potatoes were either undercooked or overcooked, and the rosemary was overpowering. Everything was frigid. The fresh seasonal fruit? A single apple in August. Coffee tasted like it came from a packet. Service? Non-existent both times."

"Avoid Olive Garden like the plague. Terrible service. Don't bother with ToGo orders. Twenty-minute wait? Are they kidding me? And don't even get me started on the quality of the food. Cold and soggy? More like frozen and flavorless. Save your taste buds and your time. Zero stars? Not enough. I'd give it a negative rating if I could."

"Ulta's got some real stinkers for customer service. Now, I ain't one for needin' much help, but a fella likes to be acknowledged, ya know? And if I got a question, I reckon it's nice to get an answer. Not here, though. These gals just don't give a damn. They act like they're doin' you a favor by breathin'. I swear, it's like they're tryin' to drive customers away. Maybe that's their job description – be as unhelpful as possible."
"Food poisoning alert. Friendly staff, decent grub. Twice now, diarrhea's paid a visit. Spices, maybe. Uncleanliness, possibly."

"Terrible experience. Been with 'em two years, service and staff quality dropped off a cliff. Rude, unhelpful, don't give a damn. Not fit for a job dealing with families, kids. Get a smile, be nice, or get out."
"Terrible joint. Tastes like kibble. No flavor. Swear they serve canned pup chow. Never going back."

"Don't waste your dough or time at this joint. It's a crummy club with mediocre decor and atmosphere. The crowd's nothing special and the music's outdated. You're better off gambling with your money and time elsewhere. It'll pay off more."

"Terrible. Worst Asian food I've ever had. Six of us, quick lunch, hotel restaurant. Different dishes. Beef noodle soup for me. Friends had pho, broccoli beef, mapo tofu, pad thai, chicken stir fry. All wrong. Wrong sauces, wrong noodles. Friend sent pho back. First time. Shut it down. Burn it."

"We gave it a shot, based on the reviews. Atmosphere was decent, no rudeness from the staff. Service was good, but the menu? Not so much. They were clean outta meat. Anything we wanted was unavailable, so we settled for grilled cheese and fried fish. Both were swimming in grease. Bread tasted like old oil, fish was drenched. Won't be going back, won't recommend it. One of the waitresses seemed a bit snarky, but she was just doing her job. Takeout's a gamble."

"APS, a lousy outfit. Their default plan, tiered usage, costs six times the normal rate per kWh. Use a third-party billing company, too cheap to process cards themselves. International cards no good for online payments, billing address foreign, no zip. Own a house in Vegas, never had issues like this with APS. Lease ending, new rental must be in SRP area. Good riddance, APS."

"Pray tell, good sir, how may I assist thee? Aye, an oil change and car wash, prithee! Verily, 'tis but sixty-two dollars and ninety-five pence, a fair price for such services, I daresay. Yet, mark my words, young man, thy sales career shall prosper not, nay, not beyond the confines of yonder car wash. Fare thee well, and may Fortune smile upon thee, despite this humble station."

"Aunt needed a new faucet, so we went to get one. Guy in a wheelchair in the plumbing department was a real jerk. My husband knows his stuff, but this guy still tried to tell him he was wrong. Rolled his eyes at us, too. Thankfully, I don't live here. Aunt does, though, and says he's always like that. Guy needs a serious attitude adjustment."
"Avoid this joint. Overpriced trash. Not worth your dime."

"Vegetarian, few places to eat. Went to this joint, tried their veggie turkey sandwich. Two hours later, nausea and stomach pains hit. Food poisoning? Maybe the soy turkey was old and bad. Next morning, esophagus and stomach on fire. Can't eat or drink. Ouch."

The office was a mess. First off, the front desk staff and medical assistants looked like they'd rather be anywhere else. Not a single greeting. I saw a nurse practitioner and told her I needed my asthma meds refilled. Also mentioned some face darkening that's been bugging me. I'd read hydroquinone cream is a common treatment. She kept disappearing to talk to the doc for over an hour. When I asked her what was up, she said she was still in training and her supervisor wouldn't let her prescribe the cream. This whole time, I couldn't help but feel like I was asking for something illegal. They changed my usual asthma script to QVAR, which cost a pretty penny and couldn't even be filled. Long story short, I waited forever, didn't get greeted, and left empty-handed without a clear reason why.

"Hark, what woeful tale doth mine ears perceive?
A hotel stay, so full of disbelief!
The sheets, unkempt, a sorry sight to see,
And ashes, scattered on the coffee table, free.

We checked in, at two o'clock, they say,
Yet still, no room service came our way.
Three calls, we made, and promises, they broke,
Now, one AM, and still, no sign of smoke.

Oh, traveler, take heed of this warning true,
This hotel, shun it, as thou wouldst shun anew.
For customer service, poor, and slow,
Doth make our stay, a woeful woe."

"Alack, the decor doth please mine eyes,
In truth, 'tis where The Gelato Spot doth rise.
Their focus, as it seems, doth lie with sweet,
But I, alas, didst seek a drink most meet.
Iced coffee, I didst order, full of hope,
But lo, the cashier didst give me cause to cope.
He gave me hot coffee, and a cup of ice,
As if my mind were lost in some nice vice.
In summer's heat, who doth desire a hot brew?
Not I, good sir, unless my wits be few.
And thus, the watery concoction didst taste,
Most vile and foul, a drink most waste.
For this, I do pronounce this place doth lack,
And shall not see my face again, no need to ask."

"Good grub, but that's it for me. No regard for health codes here. Guy comes in from smokin', touches the rail, then handles my food like it's his business. Owner sees it all, says zip. Shut 'em down."
"Meatball sandwich lacked meatballs. Bun, too big. Empty space, lengthwise. Small balls. Add more, bigger balls. Or, shrink bun. Simple fix."

"Shrimp 'n grits, good eatin'. Blackened fish sandwich, baked beans, chopped salad - all top-notch. But two stars, that's all. Rude hostess, snotty too. Twenty-five minute wait for some, while others get seated right away, no reservation needed. Service didn't match the grub. That's how it goes."

"Went to the new joint on the island. Been waitin' for this burger spot to open. Went last night, place was slammed. Onion rings were soggy, burgers too. Mine was still pink in the middle, not cooked right. Pricey too, won't be goin' back. Service was poor, but they were swamped. Soda had nothing but fizz, no Dr Pepper. Real disappointment."

"Haps has seen better days. I've given 'em another shot a few times since my last review, but today's lunch sealed the deal - one star's all they get. Why? They skimp on everything. Mashed potatoes are flavorless, garlic toast lacks garlic, and don't even get me started on the buns. They're dry, spongy, and tasteless. And that "frozen dairy dessert product"? Give me a break. Henry Weinhard's root beer was swapped out for A&W's plastic crap. That's just wrong. My $12 lunch (pulled pork, cobbler, and water) should've cost half that. With a drink, it'd be $14! Arizonans must like bad food, 'cause Haps ain't got nothin' good goin' on."

"St. Patty's day bar crawl. Most joints weren't bringin' their A-game, but still got one star. What went down?

Tables weren't gettin' bussed, so we did it ourselves.
Menus were sticky from spilled brew.
Took 15 min to order drinks, then another 15 to get 'em and order grub.
Food took 2+ hours.
Apps came with the grub, not before, makin' the wait even worse.
Tater-tot nachos had few chips, not much cheese, mostly iceberg lettuce.
Burgers were only cooked well done.
Burgers came with toast instead of a real bun.
Separate checks were too much work, so we split the table 8 ways.

I gotta stop, my blood pressure's risin' just thinkin' about it. It was a real stinker that day. Wish I'd gone to Five Guys and been done with it (ended up goin' later).

Get your act together, folks. And hey, I still tipped the waitress, most of that stuff was the kitchen's fault. You gotta tip, they ain't gettin' paid by the restaurant."

"This place brought back memories of a night gone wrong. Wasted, I stumbled into an outhouse and passed out. When I came to, I couldn't recall a thing. It was cheap and filthy, like my state of mind. Stay clear-headed when you're here, or the germs will take advantage of your drunkenness."

"Terrible customer service. They screwed me over, botched my order. The clueless woman at the counter, couldn't speak a lick of English. She should learn to communicate, treat folks with respect. That's how it goes in China."

"Terrible service. Don't waste your time. Drove from Chi-town for the Bears game, hit up Ale House on a Saturday night with six friends. Table wasn't cleaned from previous customers, so my boyfriend asks the waitress to tidy up. She agrees, but never comes back. Another waitress passes by, says she'll clean it, but doesn't follow through. We ask for the manager. D Sellers shows up, makes excuses for his staff. Should've brought a rag himself. Poorly managed bar. We all walked out. Never again. Place deserves zero stars."

"Terrible grub they got here. Green tomato BLT? More like day-old bacon and a slimy tomato on stale bread. Quesadilla? Forget about it. Dry and a mess. And don't even get me started on the server. Long nails, couldn't even set the plates down right. Unhygienic, if you ask me. Maybe the breakfast is better, but I wouldn't know. Avoid this joint like the plague."
"Skip this joint. Place was clearin' out fast, ten o'clock and all. They stuck us in a crummy corner. Who needs a view they can't even see? We bounced, went down to Mon Ami Gabi instead."

"Olive Garden? No thanks. Their grub's got a frozen taste, like it's been nuked in a microwave. Breadsticks are off too, tasty but strange. Service? Meh. Skip it. Head to Anzio's, local joint, real Italian flavor, friendly folks. Avoid this chain crap. Frozen dinners, no thanks. I can do that at home."

"Don't get the gist of this joint. Service ain't the priority. Fill up my ride, pay at the pump, no fuss, no muss. But when I need cash, it's a damn nightmare. Cashier's also the barista? Three dudes ahead of me? Might as well say a novena, 'cause it'll take eight minutes 'fore I can pay for gas. Stuck between coffee and cupcakes. They need two cashiers, always. Don't sacrifice customer service for fancy schmancy."

"Never again. Stopped in after yoga, looking for a quick bite. Guy behind counter didn't say a word. Asked him what he liked, he shrugs. Ordered falafel and chicken skewer. Took 20 minutes, place was empty. Asked for it to go, guy got pissed. Falafel was frozen, shaped like a sausage patty. Chicken skewer was tiny, dry, burnt veggies. Hummus wasn't good, pita tasted old and stale. $9? No way. Wanted to like it, but never again."

"One star, that's all they get from me. Their policy on water cups is plain ridiculous. Asked for a cup of water, got charged for a drink. What kind of nonsense is that? Malcolm, the cashier, should've told me before he took my money. But no, he just stood there, smiling like a fool. Children and the elderly, huh? What about the rest of us? Do we not deserve a simple cup of water? It's a shame, really. A place with such potential, ruined by silly rules."

"We returned, courtesy of a generous gift card, for what will be my last time. First, they brought me my steak with the wrong sauce - their pepper sauce instead of the shallot butter I ordered. I sent it back, and they brought me the right sauce - with the wrong steak. Funny enough, it was the same Heinz Ward steak I'd been unhappy with before. This time, my steak was cooked a perfect medium-rare, but the flavor was still lacking. I had three bites and stopped eating. They didn't charge me for the steak, but at a place this pricey, I expect more than a C- experience."

"Treasure Island Hotel, a place where customer care takes a backseat. My experience? Subpar service, to say the least. From the unhelpful front desk to the sports bar tenders who treated me like I was just there for a free drink, it was clear that genuine hospitality wasn't a priority. And don't even get me started on the long check-in wait or the ropes hanging outside my window, ready to be used by staff at any moment. If you want to pay extra for champagne glasses or find a Starbucks that doesn't accept gift cards, this is the place for you. But if you expect decent service, look elsewhere. Mystere, the Cirque du Soleil show, was the only highlight in an otherwise disappointing stay."

"Hark! What sign doth take up half the side of yonder hotel?
Aye, 'tis Hooters', and it doth proclaim,
In bold letters, their 24-hour game of chance,
For $3, a paltry sum, yet still they'll dance.
But lo, dear traveler, heed my words of woe,
For though the sign doth boast, the truth doth show,
But one lone table, with poor odds, doth lie,
And re-buys, alas, are not allowed to try.
The casino, small and cramped, doth reek,
Of chicken wings, a stench most foul and bleak.

If thou hast stepped within a Hooters' door,
Imagine all the horrors, and then some more,
Add a blackjack table, and beds to rest,
And thou hast this place, a den of woe and unrest.
I've seen it once, and now I know full well,
To nevermore return, and save my soul from hell."

"Hark, good sirs of Oregano's, heed my words of wisdom,
For ill tidings come to those who keep their guests in waiting.
Avoid ye the curse of tardiness, lest ye wish to vex,
And double-check thy orders, ere they be dispatched.

Forsooth, a night most foul doth lie ahead,
When hunger doth consume and tempers doth fray.
So heed this warning, and make haste,
Lest all thy efforts doth turn to naught but waste."

"Place was decent 'til now. Went with fam, found foil in grub. Waitress was cool, got manager. He didn't know how it got there, ain't part of recipe. No kiddin'. Didn't charge us, but didn't offer new plate either. Poor management. Waitress asked if we wanted somethin' else. Never comin' back. Who knows what's in their food?"
"Terrible joint. Chicken bowl, cold and rock-hard. Looked like it's been sitting out for days. Never coming back. Refund, please."

"I live here and regret ever signing the lease. Water gets shut off every couple months, sometimes more often. Whole complex goes without because some apartments don't get hot water. Been here since May 2011, water's been shut off four or five times. No AC during summer either, since it's connected. No running water right now. Called maintenance four times: doorknob fell off, garbage disposal broke twice, shower head rusted and wouldn't work. Lease will be up soon, then I'm gone."

"Chop and Wok, once a legend, now a shadow of its former self. Pricey, small portions, and flavorless dishes. Not a single label on the takeout boxes, a mystery meal. Tough, grisly beef, obsolete chicken. Kung Pao chicken, a disappointment, no spice. Crab puffs, the only saving grace. Never again, Chop and Wok. Disappointed customer since high school."
The gym's alright, but steer clear of the management. They'll keep charging you till you put it in writing that you want out. Sneaky buggers snuck in an auto-renewal clause.
"Went to Wendy's a few times. Not the best customer service, but it's okay when you're starving. Haven't been back since they redid the Walmart complex. They got a Subway in there now."
"Post office drop-off, next door. Place is a rip-off. Single scoop, vanilla, reg cone. $3.60? Outrageous. First and last time."

"Hark, my dearest spouse and I didst decide
Upon a place to dine, to celebrate
The day of fathers, and thus we didst choose
A restaurant of renown, where we hadst been
In times past, and found the victuals fair
And service of high quality. But lo,
I chanced upon some reviews, ere we went,
Of patrons who hadst suffered ill treatment
At the hands of a waitress, whose breath
Didst reek of smoke, and thus didst taint
Their culinary delights. My husband, he
Didst say, 'Fear not, my love, all shall be well.'
So to the restaurant we didst proceed,
Despite my doubts. And lo, my fears were true,
For in my drink, a plastic cigarette wrapper
Didst appear, and I, in horror, didst pick it out,
Mistaking it for ice. Our waitress, she
Was sweet and sorrowful, but the management,
They didst offer scant consolation, taking off
But drinks and twenty-five percent, a paltry sum.
We shall not return, forsooth, to that place."

"Hark, good sir! 'Twas a Wednesday afternoon, and I didst stop in for a late repast. The hour was nigh 2:30, and I, a solitary figure, didst enter the establishment. Swiftly seated, I didst order a dish of calamari, and a small pizza of Greek origin. A substitution of giro meat didst I request, in place of the ground beef that doth customarily adorn the pizza. Three glasses of iced tea didst I imbibe, ere the waiter didst attend to my appetizer. Alas, the calamari didst arrive, some seven minutes later, and lo! 'Twas soggy and foul-tasting, as if 'twere fried in burnt oil. And shortly thereafter, the pizza didst appear, with a crust most vile and unpalatable. Like an opened frozen pizza crust, left too long in the freezer, didst it taste. Ah, woe is me! For $7.95, the calamari didst cost, and $12.95, the pizza didst fetch. And $2.95, the price of each glass of iced tea. With tax, the total didst exceed $25.00, a sum most exorbitant, for a meal most wretched. Heed my words, dear friend, and shun this place, lest thou desirest to feed thy dog a similar fare."
"Spent $15 on lunch. Hot dog joint, but no foot longs or sauerkraut. Food was mediocre. Wait was awful. Talked shit while we waited. Shake was okay. One star instead of zero. Peace."

"Place called 'Americas Best Value' Inn. Bullshit. Looked like Colors, furniture and decor straight outta the 80s, carpet smelled like piss, bed was hard as a rock, bathroom had mold growin' on it. Stayed here 'cause we needed multiple rooms, thought it'd be cheaper. Two-fifty-seven miles from home, no other choice. Bought all sorts of cleanin' supplies at Walmart, tried to sanitize the place. Didn't do shit. Never stayin' here again."

"Fie upon this wretched tavern! I didst order a white wine spritzer, and the server, a foolish knave, didst tell me they didst not carry such a drink. I, in mine anger, didst inform him of its nature and longevity. My wife, fair and lovely, didst order a frozen strawberry lemonade, but received instead a regular draught. When we didst order our repast, the server didst laugh at my request to exclude poblano peppers or any spice. I, desiring a light meal, didst choose a dish from the Weight Watchers menu. But lo! When our victuals arrived, the server didst assume that my wife, larger than I, didst desire the Weight Watchers dish. I was taken aback, and straightway didst speak with the manager, recounting all that had transpired. We didst depart, and I didst pay for naught."

"Tried calling the damn number for the county joint, but it's busted. Can't get through to anyone, just a bunch of buttons to press and nothing happens. What a waste of time. If you need help, gotta call the police non-emergency line instead."

"Delivery came quick, but it was a disappointment. They brought me a sandwich with mayo and ham, despite my clear instructions. And the bread was soaked. Un eat able. I chucked it in the trash, along with my hard-earned cash."

The room was pleasant. However, the customer service was subpar. They refused to give us our Marriott reward points for our stay because we booked it along with our flight. This has never been an issue before. Additionally, they wouldn't upgrade my room, despite our gold membership status. I had planned to stay for two weeks, but after this fiasco, I decided to book at the Grand Chateau instead. They allowed me to book online through my airline and even gave me credit for my stay there. They also contacted Marriott Rewards on my behalf and had the credit for this hotel applied to my account. Thanks, Andrew, for the excellent hookup at a much nicer Marriott.

"O, wouldst thou hear a tale of woe and desp'rate fate?
A lodging most foul, a place to avoid, I do state.
Moldy sheets, stained with unknown substances, did lay,
And tub, with water beneath the plaster, did sway.
Carpet, with sickening stains, did make one ill,
And sheets, with hair afixed, did cause great chill.
Crumbs and rubbish, pushed aside, did gather,
A sight most vile, and unhygienic, I do gather.
We asked for new sheets, at the eleventh hour,
And staff, with attitude, did shower.
Just filthy, the place, a health hazard, I do declare,
Department of Health, should pay a visit, I do swear.
If thou desirest visual proof, email me, I pray,
With 'Days Inn Pictures' as subject, I shall obey.
I warn thee, traveler, heed my words,
For this place, thy health, it may devour.
Insect bites, upon my wrist, do still persist,
A souvenir, most unwelcome, I do insist."
"Las Vegas airport, Advantage counter. Noon reservation, arrived 11:25. Told I was too early, waited 30 minutes. Charged extra, didn't get what I wanted."

"Siri made the news for recycling rice. KTNV reported it. 
I returned, despite my better judgment. The pad thai called to me. Big mistake. We tried to eat there again on August 15th, but the health district shut them down...again! Over 70 demerits. Don't risk it. You'll end up in the hospital. 
We've eaten there more than a dozen times. We'd walk by, think about getting the pad thai, then keep walking. 
The pad thai is great, but you might get served the same rice twice."

"No refills, huh? That's rich. You're telling me I gotta pay another six bucks for a soda that's already cost me thirty? And don't even get me started on the seats. They're worn out, dirty, and just plain gross. And the staff? Forget about it. They don't give a damn about customer service. I'm telling ya, it's not worth the trip. I'll stick to Town Square from now on. At least they know how to treat their customers right."
"Five recalls on my '13 Escape. Told me it'd take all day. Gaudin Ford won't give me a rental. They've gone downhill. This year, customers will go elsewhere. Don't deserve a single star."

"Volleyball and booze don't mix. Someone made a bad call, combining 'em in a dimly lit dive. Doorman made my buddy leave her purse in the car. Flying volleyballs, watch out! I got smacked in the cheek, chattin' with pals at a table. Manager snarked, "Sit elsewhere," when I told him it was gettin' wild. Never sittin' there again, after his sass. Friend got nailed in the neck by a volleyball. We split before more damage. Surprised nobody's sued 'em...yet. Drinks were inconsistent, one had vodka, the next lacked alcohol."

"Wife and I had lunch here. Disappointed. Overpriced and poor quality. Fish tacos, small and flavorless. Rice and beans, too salty and dry. Chicken salad, bland. Dressing, horrible. Salsas, subpar. Upper deck seating and service, nice. But not worth $50."

"This joint's a real dump. They tried to gouge us on the bottle prices, and the strippers were a bunch of false advertising. The talent here's nothing special. Vegas has way better. I may be a fat, ugly sonofabitch, but even I ain't impressed with this dive. Stay away from these shady characters."

"BofA drive-thru's a real joke. Two ATMs, side by side, in the same lane. What kinda idiot thinks that's a good idea? Guy in front of me took his sweet time, held up the whole line for ten minutes. Stupid, stupid, stupid."

"Airport restaurants are a necessary evil. You're trapped, hungry, and willing to pay a premium for a decent meal before your flight. This place replaced a Wendy's, and now it's the only game in town. I gave it a shot, ordering takeout once. Service was terrible, and I vowed never to return. But, I did. I ordered the Torta del Barrio, expecting a quick, satisfying meal. It took 35 minutes, and the fries were soggy, the bread stale. Not worth the $13 price tag. The restaurant was packed, pumping out dishes every 10 minutes. Most tables waited longer than I did. When you're flying out, you need a quick bite. Their service was inexcusable. The cashier shrugged it off with a sorry, and that was it. If you're serving food at an airport, that kind of service won't cut it. I'd have settled for fast food at the time."

We shoulda gotten zero stars, 'cause we walked in and waited for a table for 15 goddamn minutes. The workers saw us, but they didn't even bother comin' over. Finally, we went up to the waiter and asked him what the hell was goin' on. He told us he'd seat us soon as he could, but we knew he was full of crap. We shoulda just left right then and there, but we decided to give 'em the benefit of the doubt. Big mistake.

"Chicken sandwich was a disappointment. Skimpy on meat, too much bread. Not worth the seven bucks. Son's burger was decent, though. Cashier, young girl, handled our cash and filled to-go cups with sauce. No gloves, dirty money, disgusting."
"Espresso at this joint? Sour as hell. They claim they don't use old beans, but my taste buds say otherwise. Avoid."

The crowd crammed into the tiny space like sardines in a can. The line for drinks dragged on forever. 

We decided to switch to the main pool, where staff took our orders and delivered them directly to us. A much better experience.
"Service was slow, took 45 minutes for grub. Food wasn't great, lettuce wrap was subpar. Won't be comin' back."
"Portions were tiny, flavorless. Not worth the price. Sodas served in a can. Better options in SoCal."

"KFC's grub trumps your chicken 'n waffles, no contest.  Batter-tasting bird, where's the flavor?  You serve enough for a small nation, let's donate leftovers to feed the hungry, end world hunger, yay!"

"Methinks my husband and I have dined at this place since its opening day,
And every time we've ordered enchiladas, paying extra, by the way.
The beef enchiladas, alas, had naught but a few bits of meat,
Whilst the chicken one, though slightly better, did not quite meet our treat.
The tortillas were doughy and tasteless, like lumps of lead,
And in the middle, there were cold spots, a most unpleasant dread.
We paid a pretty penny, thirty-seven bucks, I do declare,
But the service was just average, nothing to write home about, I fear.
So, we shall not return, forsooth, to this establishment again,
For our taste buds deserve better, and our purses, a wiser gain."

"Hark! I rushed to Yolanda's tanning den,
After work, with haste, I did attend.
But lo! The salon was closed, alack!
Despite the sign, which did declare,
It should be open till eight o'clock,
I found it shut, my hopes did mock.

I've spent my coins on tanning packs,
But now, my booty doth feel quite slack.
For naught but disappointment did I find,
At Yolanda's, where I hoped to shine.
So now, I shall seek elsewhere,
A place more true, where I may glow with ease."

"Hark, what news is this? A review of Sunrise Cafe,
A place where breakfast dreams are made, they say.
Mike P and Ashley D, two hungry souls,
Did venture forth, their hunger to assuage.

Alas, the cafe was full, but fear not,
For in short time, a table was found.
The atmosphere was lively, full of cheer,
And coffee, fresh, though not the best, 'twain true.

The menu, a curious sight, indeed,
Offered omelets, but in limited breed.
Egg white versions, for the health-conscious mind,
Were available, and one such, I did find.

My omelet, Eggzilla, a tasty treat,
With spinach, peppers, salsa, and cheese so neat.
But alas, poor Ashley, her omelet, a disappointment,
A shame, for the price, a decent arrangement.

In conclusion, Sunrise Cafe, a decent spot,
But for the price, elsewhere, you may find a better plot."
"Waterloo's Burrito Boyz didn't quite measure up to the ones in Mississauga and Toronto. Maybe it was the newness that made it taste less flavorful. But still, it fell short of expectations."
"Pulled chicken on country bread, not bad. Pork sandwich, not great either. Saucy meat, weak flavor. Counter guy, friendly. Newbie help, appreciated. Food? Meh."

"Methinks my comrade and I didst long to visit this place, yet alas, our expectations were sorely dashed. The tables, in sooth, didst lack a certain je ne sais quoi, and the decor, in general, didst not hang together well. The drinks, too, didst fail to impress, the bloody mary being the worst I've had the misfortune to taste. Our repast, the eggs Oscar, didst suffer from cold asparagus and a hollandaise sauce that was overly thick. Our server, Kristopher, didst seem to be in a foul humor, and his gruff demeanor didst put us off from the start. Mayhap a smile wouldst have helped, I do declare. In conclusion, we were not impressed, and mayhap we shall return anon, solely for the ale."

"Walking downtown, we stumbled upon this joint. Surrounded by businesses, we thought it'd be a quick lunch. Boy, were we wrong. They seated us fast and took our order, but then we waited...and waited...\n\nFinally, the food came out. Mediocre, at best. The Cajun Chicken sandwich was a chicken breast with a sprinkle of paprika. Tasted like cardboard, the roll was hard. Served dry, with tomato and lettuce if you wanted. The curly fries were decent, considering the sandwich. Took forever to pay the bill. The staff kept walking around, complaining about being short-staffed and how their last table didn't leave enough tip. I get it, it's frustrating, but in front of other patrons? A bit...off."

"The optometrist, he gave me a benefit statement, said it was legit, but the numbers were off. I checked my plan, it was significantly higher. Went back, told him he miscalculated, he said they're out-of-network, but they charge lower prices. Not cool. Went to West Valley Vision, got my full benefit, and their prices were better for contacts. Don't like being lied to."

"Hark! A pitcher of sangria for $36 doth seem a steep price to pay. And lo, the waiter's words didst flow like a river in springtime, making it most difficult to comprehend his every utterance. His suggestions, too, didst miss the mark, I fear. Forsooth, a prix fixe of $50 per person, or paella and tapas aplenty, didst not sit well with mine own sensibilities. Nay, I shall pay but $20 for a paella to share amongst us all, and tapas individual for each. 'Tis a bargain, methinks. And thus, the waiter didst protest, saying the paella doth serve but one. Pshaw! I shall be the judge of that, quoth I. And so, the dish didst arrive, a mighty skillet filled with rice, shrimp five, mussels six, clams six, chicken and sausage besides. Verily, we four couldst not devour it all, no, not even close. Alas, 'twas not an enriching experience, by my troth."
"Tried a new spot, not my usual joint. Pricey, fifty percent more than the place down the road. Service? Subpar. Pedi? A disaster. Nail tech? Distracted. Won't be back."
"Went there late at night with friends, couple weeks back. Service was poor. Had to flag down servers, plural, since they kept takin' breaks and switchin' out. Pizza was alright, wings were fine."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from Blondies, where we didst celebrate the eve of the new year. A bartender, with fingers loose and wild, didst charge us for another's bill, a sum of $138.00, and on top of our own cost, most dear. Our eyes didst not espy this mistake, till two days passed, when we didst check our account with care. My husband, with words of ire, didst speak to the manager, who didst promise a refund, with haste. But lo! A warning to all, for this mistake doth seem a common thing, and we, with fortunes fair, didst escape the snare. So let this be a lesson, to all who doth frequent this place, to watch thy purse, with diligence and grace."

"A club, methinks, doth need three things to thrive:
Music, a lively crowd, and drinks that do arrive.
Whiskey, a place of note, doth play fair tunes,
Some days better than others, as the DJ doth croon.
The crowd, though, doth leave much to be desired,
Yet, with friends of good cheer, 'twill be quite fired.
Drinks, decently priced, doth flow in abundance,
In this spacious hall, where revelry doth dance.
So gather, friends, and make merry, forsooth,
And at Whiskey, thou shalt have a jolly troth."

"Hark! A new coffee shop have I tried this morn,
Wherein I did order hazelnut latte, so bright.
The service, kind; all seemed well, till I sipped,
And lo! The brew, burnt, did make my drink quite vile.
A bitter mess, it was, and naught but woe,
For four silver coins, I didst pay, and now,
Must toss it aside, and seek a new place,
To find a drink, worth the cost, and not disgrace."

"Canaletto, back in the early 2000s, was a joint I spent a lot of time in. But, this past week, it didn't quite live up to my memories. The grub was real good, ten years ago, authentic and looked great. But, now? It's passable, at best. My crew of five, we all agreed, it wasn't anything special. \n\nIt's still a decent spot, Canaletto, with its outdoor seating in the Venetian's version of Saint Mark's Square. But, there's better chow in Vegas, so I can't really give it a thumbs up no more."

"Hark! What's this? A fast food place with rave reviews, they say,
But my own experience was naught but mediocre, I pray thee,
Alack! I should have known better than to order seafood,
At such an establishment, but the picture did deceive me,
A volcano-blackened mahi, they called it, full of salt,
I had to scrape it off, the fish beneath was but a faint,
Freshness, not of the ocean, but of Arizona's land,
I laughed and said, 'tis OK, but not quite as planned.

The veggies, they were stir-fried, not steamed as I thought,
They were passable, but not the best, I must be brought,
And the mango cheesecake, oh how it did disappoint,
Just plain old cheesecake, with a mere thimbleful of mango juice, feigning sweetness, alack!

I would return, but with lowered expectations, ere I dine,
Forsooth, a lesson learned, to not believe all that doth shine."

"Alas, my friends, how poorly doth this establishment fare! A quarter hour didst we wait, for what should be swift victuals, alack! And when at last our meals didst arrive, oh woe! The flavors were most vile and lacking in zest. Methinks 'twould be wise for them to reassess their bill of fare, and with haste, ere they lose all custom. Forsooth, fair patrons will forgive a tardy feast, provided 'tis of high quality. But here, alas, doth lie a sorry tale of twofold failure."

"Two stars for ambiance, alas, I cannot give more, my dear.

He who wouldst know how a Caipirinha with white sugar tastes, is best advised to tarry here. Moreover, one needs much time, the service is unfriendly and inattentive.

To reserve a table, one must first pay a high minimum drink order per head, elsewise, no reservation shall be had.

Hark! Karlsruhe has a rival establishment, with the same flair but better cocktails and friendly service. 'Tis a pity, P10, that thou art not as keen!"

"Underwhelmed, that's how I felt after biting into the turkey sandwich at Canter's in Vegas. For $15, I expected more than a dry, flavorless bird on wheat bread. Fries were mediocre too. The only saving grace was the dijon mustard. Had a bite of someone else's pastrami, now that was decent. But overall, disappointment reigned. Maybe my taste buds were still recovering from the previous night's shenanigans. I'll give the real Canter's in LA a shot, hoping for a better experience. This one? No thanks."
"Update? Please. This joint's seen better days, back when the mob ran Vegas. Smells like grandpa's attic, too. Staff's friendly, but the building's a dump. No wonder it's cheap."

"Hark! I dwell but a stone's throw from SMG,
A convenience most fortuitous, methinks.
Yet, alas! Two grievances doth trouble me,
And mar the joy that otherwise would be.

The first, their victuals. Fie upon them!
Five dishes have I sampled, and all were woeful.
O'ercooked and swimming in grease, they be.

The second, their seating. Pray, let it be known,
I'd rather sit in a theatre's standard chair,
That doth recline, than those cumbersome seats,
So bulky and uncomfortable, they do impair."

"Food's good, but menu's a mess. 'All you can eat' ain't all you can eat. Loopholes everywhere, limiting choices. Dessert's one per person, but it's not stated. Some items are dinner-only, but it's not mentioned. Won't be back."

"Circus Circus, a joint that'll leave you feeling like you've been hit by a truck. Check-in's a real chore, staff's as friendly as a wet cat. Place smells like old smoke and stale beer, but hey, that's part of the charm, right? Rooms are basic, like a cheap motel. Don't expect luxury, but they're clean enough. Steakhouse is decent, but overpriced. Buffet's a no-go, unless you're into mediocre grub. If you're on a tight budget, it'll do. But let's be real, there's better options in Vegas."

"Coop's show at Planet Hollywood's got some issues. It's a mix of impersonations, dance numbers, and comedy, but it don't flow right. Coop does a good job, but the audience plants are way too obvious. They laugh too loud and at everything, which tells me the show ain't that great. If they knew their audience, they could fix this mess and make it something special. Instead, they're tryin' to please everyone and endin' up with nothin'. Check it out for yourself, but don't say I didn't warn you."

"Pros:

* Ambiance is pleasant
* Rooms are spacious
* View is nice
* Equipment is fancy
* Beds are soft

Cons:

* Service is poor/rude
* WiFi is unreliable
* Showers are extreme (either hot or cold)
* Lighting is poor
* Expensive
* Balcony is blocked off (like we're 3 years old)
* Room smells bad

Overall, there are better options in Vegas with better service, amenities, and value for the price."

"Alas, this place doth not meet my expectations.
The victuals, indeed, are quite delectable,
And those who prepare them, skilled in their art.
But alack, the servers, ignorant of their fare,
Do puzzle me with questions they cannot answer.
Aye, 'tis a health kitchen, and yet, they know not
What squash doth lie within their signature dish.
Nor can they say if oil or sugar doth reside
In sauces that adorn their plates. Alas, poor souls,
Their lack of knowledge doth cause much frustration.
I fear to partake of their most savory dishes,
Lest they contain some ingredient I must avoid.
Twice now, I've visited, and twice, the same lass
Hath failed to aid me in my quest for knowledge.
Oh, wouldst they couldst be more learned in their craft!"

"Methinks my love and I didst espy yon Waffles Cafe, and thus didst we decide to partake of their victuals. I knew full well, from perusing the reviews, that we should expect naught but paper plates and plastic cutlery. 

The fare didst take its sweet time in arriving, and we were forced to fetch our own coffee and water. I didst order the chocolate waffle, with strawberries and banana slices upon it, yet alas, 'twas but a mediocre repast. The plastic knife didst make short work of cutting my waffle, but verily, the flavor of chocolate was nowhere to be found within the batter. My love didst order a breakfast combo, consisting of a waffle with peanut butter and chocolate sauce, accompanied by eggs and bacon. Alas, the bacon didst taste as though it had been cooked in used oil from the Chinese establishment next door, a most disgusting prospect. His waffle was passable, but the eggs didst not meet with his approval. 

But lo, the most foul aspect of our meal didst come when my love didst attempt to season his food with salt and pepper. He didst pick up the shakers, and they didst stick to his fingers, covered in syrup and other unsavory substances. 

We didst discard the punch card given to us, and shall henceforth make our waffles at home, where the fare is fresher, and the utensils are cleaner."

"Methinks I've visited this McDonald's ere now,
But today, alack, my rating doth suffer, how?
Forsooth, the place did swarm with flies, anon,
In such abundance that our meal did lose its charm.
This McDonald's, situate in fair surround,
Doth boast an interior most elegant and fine,
A veritable gem, and the staff, full of grace.
But lo, on this day, the flies did mar the place,
And made our feast most unsanitary, alas!
I pray, when next I visit, all shall be well,
And naught but joy shall fill the atmosphere."

"Love turned sour at Parlor last year. Recent visit proved it. Lunch with the missus, empty joint, hostess ignored us five minutes. Serverless, we waited ten. Eye contact, friendly waves, nothing. Left without a fuss. Love lost."

"A quarter hour, they say, for a draught to pour,
And twenty-two, for a drink of spiced wine.
But lo, a chicken dish, with roast beside,
Did take seventy minutes, or so did tell the time.
The wait, indeed, was quite absurd,
For all I asked, though crowded, still they stirred.
Fried pickles, salty as the sea, did taste,
Chipotle chicken, decent, yet not worth the haste.
Fries, too salty, scarce could be consumed,
And Chix quesadilla, small, yet somewhat assumed.
Margarita, priced high, did make me wince,
Yet still, the tavern's fare, did somewhat convince."

"Been a TP fan since opening day. But last visit, they told me they needed a credit card up front for lunch. Don't sit right with me. Few skips out on the bill, ain't no reason to treat all customers like crooks. Other joints around here don't pull this crap. Good lookin' waitresses and grub ain't worth it. Won't be back."
"Valentine's Day special sounded good, but it was a joke.  Food was poor quality, overpriced.  Used to be good here, but not recently.  Not worth it."

"Poolside, I sipped on WELL vodka and diet coke, enjoying the sun and scene. But when I asked for the bill, my smile soured. Fifteen bucks for two drinks? Pricey, but I could swallow it. Then, we took two shots of fireball. Cheap stuff, right? Wrong. Sixteen bucks! Other bars give it away for free. Bullshit. Not worth it."

"Methinks 'twas but a single time I didst venture into this Zizzi, and verily, all aspects of the place didst seem most ordinary. My comrade and I didst decide to partake in a two-for-one offer, which didst prompt our visit. Upon arriving at the eatery, we didst encounter a considerable delay in being seated, due to the multitude of office workers who didst occupy the tables. The establishment didst appear clean, yet there was a certain unpleasantness about it, much like a McDonald's. Our repast was rather unremarkable; I didst consume a pizza, fresh from the oven, yet it couldst have easily been mistaken for one of Tesco's finest offerings. My companion didst opt for a seafood pasta, which didst lack a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of seafood. The service was adequate, though not particularly expedient or cordial. I fear I shan't be returning."
"The hotel's size didn't match its quality. Big, but lacking. Service, too. Not worth more than three stars. For a real treat, hit up Mirage's buffet. Now that's a smart spend."
"Atmosphere, cool. Soup, cold and bland. Meatballs, dried out, flavorless. Another try, upstairs opens. For now, pass."

"Alas, my friends, the rice didst lack moisture,
The service, slow, and at best, a trifle.
The price, oh how it didst climb to great heights,
For sushi, far better, Albertsons doth provide,
And at a cost, a fraction of the sum,
I pray thee, let us not return anon."

"Sin City's got nothin' but frustration and a whole lotta shit. Don't waste your hard-earned cash here, pal. People got their heads up their own asses, can't even help a fella out with a simple question. Elevators take forever, packed tighter than a whore's schedule. Skinny bitches give you the side-eye, shovin' their bony asses against you like they own the place. 

But hey, the tiki bar wasn't half bad. Met a wild bunch, Americans and Brits alike, even a Castro lookalike. Most of 'em didn't know squat about Cinco de Mayo. So, in honor of the English bloke, we raised a glass to ol' Sanchez - Dirty Sanchez, that is. 

That's worth a second star, if you ask me."

"Hark! What's this? A Yuzu special, they call it.
A platter of many dishes, small in portion,
But diverse in taste and form, a wondrous sight.
Yet, alas, my heart doth sink, for all its worth,
The price, it doth seem steep, for what it's worth.
My mother, bless her soul, a better cook,
Than these pretenders, with their meager book.
For those who seek true Japanese delight,
Look elsewhere, friends, for this place doth not excite."

"No good. Had a decent cut here once, but that was it. Went back today, thinking they'd be open. Called at 3:45, guy said I had till 5. Got there at 4:10, he tells me they're closed. I remind him I'm the one who called, he just shrugs and points to the clock. Not worth the risk. Sketchy place in mid-city gives better cuts, better service, and cheaper too."

"A pox upon that varlet John Cowan,
Whose words were lies, and actions, woe.
He sought to cheat us, and my wife didst feel
Discomfort, which didst cause him to raise his voice and keen.
His manner was rude, and he didst treat us like fools,
Boasting of his sales prowess, as if 'twere a prize.
But, lo, the manager didst intervene,
And offered us a better deal, with free oil changes, by the by.
So, two stars, I give, for their efforts,
Though, truth be told, we were not impressed, by their shenanigans."

"Never seen a male revue? You might think this show's good. It's not. Amateur hour. Sloppy. Sure, the bodies are great, but only two of 'em have decent faces. Can't dance either. Same old moves for every song. Most of the time, it's just one guy dancing while the rest sit around doing nothing. Lazy. Some "OMG" moments, sure, but not worth $20, let alone $36 from the half-price ticket booth. Seen better at Chippendales."

"Alas, poor World Market! I didst enter thy hallowed halls seeking the fabled "Hobbit" line of brews, a gift for my love on New Year's Eve. A kindly shopkeeper, with a heart full of cheer, didst assist me in my quest, alas, to no avail. Forsooth, the store had not received a shipment of the fine ale, or perchance, it doth not exist. Yet, lo and behold! I didst discover, via the mystic internet, that a World Market on Camelback doth carry the elusive brew. Fie upon thee, fate! Why art thou so cruel? I might have purchased it that eve, and savored its rich flavor, but alas, 'twas not meant to be."

"Fair warning, good sir or madam, avoid the taco salad at all costs! 'Tis a dish of excess, with far too much guacamole and sour cream, making it quite vapid. Verily, a mess it doth make. The service, however, is friendly and the atmosphere of this quaint neighborhood establishment is most pleasing, yet alas, the victuals do leave much to be desired."

"Room 514. Sleep-number bed busted. Felt like a hammock by the time I finally dozed off. Liked the room's layout though - headboard against the bathroom wall, curved desk/dresser setup was different. But they didn't restock the place well after the first night. No fresh coffee supplies or clean glasses and mugs. Asked for no feather pillows at check-in, but they gave me floppy ones instead. Like, the kind you gotta wad up into a ball. And get this - no taxis. Ever. Had to call one for me. Waited 15 minutes. Not terrible, but not great either."

"Hark, what woe is this? A feast of Enchiladas, 
With adobada meat, so foul and vile,
Didst make mine stomach churn and turn.
The server, kind and gentle, didst smile,
But left me waiting, still and all the while,
For refill, which didst never come, alack!
My dinner, horrid and most dire,
Didst leave me wroth and full of ire.
Arribas, a place of Mexican fare,
Doth sell, methinks, but NASTY, nay."

"Taxi would've been the way to go. Shuttle takes its sweet time fillin' up at the airport. Sat there for half an hour, sweatin' bullets. Lucky for us, the first stop was our hotel, The Venetian. Bought a round trip ticket, but the pick-up at the hotel was a real nail-biter. They were 45 minutes late, and we damn near missed our flight. Called 'em four times, and all we got was 'it's five minutes away.' Other folks on the shuttle said they were sittin' at the Palazzo for half an hour before they finally picked us up. Not worth the aggravation. Spend a little extra for a reliable service. You're in Vegas, for cryin' out loud—you're gonna spend money anyway. Lesson learned."

"Beware, dear friends, of this eatery's fare,
Lest ye wish to taste naught but despair.
'Tis a place of no repute, a den of woe,
Where culinary dreams go to meet their doom.

The fry bread, once a noble dish, now lies
Flat and lifeless, devoid of all surprise.
Like a chalupa tortilla, it doth seem,
But thicker, staler, and far from serene.

The meat, oh how it doth pale in comparison,
To that found in a grocery store's cold dimension.
'Tis pre-made, pre-cooked, and lacking zest,
A flavorless concoction, at best.

Within the restaurant, disarray doth reign,
The kitchen, a mess, like a tempest's bane.
The staff, though polite, doth seem disheveled,
Their efforts, alas, in vain, forever concealed.

And thus, dear friends, I urge thee, flee,
From this place of woe, of misery.
For in its depths, there lies naught but despair,
A culinary nightmare, beyond compare."

"Fie upon this wretched service, foul and slow! 

We came at noon, a Thursday, and found but two tables seated nigh. Our busser brought waters and iced tea with haste, yet our server didst tarry, ten minutes passed ere he took our order in hand. 

A Greek salad came forthwith, fair and fresh, but lo, the other twain didst receive their pies ere we had finished our repast. And thus we waited, twenty minutes more, forsooth, ere our server didst return with news of woe. A computer malfunction, he didst say, and our pies would come anon, within ten minutes' space. 

Alas, the pizza was good, a saving grace, yet shall I ne'er return, such service doth disgrace this place."

"In sooth, my appetite didst wax not for a spread of victuals,
So past the Excalibur's feast, I didst proceed,
To seek a place where cooked-to-order dishes were sold.
My hunger didst soon abate, for swiftly came my meal,
But from a warming tray, I fear, didst most of it reveal.
The eggs were watery, corned beef hash, dry and old,
The potatoes, but a portion could my stomach hold.
The toast, though wrapped in basket, cold didst remain,
E'en when it first arrived, the butter could not gain.
The orange juice, a bright spot, didst please mine taste,
And decaf, though not great, didst satisfy, in haste.
The service, friendly and kind, didst make amends,
For chairs, though soft, didst lack support, methinks, my friends.
All told, the cost, five silver pieces more, didst seem,
A price too steep, for buffet's equal, didst gleam."
"Place needs work. Service poor. Cleanliness lacking. Not a good spot for gambling."

"Tried three times on weekends, never in top shape. Maybe puked in the parking lot once. Sorry. But on a sunny Thursday morning, got in no problem. 
Usually, the fuss is outside. Shade now, Jane L. Makes sense, summer's over. Duh. Screaming tots, go go. Tiny place. Why bring spawn here? IHOP has balloon animals. Anchor-shaped balloon matching your tattoo-inspired tee? 
Choices are slim, portions large, grease abundant. Like grease, but like it dripping from my burrito at 4 am. Feels dirty. Had oats, surprisingly grease-free. Partner had cheese omelette. Ordered home fries, rosemary's been complained about. Mine had rosemary, looked accidental. Bland, boring. Entire experience, bland and boring. Don't see the fuss. Good, yes, but breakfast...how hard can it be?"

"Sat down quick, ordered fast. Asked for #90, got #19. Waited, waited, server never came back. Dealt with it, ate my food. Sister pointed out roach next to my feet. She tried to tell someone, they hesitated, so she got up, killed it herself. Finally got the check, paid, left. Food's good, but service and atmosphere make it hard to want to return. Two stars for the cooks."
"I arrived, waited ten minutes. Grabbed a menu, asked an employee if I should seat myself. He said sure thing, then kept walking."

"Service was decent. Got my salad, but no dressing. Waited ten minutes, still no dressing. Finally got it, tasted funny - too salty. Put it on anyway. Hubby didn't like his food either. Been there before, enjoyed it. Not this time. Won't be back."

"Staff's friendly, but stretched thin. Good luck gettin' their attention. Line moves quick, but food takes its sweet time. Quality ain't exactly worth the price. Tacos cost eight bucks, but they ain't no eight-buck tacos. Food's cold, margaritas too sweet and flavorless. If you wanna overpay for mediocre grub 'cause you wanna support local, this is your spot."

"I've sent many a friend and colleague to this joint. Twice a week, I'd grab takeout from here myself. Sure, they might be a bit slow sometimes, but the grub's always been fresh and delicious. That is, until today. Ordered the 2 roll lunch special and a dynamite roll. Started chowing down on that dynamite roll, when suddenly - BAM! - a sharp piece of wire in one of the pieces. Cut my tongue and jabbed a hole in my gums. Not going back. One thing to have an off night with the food, but safety issues? No excuse."

"Las Vegas, where gourmet buffets reign supreme. Latest contender? The Bayside Buffet at Mandalay Bay. Problem is, it's showing its age. Food's not bad, service is decent, but the hotel's high-end vibe sets expectations the buffet can't meet. Time for a revamp, or tables will stay empty."

The restaurant's got a real friendly vibe, and I dig the unique Ome-like design. But let me tell you, the grub and joe ain't worth a damn. And if you hit up the drive-thru, you're in for a long wait. They might even tell you to pull up and chill while they bring your food out. Just not impressed with the mediocrity.

"Brunch at this joint on Homecoming weekend? Big mistake. Service was slow, real slow. Took 'em over an hour to bring out two breakfast plates. Didn't even bother with drinks, but folks seemed to enjoy 'em. Ordered huevos rancheros with chorizo, thought it was a safe bet. But no, they still managed to screw it up. Eggs were too salty, presentation was meh. Won't be comin' back."

"We hit up The Spot for lunch, and it was just alright. Kinda like a short-order joint. 

Had the Spot sandwich - plain chicken, nothing special - and a chicken salad. Best part was the tiny apple cinnamon bread slice that came with it. Other than that, it was just a basic salad with some turkey, ham, and walnuts. 

Seating was uncomfy, and they got like two tables inside downstairs and one upstairs. Not great for summer in AZ. Ended up outside. Misters helped a bit, but still disappointing they don't have more indoor seats. 

Dessert case looked decent, but not worth coming back for. Doubt we'll be back."

"Hark, what news is this? A small blizzard for $3.79? Fie upon it, 'tis a jest indeed! 

I laughed with glee when I beheld its puny size, as I collected it from the drive-thru with haste. Forsooth, 'twas been an age since last I savored such a treat. 

Alack, I shall not partake in such indulgence anon. (And verily, 'tis a blessing in disguise.)"

"Stopped by on a whim, nearby. Underwhelmed by the grub. Joint's got a lively vibe, though - almost too much. Fish tank was a highlight, I'll give 'em that. Smallish portions, skimpy on noodles. Broccoli was plentiful, Thai BBQ chicken alright. Garlic chicken, who knows? Maybe our waiter goofed the order. Deep-fried bird with sweet chili sauce, whatever they called it. Service dragged, too. Twenty minutes for hot water and lemon? Meh, underwhelmed."

"Hark, what news is this? A show most fair,
With Frank Caliendo, a man of wit and cheer.
Two couples, eager for a night of mirth,
Didst arrive early, seeking seats of worth.

But lo, the Improve, with policies most strange,
Didst demand we spend $60.00, or else remain
In seats of little worth, with views most dim.
A promotion, it seemed, of DUI's within.

Disappointment filled our hearts, I do confess,
For such a policy, most unjust and mess.
The Improve, once dear, now doth estrange,
And we, with sadness, didst depart, with naught but change."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from Tropicana's halls,
Where cinematic dreams doth turn to bitter gall.
A paltry sum of gold doth gain thee entry, fair,
But, alas! The crowd doth swell, and tempers fray.

Within the theatre's walls, a scene doth play,
Of folk who know not how to pass the day.
Their phones they doth hold dear, and loud they doth speak,
As if the world doth revolve around their every seek.

And lo! The children, dear, they doth cry and shout,
In scenes of violence and of language devout.
Their parents, lost in thought, doth let them roam,
As if the theatre doth be their own home.

Oh, for a seat of comfort and some peace of mind,
I'd pay the price, and leave the rabble behind.
For though the cost doth seem quite low,
'Tis worth it, sir, to avoid the row."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from me,
Concerning conference rooms, so stuffy and humid,
In temp'ral control, a sorry state, it be.
And coffee, oh, how vile and poor the brew,
A travesty, indeed, for one to endure.
Nor can I speak of rooms, forsooth,
For none have I beheld, save those for meetings,
So dank and close, they did my spirits dampen.
Alas, a sorry lot, this conference place,
Yet still, I pray, our gatherings may find grace."

"Hark, what news is this? My journey done,
I sought to feast on Paymon's fare,
But lo, they do not take orders past nine,
My hunger doth remain unfulfilled, alas."

"Restaurant had been praised, so I took three guests for dinner. Food was mediocre - 22 oz rib eye steak, 50% fat and bones, undercooked. Scallops, just okay. Fries and veggies, barely warm. Waitress, very good. Compensated a bit for the food."

"I tried this joint for the first time, excited to see what it had to offer. The grub was top-notch, but the service was a mess. Hostess kept seating folks at dirty tables, and the servers were clueless about which orders went to which tables. Took 'em 30 minutes to bring us our breakfast. If they got their act together, it could be a decent spot. But with so many other places in town serving up good food and friendly service, I won't be back."

"Our previous sojourn at this inn was most pleasant, some three years past. But alas, this time our chamber key didst not function properly, and we were forced to replace it twice. Moreover, the housemaids didst not secure our door fully upon their departure, leaving us vulnerable to the whims of nocturnal revelers. We were roused from slumber on three occasions by the boisterous chatter of guests in the hall betwixt two and six o'clock in the morning. Our neighbor, a lady of discerning taste, didst also express her displeasure at the commotion. On one fateful night, a stranger didst essay to force open our door with his card key, until my spouse didst intervene with a stern admonition. Alas, we shall not be returning to this hostelry again."

"Hark! What's this? A dish of chicken Korma, foul and rank,
Tasteth like rubber ducky, oh so bland and weak.
Gravy, not cream or cashew, doth it claim to be,
But nay, 'tis thick and loathsome, fit for none to see.

I prayed for white meat only, and the waitress didst frown,
But granted my request, with a scowl and a sigh.
Yet lo, the chicken, undercooked and old, didst taste,
Like a bird long past its prime, with flavor quite waste.

And the chicken tikka masala, oh how it didst stink,
Like tomato sauce turned rancid, with a putrid blink.
The rice, too, was dry, and crackled beneath my teeth,
While the naan, alas, was burnt, with nary a bite to eat.

The place itself, akin to the Bates Motel, didst seem,
Grimy and foul, with an air of gloom and despair.
The service, slow and listless, didst add to my woe,
As I waited, and waited, for my meal to arrive, oh so.

And the water, alack, didst taste of fish,
A strange and unpleasant flavor, I didst wish.
Friday night, and empty, the restaurant didst lie,
Eerie and deserted, with nary a soul to spy.

Yuck, quoth I, and vowed never to return,
For the price, too high, and the quality, too stern.
Away, away, to a better place, I didst flee,
Leaving behind, this den of culinary misery."
"High hopes for this park, read rave reviews on Yelp.  Ended up a letdown, trash and broken glass everywhere.  Graffiti too.  More worried about cutting my foot than a snake surprising me."

"Papa John's, usually top-notch service. Not this time. Order botched, delivery gal tossed grub at us, then split. Called 'em up, rude chick on phone. Put me on hold, came back, said she couldn't do squat. Manager same, clueless. Maybe send the driver back? Apologize? Nada. Hope they shape up. Pizza's good, vegan too. Don't wanna stop ordering."

"Yi's got some issues. Used to like the place, but now? No way. Brought in a bathing suit, brand spankin' new, for tailoring. Gift, mind you. Eight hundred bucks. Tags still on, just some loose threads. Go back today, tags are gone. Explain to the guy, woman behind the counter speaks better English, two tags, barcode and thread holder. He blames me, says I musta taken 'em off. Ridiculous. Was gonna sell it on eBay, never touched those tags. Won't be goin' back. Business elsewhere. Two stars 'cause the tailorin' was good. Losin' my tags and blamin' me? Unacceptable."
"Good grub, damn fine rice. Shame we both got sick as dogs when we got back. Pepto B did the trick."

PROS:
A clean hotel, with lobby fair and bright,
Great customer service, staff pleasant and kind.
Free breakfast buffet, wifi, gym, pool in sight,
Beds comfortable, non-smoking, a delight.

CONS:
Far from the strip, a trek to behold,
Parking in another casino, troubles to unfold.
Nearby, nothing to see, nowhere to stroll,
Convention center and LVH, that's the whole.
IKEA-like decor, cheap ambiance, alack,
No glitz, no fancy, a letdown, that's a fact.

Would I stay here again? Nay, I say,
The strip's call, I cannot resist,
Freedom to roam, my heart doth sway,
Vegas' vibe, I cannot miss, come what may.

"Coffee here used to be top-notch. Imported and roasted their own beans, I reckon. Now it's some outfit from Ithaca, New York. Just okay, if you ask me. And don't even get me started on the price. Pecan pie, tiny as can be, cost me six bucks. Menu said it should've been cheaper. I complained, but the barista didn't give a damn."

"A pox upon this wretched place, where salesmen be rude and uncouth! My love and I didst enter, seeking a carriage of speed, for mine own had met its demise and I didst ride in a borrowed steed. We were to meet with Luke, a man of words, but alas, he didst take another engagement, leaving us to fend for ourselves with a surly salesman, whose manner didst reek of disdain. His gruff demeanor didst make us feel most unwelcome, and thus, we didst depart, our business unfinished. Good sirs, attend to thy customer's needs, lest thou lose their trust and coin!"

"I went to Red Velvet Cafe, hoping to be impressed. But, sadly, I wasn't. As a vegan, I look for places with vegan options. Red Velvet had a mix of vegan, vegetarian, and non-vegan dishes. Sounds good, right? Wrong. They just took the meat off and added vegan substitutes. Boring. I got the flatbread with pesto and hummus, vegan style. They used vegan cheese instead of parmesan. No flavor. The pesto was bland and looked like it came from a jar. Same with the hummus. It was processed and not homemade. They put it on pesto flatbread with an ice cream scoop. Not pretty. The sangria sparkling tea was good, though. Tasty, with fruit floating in it. But, $5.50 a glass and no refills? Steep. Too bad. Sticking with my usual vegan spot in Las Vegas."

"I checked in Tuesday for three nights. They upgraded me to a seventh-floor suite, but it was sweltering hot. Took forever to cool the place down. That night, some idiot started beeping a bulldozer at 4 AM. Couldn't sleep, so I hit the gym. What a joke. I asked for an upgrade and a high floor beforehand, but they ignored me. Moved my stuff to the fifteenth floor Wednesday afternoon. No more construction noise. Management, are you paying attention? This is how you treat your Premier Platinum Elite members? Disappointing."

"Hark, since Sunday have I been confined,
In this conference hall, with facilities fine.
Beds, alas, not as soft as they should be,
A maid service, poor, that doth not impress me.
Hyatt, thou dost try to save a few coins,
By leaving soap and such unfilled, I suppose.
Beds, a mess, with sheets that do not fit,
And staff, fair, but not up to my wit.
Forbes training, they must have forgot,
Or management, lacking in its thought.
Bar service, better, yet not divine,
But still, this place doth not meet mine eye.
Expensive, 'tis, and not worth the fee,
For a vacation, destination, 'tis not thee."

"A pox upon this Outback, once a place of cheer,
Now fallen from grace, its former glory lost.
I gave it two stars, for 'tis but mediocre,
My love for it, now turned to bitter frost.

My husband, ever constant in his choice,
Orders a half rack of ribs, his heart's voice.
But lo, the portions, once generous and fair,
