"This joint was something else. The talent was top-notch, and the lap dances? Off the chain, kid. Fully nude, and you could get a feel, too. They had these beds, and if they'd let you drink, it would've been a five-star spot, easy. But the lap dances, that's what made it special."

"A traveler, lost in yonder sands,
Chanced upon this haven,'midst the dunes.
Like Batman's lair, it seemed to be,
In darkness deep, mystery did shroud.

With fumbling steps, I groped my way,
Through shelves of tales, both old and new.
Squinting hard, I scanned each page,
And chose a few, to ease my mind.

Then forth I stepped, into the sun,
My phone, a beacon, lit the path.
For though the night, had claimed this place,
I now was ready, for its embrace."

"Hark! The wondrous creatures of the Biodome,
Penguins, monkeys, and a kapibara, doth roam,
In Canada's land, a sight most fair and bright,
A visit hence, doth merit thy attention tight.

Thou shalt spend ninety minutes, or two hours,
Strolling through ecosystems, in sweetest flowers,
Observing beasts, in freedom, unconfined,
A change from zoos, where they are oft confined.

Beware, dear traveler, of school breaks and weekends,
Lest thou find thyself amidst a throng of mischievous sprites,
Who, in their glee, may block thy view of the penguins,
And mar the peace, that otherwise doth attend thy visitations.

Admission, alas! doth come at a steep cost,
Unless thou art a Quebecer, or a scholar, lost,
Yet, worth the price, the experience doth bestow,
Especially if thou dost combine it with a trip to yonder Botanical Garden, doth grow.

Avoid, I pray thee, the Olympic tower, so grand,
For from Mont Royal's chalet, a better view doth expand,
Free, and a healthy hike, doth await thee, 'tis true,
So heed my words, and save thy coin, anon, do!"

Hark, good sir or madam, listen well,
For I have news of happy hour to tell,
A time when prices drop and cheer doth flow,
At this establishment, 'tis so, don't you know?

From five to eight, and twelve till close,
The deals are sweet, the savings, they do grow,
A steak and side, for half the price,
A bargain, indeed, a wondrous sight,

The atmosphere, within those walls,
Doth evoke the spirit of old Western halls,
A place where cowboys once did gather,
To drink and dine, and share their tales,

And mint julep, oh, how grand,
A drink most potent, fit for any hand,
One glass, and thou shalt feel its might,
So, heed my words, and make it thy sight,

But, gentle patron, take heed of this,
Make haste and reserve a table, ere thou miss,
The happy hour, and pay full price,
A fate most dire, a pennywise's device,

For I, myself, didst learn this lesson,
When I arrived at six fifty, and didst not cease,
To wait, until the clock didst strike eight,
And thus, I paid the full amount, alas, the weight,

So, heed my words, and plan ahead,
For happy hour, it doth await,
With steak and side, and drinks galore,
A time to revel, and a night to score.

"Phoenix Art Museum's restaurant? Top-notch. Great setup, fresh ingredients, friendly staff, and reasonable prices. Best museum restaurant I've been to. Stopped in for drinks and an appetizer between exhibits and was impressed by the quality of the food, warm service, and inviting atmosphere. Looked around and saw delicious-looking sandwiches, mouthwatering crab cakes, and a generous portion of coconut cake. They even named the menu items to match their Hollywood Costume theme. Funny! Will definitely come back hungry next time."

Alas, my friends, I must confess,
I hold a certain fondness for Zipps,
A place wherein I oft did find solace,
During the madness of March's wild rips.

Their doors but newly opened wide,
And though some say the service be poor,
I say, give them a chance, let time abide,
For all new ventures suffer such a sore.

In truth, I've helped to open many a place,
And know full well the trials they face,
But fear not, dear friends, for with grace,
Zipps too shall flourish in its chosen space.

"Upon a morn of Tuesday, 'twas my first visit here,
At ten and thirty, when the crowd doth disappear.
I'd heard this place did bustle with much activity,
Yet, we were seated straightaway, with great celerity.
The atmosphere was loud, yet service was swift,
And coffee, just as I liked it, did my senses lift.
Scrambled eggs with salami, and hash browns beside,
Wheat toast did complete my meal, and left me satisfied.
Home fries I had asked for, but hash browns did come,
Yet, they were so divine, that I didst not bemoan.
Strawberry jam, a delight, did cap my repast,
And thus, I shall return, to partake of their feast."

"Five years hath passed, my visits here each moon,
To seek the skilled hand of yonder tech, anon.
In faith, no other place shall e'er entice me,
For here, my heart doth find its peace and glee."

"This joint serves up the best bacon-covered cinnamon rolls in town. Period. Don't believe me? Ask 'em nice (and throw in a little extra cash) and they'll slap a fried egg on top. Now we're talkin'. It's like a party in your mouth, minus the noise and annoying guests. Just you, the roll, and that runny yolk. Ah, heaven. And don't even get me started on the prices. They ain't the cheapest, but hey, you get what you pay for. So go ahead, treat yourself to a champion's breakfast. Your taste buds (and your belly) will thank you."

"A bottle service, Kaskade, and nurses of the night,
Make me a happy camper, indeed, a delight.
This club, I shall return, 'tis my desire,
But, alas, the bouncers, rude and full of fire.

They guard the aisle, with stern and solemn face,
And shove away, without a moment's grace.
They care not, if a lady, fair and bright,
For they will push, with all their might.

The club, they seek to make, exclusive and rare,
But, in their zeal, they forget, we females fare.
For shoes, they object, in club, hotel, or elevator,
And boot, thy friends, with no tolerance, whatsoever.

Despite these flaws, four stars, I shall bestow,
For music, atmosphere, and artists, in tow."

"By Jove, my roommate didst tell me of this place,
And glad I am that she didst, forsooth.
Kristen and I didst visit RnR one day,
And found it most agreeable, in truth.

The entrance, grand and wide, didst impress,
And though the interior be somewhat small,
It doth not feel cramped, and seats abound,
Outside, where we may watch the people pass.

We didst begin with two apps, pigs in a blanket,
Flaky pastry crust, a childhood delight,
And chicken lollipops, tender, juicy,
Buffalo sauce, oh, how it doth ignite!

A pork sandwich we didst share, with sweet and sour sauce,
Tender pork, a feast for our taste buds, no doubt.
Fries came with it, a bucketful,
A fine repast, at RnR, we didst devour.

Hark, good sirs and madams, heed my words,
RnR, a place most worthy of your visits, 'tis true.
With happy hour, drinks, and atmosphere fair,
You shall not regret it, I do swear."

"Aye, 'tis a place most wondrous, a mall of sorts,
In Las Vegas, where commerce and frivolity consorts.
With stores of little worth, an arcade of delight,
And people-watching, a pastime most pleasant and bright.

Oh, how I do adore the fan, so large and grand,
A decoration for my living space, so bland.
And those knives, so sharp and shiny, a set most fine,
To purchase, a dream of mine, someday, in good time.

But alas, the prices, they do sting,
For all the trinkets and baubles, they do cling.
Yet still, I say, 'tis a place of joy,
To pass the time, and let my spirits employ."

"The Bi-Lo in Matthews, on Fincher Farm lane, has a friendly crew. Managers and sales staff alike, go out of their way to help. Had a slight issue with an item, buy one get one free, but they made good. Refunded my cash, and I kept the goods. Can't complain 'bout that. Wish they had more gourmet picks, like Harris Teeter, but I dig the shopping vibe, and they got good deals on the regular stuff I need. That's why I keep comin' back."

"Fourteen of us did gather round,
For business purposes, we did abound.
A feast fit for kings, the menu did boast,
With Kobe beef and geoduck, at quite the cost.
But fear not, thrifty friends, for 'twas not dear,
Thirty pieces of silver, or so, did appear.
We shared a trio of birds, cooked to perfection,
Our taste buds, they did burst with elation.
Kobe, fried rice, and fish, we did devour,
All dishes, they did please, and that's for sure.
The service, gracious and kind, did shine,
Managers, attentive, kept all in line.
A birthday cake, a surprise, did we bring,
It went off without a hitch, our joy did sing.
Five stars, I do reserve, for the best of the best,
But this place, four stars, it does deserve, no rest.
I would recommend, to all who can hear,
This restaurant, it's worth a visit, have no fear."

"Villa Dolce, a pizza joint in Middleton, Wisconsin, surprised us with its excellence. The crust was top-notch, and the fresh toppings, which we opted for the veggie version, were flavorful. It's a contender for the best upscale pizza in Madison. The gelato? Superb. Rich, creamy, and intense. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and enthusiastic without being too pushy. She gave us spot-on recommendations. The atmosphere was cozy, with outdoor seating for the summer months. A winner, pending further visits."
"Four stars for this joint. Cheap and the pizzas are massive. Basic quality, but nothing to rave about. Service was fine."

"Hark! I didst attend the YAM's grand soiree,  
At the Mint, where art doth reign supreme.  
Their new digs, a sight to behold,  
Modern, spacious, and full of gleam.  
My heart didst sing, my spirit didst soar,  
At the Romare Bearden collection, a treasure trove.  
In days of yore, a YAM I didst call myself,  
And thus, many a night didst I revel in their halls.  
This venue, grander than its predecessor,  
A place where mirth and art do meet and mate.  
Food, drink, and music, all didst delight,  
A truly wondrous evening, pure delight."

"Good eatery. Sat at the bar, service top-notch. Had their Jalape\u00f1o popper burger, date had the Dynamic Duo. Shared the King roll, sushi roll decent size, very flavorful. Couldn't finish our burgers, eager to return, menu options all appealing."

"Halt, good sir! 'Tis a fine place indeed,  
To rest thy weary head and quench thy thirst.  
All seats, save one, are outdoors, I reckon,  
With misters cooling summer's heat, and winter's warmth in burst.  
The barmen, merry souls, pour drinks with glee,  
And victuals, too, are served, as fitting courtesy.  
A biker's haven, some might call it,  
Yet all, from near and far, are welcomed in it."

"A most excellent spot, this tavern be,
For drinks and merriment, 'tis plain to see.
The bar, it doth impress, with its fine selection,
And I, a lover of bars, didst feel quite at home.

The outdoor patio, with fireplaces aglow,
Didst create a warm and welcoming atmosphere, I do declare.
Bocce ball, a game of skill and chance,
Didst provide us with some friendly competition, in sooth.

My husband, dear, and I, didst sit and ponder,
What words of wisdom could we share, in this place so profound?
Trivia cards, a clever find, didst spark our interest,
And we, in jest, didst make a wager, with no ill intent.

The food, oh how divine, didst please our taste,
And the staff, with smiles so bright, didst make our visit quite ace.
This tavern, a gem, didst shine so bright,
A place to meet, and laugh, and dine, with all thy might."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, let this place be thy will,
A sojourn brief, yet filled with wondrous delight.
'Tis one of our most cherished haunts in fair Las Vegas,
Where gastronomic delights doth reign supreme, my friend.

The shops, they do abound with wares most fine and rare,
And sights to see that shall leave thee in awe and wonder.
At least, a visit brief, doth merit thy attention,
For here, thy spirits shall be lifted, and thy heart be lightened.

So, heed my words, good sir or madam, and make haste,
To visit this most wondrous place, and partake of its grace.
For in this city of sin, 'tis a true gem, thou shalt find,
And leave thee not, until thy heart and belly be fully satisfied."
"Bass Pro run, then grub at the hotel. Meat tacos, street tacos, too. Not bad, but Hawaii still reigns supreme. Friendly staff, though. I'll be back."

"Happy hour, great spot. Missin' my ol' 'hood, me and the hubby'd hit this joint, load up on grub and drinks, all under 30 bucks. Fried pickles, best in town. Drafts and wells, reasonable. Bloody marys, top-notch. Cajun rim, ask for it. Service, solid."

"Hark, what news is this? A service slow, yet clean the restaurant doth be. Atmosphere pleasant, food most tasty, hamburger good, impress'd was I. Bread, oh so addicting, more ye shall desire. Pasta, above average, recommend it, I would. Price, a bit steep, yet not by much, fair it doth seem."

"In Mekong's hallowed halls, all was neat and tidy,
No stumbling blocks nor pungent smells did impede my gait.
The live and frozen seafood, a wondrous sight,
Well-organized and labeled, a feast for the eyes.
Prices, fair and low, a bargain, indeed,
Our picky needs, the staff did willingly heed.
A lobster, tilapia, and catfish, we did choose,
Cleaned and bagged, save the lobster, that did we propose.
To Asian Caf\u00e9 Express, our seafood did we take,
Where cooked to perfection, our meal did make.
Agreement between Mekong and ACE, a clever notion,
For a small fee, our seafood, they did prepare with devotion.
A first, this was, and pleasing, I must confess,
An experience worth repeating, I do profess."

"Hark! This cozy cafe doth lie near Museum of Fine Arts,
A place where one may partake of delectable fare,
And sip upon a cup of brew, or perhaps a glass of wine,
In atmosphere most refined, and with service most divine.

The victuals, they were fair, our hunger they didst assuage,
And drinks, they flowed like nectar from the gods above,
The staff, most courteous, didst attend to our each need,
And swiftly, with a smile, our orders they didst heed.

But, alas! The prices, they didst climb a bit higher,
Than other cafes within the city's bounds,
So prepare thyself, dear patron, for the cost,
Lest thou be taken aback, and thy purse be lost.

Yet still, this place doth hold a certain charm,
A haven for the weary soul, and hungry heart,
So if thou find thyself near Museum of Fine Arts,
Do step inside, and taste their culinary arts."

"Alack, poor drive-thru window teller, how thou dost bear the brunt of anger from that tube customer! Yet, still thou doth maintain thy calm and aid me with my deposit. Well done, fair Susan, for thy patience and politeness in the face of ire. May all who encounter thee be gentle and kind."

"Weeknights in Uptown, Picasso's got it right. Laid-back crowd, friendly servers, and a menu that delivers. Their pizza, it's not half bad, not quite a NY slice, but it'll do. Spinach and sun-dried tomato, that's my jam. Wings, they were hot, honey chipotle style, but our bartender, he forgot about 'em. Took forever, but we didn't sweat it, dude was cool, funny too. Big place, lots of space, leather couch, TVs everywhere. Good eatin', good vibes."

"Though I did chip a tooth on bacon, foul mishap,  
The food, a feast for senses, savory and sweet,  
At M hotel's place we dined, my friends, anon."

"Methinks 'twas wondrous service, in an atmosphere most fair,
With victuals of Venezuela, fit for a king's table,
At prices most reasonable, that doth make me sing,
And causes me to ponder, why doth not each innkeeper
Doth share such zeal for his own culinary treasure?
Verily, I do anticipate my next visit with glee."
"Bouchon for dinner. Chicken, amazing. Brownie-wine corks, good too. Upscale bistro feel. Comfort French with twists. Delicious, but pricey. Might try elsewhere next time."

"Been to Carl's Jr lately? They've gone upscale, brother. Saw their commercial with the Maloof Brothers and thought I'd give it a shot. Their $6000 combo caught my eye, but I settled for a $6 burger instead. Inside, it was surprisingly decent. Three TVs playing different ESPN channels, a big chicken salad that was actually good, and a Squirt to wash it down. Girl came by to ask if I wanted a refill, but I passed. My companion took her up on it though. At the end, we weren't sure about tipping, so we left a buck just in case. Didn't check the nutrition facts, but it felt healthier than a burger or taco. Not bad, Carl's Jr."

In this fair land of plenty, where food doth abound,
A place there be, where one may find sustenance profound.
For those who be of limited means, and seek a hearty meal,
This eatery doth provide, with prices most conceivably real.

The portions, generous they be, and fill thy belly full,
So fear not, dear traveler, for thou shalt have enough.
The fare, not of the finest sort, yet satisfying still,
And for the price, a bargain, verily, a steal.

So, if thou art in need, and coin doth dwindle low,
Come hither, friend, and dine with joy, I do thee know.

"Alas, poor Boston, without this wondrous place,
Where breakfast reigns supreme, in flavor and grace.
A BLT bloody mary, with bacon, lettuce, and tomato,
A feast fit for a king, or so I did assume.

The menu, a vast expanse of culinary delight,
Didst overwhelm us, with options, left and right.
We shared, to sample all, with great intent,
The Snickers pancake, a behemoth, of immense proportion.

Fried chicken, waffles, bacon, oh my!
A heart attack, on a plate, didst lie.
But worth it, indeed, with flavors so bold,
And hash, with grilled chicken, asparagus, and sundried gold.

A healthy option, compared to the rest,
But fresh and tasty, the marmalade did bless.
So, gentle traveler, make this stop a must,
In Las Vegas, where culinary dreams are fust."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, indeed,
Where sushi doth abound, and all with speed.
Their rolls, they do contain brown rice,
A healthier choice, and full of nice surprise.
Each one I've had, hath been a treat,
And left me feeling full, and most discreet.
The setup of the place, doth please mine eye,
A cozy spot, where one can sit and sigh."

"Hark, fair friends, to my tale of woe,
Of eggs benedict, both fried and poached,
At Wanda's, a place of gastronomic delight,
Where service is swift and the folk are bright.

A referral from the DMV, a chance encounter,
Led me to this cozy eatery, full of cheer,
The flavors danced on my palate, a true delight,
But alas, the egg, fried, not poached, did appear.

Yet still, the friendly folk and quick service,
Make Wanda's a place of joy and good cheer,
So if thou art in search of a tasty repast,
Pray, give this spot a try, 'twill be thy quest."

"Frozen yogurt, that sweet, creamy delight. In Chicago, it's a rare treat, reserved for the warm months. But in Phoenix, it's a year-round indulgence. I couldn't resist the temptation, not when Yogurtland beckoned. A place where you pay by the ounce, it's a choose-your-own-adventure for your taste buds. I sampled a few, then settled on peanut butter and devils food. Low-fat, they say. But let's be real, the Reese's and other candies made it anything but. Still, peanut butter is my weakness. Can't go wrong there. Busy place, Yogurtland. Popular, too. Must be the tasty flavors, the endless toppings, or the reasonable prices. Maybe all three."

"Gurkha Brigade, not the most obvious eatery on Leith Walk, but not the worst either. Clean, spacious tables, friendly atmosphere. Went for their takeaway menu - expensive compared to others in the area, but varied with different sauces, meats, and veggie options. Ordered the pork sungur - tender chunks of meat in a spicy tomato and garlic sauce. With plain boiled rice and a Coke, it came to around £10, steep at the time, but the food's quality made up for it. My friend got two starters of different pakoras, looked and tasted great. Worth trying again, maybe next time after we get our student grants."
"No wait, cool patio crowd, good service. Food was decent, not mind-blowing, but still a solid bar meal. My wife and I will be back."

"A wine bar most wondrous, in the Old Town square,
With prices so fair, it doth astound and glare.
A bachelorette party, with laughter and cheer,
They accommodated them, with nary a fear.

Their wine selection, a marvel to behold,
Ten percent off, on the back of their gold.
Their food, a delight, with portions so fair,
Even the hardest to please, did declare.

The bruschetta sampler, a treat for the taste,
A patio so cute, with live music in haste.
Overall, a place most excellent, indeed,
A hit, a find, a treasure to heed."

"A five-star review, perchance, for food most fair,
But, alas, the venue doth leave much to despair.
A no-frills place, with naught but bare essentials,
And loud, oh so loud, with sushi chefs' constant yellings.

I entered, and a cheer didst one of them extend,
A power clap, per se, and I, in kind, didst respond.
All in good fun, I say, and thus didst join the fray.

In Charlotte, none doth offer such a deal,
For $10, all thou canst eat, a veritable steal.
The sushi, "Americanized", doth lack refinement,
Deep-fried, unhealthy, yet still, my taste doth tempt.

Time labels on the plates, to ensure freshness true,
Yet often, sushi doth run out, ere time doth too.
'Tis good, indeed, and thus, in rotation, shall stay,
My Ru-tation, for Ru San's, a local sushi way.

Note: Arrive at 11:30, to avoid a wait, I pray."

"Yogurt shop, retro vibe, mid-century modern. Friendly staff, but they watch us like hawks. Don't know if it's the design or what, but it feels weird. Raspberry sauce, though, top-notch. No squeeze bottle, real raspberries. Impressive toppings, Hostess cupcakes, Little Debbie wafers. Not your usual suspects."

"Hark! Firkin On Paradise, a pub most fair,
In Las Vegas' Bar Belt, doth hold its lair.
A place of mirth and cheer, where fun doth reign,
And prices, small, doth make it easy to obtain.

The TVs, they doth show sports, my dear,
And Firkin, too, doth tie in beer and cheer.
At time of visit, $2 beers, a sight to see,
And $5 fish and chips, a special treat for thee.

I shall return, my friends, 'tis true,
For $4.50 beer, a price most fair and new.
The $2 special, sensational, indeed,
And noise, not loud, my thoughts doth heed.

The food, delicious, by Yelp's decree,
The servers, friendly, specials doth reveal.
TVs, plenty, for sports, a joy to behold,
Pool tables, too, for games of old.

British theme, a charm, doth please mine eye,
Across from Hard Rock, a night to fly.
Kiss Mini Golf, behind, a challenge, mayhap,
But after beers, a test, a trial, a laugh, perchance.

So here, my friends, I shall return, anon,
To Firkin On Paradise, a pub most wondrous, alone."

"Sausagefest found at StrEATs. Chicago's southside, Polish and Hot Italian put to the test. Passed with flying colors. Unconventional Vietnamese rolls, but damn good. Perfect bun-to-meat ratio. Soft, chewy, and strong. Fries, crispy and golden. Just like home. Rock on, Sausagefest. We'll be back."

"Hark! A feast fit for a king, and at a price most fair! 
Red Lobster, a place I had not visited in years, didst impress me mightily. 
A gift card, my dear GF didst possess, and thus we didst venture in, 
During Lobster Fest, a time of joy and cheer. 
The wait, they didst say, would be some forty-five minutes, 
But lo, we were seated in but twenty, a most pleasant surprise. 
The staff, polite and friendly, didst attend to our needs, 
And the biscuits, oh how they didst delight! 
Specialty cocktails, a true delight, and the specials, 
Didst cater to all tastes, a wondrous sight. 
Two lobster tails, cooked to perfection, didst grace my plate, 
And my GF, her surf and turf, didst savor with glee. 
A complaint, I must lodged, the water in the sink, 
Doth heat up quickly, a minor quibble, I do confess. 
But overall, a grand meal, with service most excellent, 
At a fraction of the cost, a true bargain, indeed."

"Methinks four trips didst suffice to unearth the cause of mine phone's malfunction. Each sojourn didst proffer a novel perspective on the matter, as if by divine providence. 'Twas not their fault, perchance, that they knew not the answer straightaway. Given they didst strive to amend the problem, I do confess myself content with their endeavors."

"This place, a haven, doth delight. Meatless dishes, many there be, for vegetarians, fear not to ask, 'tis true. Soy-rizo, a substitute, they do provide, for Mexican chorizo, with a couple of entrees, a clever move. Made to order, all doth seem, a sign of care, a mark of esteem. Decor, homely, artistic, not opulent, yet cozy, a pleasant scene. Bring thine own bottle, on certain nights, two entrees and an appetizer, doth grant a complimentary wine, a generous sight. Coffee, freshly brewed, doth make all the difference, a perfect end, a sweet delight. The chef, a friendly soul, didst come forth, to greet and check, a gentle touch, a pleasing sight. A recommendation, I do extend, and shall return, for that chocolate torte, a treat most divine."

"A humble abode, a tranquil scene,
Biscuits and gravy, a meal most serene.
But mark this well, my friends,
Ere break of noon, thou must descend,
Lest thou miss out on breakfast's delight."

"Elegant joint, this Trump Hotel. No craps table or smoky gamblers. Classy, top to bottom. Loved the LCD in the bathroom mirror. Watched the game while brushing my teeth. Novelty wore off quick, but that deep tub? Two could fit easy. Ahhhhhh...Breakfast in bed, every morning. Best damn service too. If you want luxury in Vegas, Trump's the ticket."

"Skinnyfats, my go-to spot. Weekly visit, today's was subpar. Waitress, poor form. Group of four, all meals arrived but mine. Partner queried, server snapped. 'Tude, no empathy. Slammed a house salad, corrected order, still crabby. Quinoa salad with chicken, please. Coaching needed, feedback too. Other staff, friendly. Food, top-notch."

"Building's a real stunner. If you're in Pittsburgh, stop by and take the tour of the Nationality Rooms. Twenty-odd rooms, each one done up in the style of a different nationality that helped build the city. Check the times before you head over."

"Hark, good sir! If thou art in need of car repair,  
Or merely passin' by, do stop and tarry here.  
'Tis a Ford dealership, where thou shalt find  
A breakfast spread, most wondrous and fair.  
I, myself, didst partake of eggs and cheese,  
Upon a flaky croissant, most delicious, 'twas ease.  
Indeed, I would return, again and again,  
For such a meal, most satisfying, doth proclaim.  
Alas, one star doth falter, for the wait,  
Didst stretch on long, past reason, methinks, 'twas fate."

"This joint? Love it. Margaritas, fajitas—the works. Summer’s the time to go, though. That’s when it’s warm. Not that it’s a bad thing, mind you. But if I’m gonna give it five stars, gotta be perfect. You know?"

"Hark! In three year's time, I've witnessed Las Vegas' rise,
As Roberto's locations sprout, like mushrooms in the skies.
Each store, unique in quality and menu, doth surprise,
Like the fiery green salsa, that doth burn my eyes.

This Roberto's, near my home, doth hold a special place,
With carne asada, so-so, and breakfast burritos, in grace.
But the carnitas, oh! How they doth stand apart,
Fried to a crisp, they steal the show, and win my heart."

"Hark, what tidings bring thee to our neck of woods?  Aye, 'tis Pita Jungle, where victuals are as delectable as those at other establishments.  Verily, the staff doth provide most excellent service, with smiles that doth light up the day.  Alas, the bar area doth seem a mite small, but fear not, for on fair days, the outdoor patio doth provide a most pleasant refuge."

"Hark, what fortune brought me to this place,
Where kindness doth abound in every face?
I sought but take-out, yet didst receive,
A taste of soup, most vegan and relieve.

Their tortillas, soft and fluffy, made,
Didst wrap the burritos, which my heart didst sway.
With lime-infused rice, and beans so black,
Guacamole, fajitas, pico, and salsa on the attack.

My woman too, didst partake in the feast,
Her burrito filled with joy, and love at least.
And though I once didst crave cheese, I swear,
Their chips and queso dip, didst bring me cheer."

Sam Fox, you've got a fan in me. Your grub at FRC restaurants never fails to impress. Culinary Dropout's no exception. Been here a few times, always satisfied. Service has had some minor slip-ups, but nothing major. That bacon bloody mary's a real treat, and the salmon's a dream. And don't even get me started on the pretzels and fondue - fondue had me at hello. Keep up the good work, and I'll keep shelling out the cash. Cheers!

"Noodle factory, you love it? Hell yes, you do. It's the real deal, kid. I know my way around Montreal's Chinatown, seen my fair share of restaurants, but sometimes they don't quite cut it. But Noodle factory, that's the spot. Great noodles, dumplings, all that jazz, and it's cheap too. Cozy place, feels like home. That's where you wanna be."

"Fear not the humble abode, my friends, for within its walls doth lie a feast most wondrous and fine. A veritable cornucopia of sashimi, with grilled mackerel and edamame did we devour, and by the stars, 'twas fresh as spring's first bloom. And, mark thee well, the wasabi, that fiery dragon's breath, did we receive in abundance, a gift from the gods, or so it seemed. This place, a gem, a treasure trove of culinary delight, shall be our secret, hidden away, but not forgotten, nay, not forgotten."

"Methought to partake of a novel Indian feast,
And thus, my heart didst choose the Curry Garden least.
The interior, alas, didst not impress mine eyes,
But nay, the victuals, they didst take me by surprise.

A Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhatura, and Garlic Naan,
Didst order I, with eager anticipation keen.
The Paneer, so fresh and delicate, didst please mine taste,
And the sauce, oh how it didst delight mine senses vast.

The Bhatura, a marvel of culinary skill,
Didst arrive, steaming hot, and didst my hunger still.
And the Garlic Naan, with its generous clove,
Didst satisfy mine craving, like a gentle dove.

The service, too, didst merit high esteem,
Despite the homely decor, the place didst gleam.
Cleanliness, they didst not neglect, I must confess,
And thus, my heart doth sing with joy and happiness.

Anon, I shall return, should my Paneer craving arise,
For at the Curry Garden, true delight doth lie."

"A most excellent tavern, with a fine array of victuals and potables. The barkeepers, friendly and keen, do serve with haste and diligence. The serving folk, though somewhat hasty in their steps, do strive to please. A merry place, indeed, to watch a game or two, with televisions plentiful as the stars in heaven."

"Methinks I do adore the ambiance of this place,
And the victuals, they didst please my taste.
Forsooth, thou mayst sing and dance, if thou art not afraid,
In this merry tavern, where mirth doth reign supreme."
"Bought a gift cert online in Vegas. Ribeye, perfectly cooked. Sides, great. Creme brulee, fantastic. First-rate joint inside a casino."

"Hark! A review of HOB Vegas doth lie within these lines,
A concert venue of note, with food that doth decline.
I've had it before, and, by the stars, I'd pass,
For 'tis not worth the coin, nor the time, alas!

But AFI, a band of old, didst play herein,
In January last, with sounds of yore, so fine.
Their music, like the wind, didst stir the soul,
And though 'twas not their latest, still, 'twas whole.

Now, as for the venue, 'tis a wondrous sight,
With stadium seating, and views most bright.
No problem getting in, or out, I say,
Even with a line, 'twas swift, come what may.

The sound, oh, 'twas a joy to hear, so clear,
And upstairs, the bar, didst serve with speed, my dear.
I do prefer this HOB, o'er Anaheim,
For Vegas' Disneyland, doth bring a merry gleam.

So, if thou art in search of music, and delight,
Come to HOB Vegas, and let thy spirit take flight."

"A hearty breakfast did we enjoy, my dear. Samantha, a vision of loveliness, did grace our table with her presence. Eggs and chorizo, a feast for the taste buds, did we devour with gusto. Alas, the pancakes and muffins, though they did appear most delectable, did we not partake of, for we were full and satisfied with the morning's repast."

"Methinks I wouldst give this place five stars, forsooth,
My taste buds didst dance with joy, in truth.
But alas, fair friends, hygiene doth play a part,
And thus, my rating doth depart.

A peek within the kitchen, all didst seem fine,
But then, a table, not so clean, didst shine.
Cabbage remnants on the chili bowl, oh dear!
Yet still, I sought to banish fear.

Lamb and chive dumplings, round and full of might,
Didst burst with flavor, a true delight.
The pork and cabbage, fried to perfection,
Didst please my taste, with its crispy dimension.

So, friends, do visit this place, anon,
For dumplings divine, and salads, a bonus.
Just heed my words, and turn away,
From rugs, that may thy gaze dismay."

"Hark! The Habit doth break the mold of common burger haunts,
A cut above, like Carl's Jr., with finer appointments.
Their bill of fare, though not extensive, doth satisfy,
And servitors, with diligence, do attend to needs.
But, alas, parking at noon doth prove a challenge,
So come early, lest thou be forced to tarry long."

"O, what a wondrous place! Breads, pretzels, sausages, and meats of all kinds,
Soups, snacks, and pickled delights that doth astound.
We chanced upon this haven, and our hunger did sate,
With a soft pretzel, shaped like a horse's hooves, so great.
A bag of sticks, and a mustard, creamy and bright,
With dill, lemon, capers, and honey, a true delight.
Next time, we shall return, to gather more of their gummies,
For they do have a plethora, of sweet and tasty treasures."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, heed my words of wisdom,
For in this place, a dish most wondrous lies,
'Tis called Malaysian fried rice, a feast most fair,
Unbelievable, indeed, it doth surprise.

And if thou art a fan of sushi, then
The panther roll, a treat most worthy, doth await,
With flavors rich and colors bright, 'twill win
Thy taste buds' hearts, and leave thee in delight.

But, alas, the service here, at times doth falter,
Yet fear not, for the curries, they do make up for't,
In spicy splendor, they doth dance upon thy plate,
A culinary joy, that doth await thy fate.

So, prithee, gentle reader, take my humble advice,
And come, partake of this most wondrous rice,
For in its savory depths, a gustatory paradise,
Doth lie in wait, to make thy senses thrice as nice."

In sooth, a pleasant stay didst I enjoy,
At Hyatt Place, where modernity doth employ.
Clean, safe, and comfortable, the space didst provide,
With friendly front desk staff, who didst enquire,
If all were well, and naught didst cause dismay.
A separate sitting area, with fridge and large TV,
Didst complete the accommodations, in a most agreeable way.
But lo, a strange thermostat, didst cause some strife,
And coffee, alas, didst leave much to desire.
The GPS, a newer sort, didst cause some woe,
For those with older cars, a tricksome route to go.
On Sunday morn, didst I awake to peace,
A quiet calm, that didst my soul release.
But soon, didst children's laughter and footsteps ring,
In Spanish, loud and boisterous, didst they sing.
A gathering of seven, in the hall didst convene,
Their noise, didst increase, as I didst emerge.
Alas, the hotel, cannot control,
The rowdy guests, who do not keep it low.
A request, in writing, at check-in, might suffice,
To ask for quiet, during certain hours, nice.
But alack, 'tis wishful thinking, I do fear,
For hotels, cheap and large, do breed such cheer.

"A fortnight's sojourn at the Wigwam didst afford me,
For work-related purposes, a most pleasant respite.
A leadership summit, our company didst convene,
And this location proved ideal, most fitting and bright.

The chamber, spacious and well-appointed, didst boast
A wet bar, living room with fireplace, and bed,
Soft and luxurious, that induced sweet slumber,
The best repose I've known, indeed, most divine.

The decor, a blend of Southwest and Ranch, didst charm,
Though modernity, my heart doth truly disarm.
Yet, comfort and relaxation, I didst find,
In this haven, despite its style, so unrefined."

Last eve, I didst meet with friends most dear,
For enchiladas of cheese and drinks of cheer.
This establishment, with service so fine,
Didst provide us with an evening divine.
Their Sonoran-style cuisine, a feast for the taste,
I didst vary my order, with green chile in haste.
Yum, yum, yum, the flavors didst delight,
And vegetarian options, a pleasant sight.
My friend, a regular, doth sing its praise,
A testament to its quality, in many ways.
Though still I search for that elusive red sauce,
This place, in my book, doth earn a favorable pause.

"A watch, a symbol of stature and wealth, doth speak volumes of its owner, akin to a dwelling or carriage. For those who seek to display their standing, a fine timepiece is a prized possession. But for me, a humble soul, a watch doth serve naught but to chafe my skin and weigh heavy upon my wrist. My modest attire and tattered shoes shall suffice to signal my station in life. \n\nYet, for connoisseurs of horology, this diminutive, eccentric boutique shall be a treasure trove, overflowing with an array of exquisite timepieces, each one a marvel of craftsmanship and artistry."

"Hark! If thou hast not seen this place before, 'Tis worth thine while to venture forth and explore. Forsooth, a ticket doth cost but twenty crowns, And within, thou shalt find diversions galore. Aye, drinks and victuals, too, they doth abound, As three-penny soda, five-penny ale, and seven-and-a-half penny turkey legs, With brownie and ice-cream, five crowns doth command. But, gentle visitor, heed my words of wisdom, Bring sunscreen and hat, for 'tis a long, hot day, And things to buy, they doth come dear, I pray thee, be prepared. Yet, fear not, for there doth be shows aplenty, A little bit of all, for every soul to enjoy."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, do not miss this place,
My friend doth live nearby, and we have found grace
In breakfast visits, oft and frequent, 'tis true,
The coffee, rich and smooth, doth please my taste anew.
A vanilla latte, sweet and velvety, doth reign,
A favorite, indeed, among their offerings profane.
The menu, diverse and quaint, doth pique my interest,
Yet, I, a glutton, find myself enthralled,
By short rib burritos, savory, oh so fine,
A dish most delectable, fit for a king's design.
But, alas! The portions, large and overflowing,
Do leave me sated, ere my meal be going.
I pray, good sir, a to-go box, forthwith,
Lest I, in haste, devour all, like some wild beast.
The wait, a trifle long, yet, service swift and bright,
Doth make amends, and doth dispel the morning's blight.
But, comfortless seating, a minor drawback, I confess,
And healthy choices, scarce, save for their willingness
To substitute, with grace, and accommodate,
A boon, indeed, for those who seek a lighter fate.
So, prithee, gentle reader, heed my words of cheer,
And visit this spot, where culinary joys appear."
"Good eatery. Husband and wife run it. Friendly folk. Grub's decent, service top-notch. I'll be back."

"In fair Edinburgh, where wondrous sights abound,
A hunger pang did strike, and rest did seek.
A cafe, recommended, alas, didst shut its door,
So here, within this bistro, didst I entreat.

Quiet, cozy, with but few patrons nigh,
A table found, and ordered forthwith.
Avocado salad, healthful choice, didst crave,
With water, pure, to quench thirst, didst wave.

Waitress, kind, didst show me to my seat,
And swift, my salad came, with bread, a treat.
But, alas, too much vinaigrette didst pour,
Dripping, the leaves didst, in oil, a sore.

A star, deducted, for this mistake, I say,
Yet still, wouldst return, for service, good, didst play."
"Good spot for a cold one and some grub. But, forget about getting a table for more than six. They don't take reservations and it's tough to snag a spot."

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy and cheer,
For fish sandwiches, they be all they claim,
In this, a humble tavern, dark and dim,
Where smoke doth fill the air, and time doth slim.

But fear not, traveler, for thy meal,
Shall be prepared with haste, and served with zeal,
Though thou mayst wait, and thy patience be tried,
Yet shall thy hunger be satisfied.

Aye, for a fish sandwich and fries of gold,
Thou shalt pay ten silver coins, 'tis true,
But mark my words, 'tis worth the cost,
For in this place, thou shalt find naught but the best."

"Great spot! Used to hit up the Mesa joint, but the manager was a real piece of work. Total witch. My boyfriend and I would go every week, and she'd never even say hi. So we stopped going. Glad we tried the Bell Rd. location. Service was top-notch. Friendly greeting, quick seating, and our server was on it. Food's still great. Always get the skillet and Eye Opener Combo. Happy to have this place back in our breakfast rotation!"
"Chocolate tour, fun. Cactus garden, cool. Chocolate at end, best part. Creme Liqueurs, my fave."

"In Mekong Plaza's restaurants, there's nary a dud,
But Wholly Grill, a gem, deserves a second nod.
We sought a meal both good and cheap,
And thus didst venture forth, our taste buds to keep.

The food court beckoned, and we didst stray,
To sample dishes of the local way.
Wholly Grill, our choice, didst not betray,
Our hunger sated, we didst end the day.

I chose the pork belly, oh so fair,
My partner, skewers, with eggplant rare.
Both dishes, delicious, beyond compare,
The flavors danced, our senses to ensnare.

The staff, kind and friendly, didst declare,
The pork belly, their recommendation most fair.
We laughed and smiled, our bellies full and round,
Our taste buds, happy, our spirits astound.

Oh, how I yearn for that pork belly now,
My craving, strong, doth never slack.
I shall return, my friends, make no mistake,
For more of that dish, my heart doth ache."
"Chai tea latte, small size, vanilla flavor. Perfect for me, delicious too. Three bucks though, steep price for a tiny cup."
"Met a mate at a quaint eatery for Restaurant Week. Cozy joint, top-notch ambiance. Squid was a hair overdone, but the rest was spot on. Server was ace. Brought our own vino."

"Craving something light, we gave this spot a shot. Sushi and sashimi, my jam. Menu had plenty to choose from. Went for some small share plates. Not disappointed. Ordered six items, all fresh and delish. Sauces, outstanding. Service, top-notch. Friendly, efficient, sincere. Would eat here again."

"By chance, I stumbled upon this bakery while on other errands in the area. The sweet aroma of fresh bread wafting from within was too enticing to resist, and I found myself stepping inside for a brief visit. They had an array of delights for a satisfying meal: bread, pastries, cakes, quiches, cheeses, and pre-prepared dishes ready to be warmed at home. I sampled their bread with honey and nuts, which was simply divine. However, I left with a loaf of raisin and nut bread that was cut to my liking. It was a dense bread with a solid crust but not too difficult to eat, and a soft interior that didn't make too many crumbs. If this bakery were closer to my home, I would likely be a regular customer!"

"Hark, what multitude of fair and gallant folk doth throng this place! Methinks 'twas fate that brought me hither, ne'er to know the ways of this, their favored haunt.  Aye, confusion reigned within my mind, as if the fates themselves did seek to hide the truth from mine eyes. But lo, a kindly quartet of servants didst guide me to the will call desk, and thus my quest did end in triumph.  Mirth and gaiety doth reign supreme amongst this merry throng, and youthful vigor doth abound.  Alas, the subterranean parking lot, a veritable labyrinth, didst prove a challenge to mine own meager wit.  Perchance a brighter illumination might serve to light the way, lest one stumble in the darkness, lost in thought, as in a dream.  Aye, upon the pool deck, a concert didst take place, with New Order playing to a packed assembly.  The acoustics, methinks, were naught but marginal, yet still the music didst stir mine own soul.  Four songs from Joy Division didst they play, a wondrous treat indeed!  Fie upon those who didst depart ere the encore, for they didst miss a wondrous sight!  A true fan doth stay until the very end, when all is done and gone.  And thus, a pleasant evening it was, with new friends made, and memories to cherish."

"Our ceaseless pursuit of boba tea, a month long quest,
Led us to Sesame House, a place unjustly named,
Within Chinatown Plaza, a mall of wonder,
A sign outside proclaims, "No. 1 Boba", in thunder.

Their tea, a second best, next to Tea Planet's brew,
But prices here, more kindly, on the purse, doth do.
Atmosphere, sparse, yet fruit, fresh as the dew,
And dried fruits, aplenty, for all to pursue."

"Vieux Quebec's got a gem of a spot for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. My missus raved about it, called it 'cute.' We went twice, and the breakfast wasn't too busy on the weekdays. Their pastries? Top-notch, especially the cheesy biscuit with a spicy kick. Wife loved the Cuban panini, and I dug the filling, even though the bread was a bit too crispy for my taste. Still, I'd order another panini in a heartbeat, and those cheese biscuits? Dessert perfection. Get a large cappuccino while you're at it. Not too pricey compared to other tourist traps in the Old City."

"Verily, this Thai food doth please mine taste,
With beef jerky, pad thai, papaya salad, and rice so bright.
Their tea, a vast and wondrous brew, doth fill my cup,
And though the site may lack, the service doth make up.
I shall return, for here I find my heart's desire,
In this fair Thai food, which doth my senses fire."

"Flown in and outta here more times than Anna Nicole's pharmacists flew to the Bahamas. Inside's a breeze, outside's a damn maze. Which lane for the 202? Left? Middle? Left again? WTF? Traffic monitors just chillin', munchin' Cheetos, sippin' Dr. Pepper, laughin' at us lost souls. Services are decent, got bars, restaurants, shops. Don't know what the haters want. All I need's a bar, snack, TV, Dramamine, National Enquirer, and that silly horseshoe pillow that makes me feel like a fool every time I pull it out."
"Sweet treats, dangerous. Sugar bars, yum. Glad I can only get them in town, or I'd need bigger pants."

"Hark! What light through yonder terminal breaks?
A chicken and biscuits doth my hunger slake.
In sooth, 'tis a fine repast, fit for a king,
Or e'en a poet, such as I, in flight.

Well done, fair North Carolina, thy victuals be
A worthy sustenance for travelers such as me.
Keep up the excellent work, that all may see
Thy bounty and generosity, in abundance free."

"Hark, good sir or madam, let it be known,  
This Trader Joe's doth offer wares most fine and bright.  
Their parking lot, alas, doth leave much to be desired,  
A place where insurance premiums should be required.  

In truth, I park afar, to avoid the fray,  
Lest elderly patrons doth crash and play the day.  
But fear not, dear friends, for this doth not deter,  
My love for this TJ's, which doth be near my chamber.  
I shall return, again and again, to savor  
Their goods, and perhaps, a parking spot to favor."

"Poppy's Bagels, a delightful find. Met Tonya P, a charming lady, for a quick bite. Toasted bagels, crunchy and carby, paired well with homemade cream cheese. Chive and vegetable spreads, both satisfying. Riley, my pup, enjoyed the patio, despite the noise from passing cars. Will return for another tasty bagel and quality time with good company."
"Five Guys, three states. SoCal native, In-N-Out fan. Obama's endorsement sold me. Better flavor, great burgers. Fries? In-N-Out still wins. Keep coming back."

"French fries, oh how my mind doth dwell on thee!
Batter-dipped, I do suspect, before they didst fry.
A buffalo chicken sandwich, verily, didst please,
And large the menu, with options for all to seize.
Open and airy, fit for groups to gather round,
With televisions many, for sporting events profound.
Thou art not unlike an Applebee's, I must confess,
Yet still, I shall return, for those fries, I must possess."

"Buca Di Beppo's got it going on. Food's top-notch, portions are huge. You can only order pasta plates for 2 or 4, but trust me, it's enough for 4-6 people. Pasta's cooked just right, sauces are tasty. Place is always packed, so make a reservation during dinner hours."

"This joint's been our go-to since it opened. Teppan chefs always put on a show, cookin' up a storm with flair and personality. Owners Barry and Ahn, they're the real deal, too. Friendly as can be, they make sure everyone's happy. They know their regulars and welcome 'em back like old friends. Happy Hour's got a killer menu, sushi's always fresh. Yeah, it can get loud, but it's a fun kinda noise. They got a big ol' patio, too. Catchin' an Arizona sunset from there? You won't regret it. Been comin' here for years, and we ain't stoppin' now."

"Hark, what cheer! We doth arrive on Tuesday eve,
For celebration feast, our bellies to relieve.
Groupon, the wondrous deal, doth grant us boon,
Two for $36, a price most fair and soon.

Afore we sat, our visage doth adorn the screen,
A smile, a laugh, a moment of pure delight, 'twas seen.
The fare, a medley of diverse sorts, doth please,
Salads, soups, Mex, Mid-East, Asian, Americ, Italian treats.

AYCD, the drinks, doth flow like liquid gold,
Beer, wine, champagne, life's nectar, stories untold.
Neyo, the ladies doth agree, with nods and grins,
The strawberry crumb cupcake, a sweet delight within.

Cotton candy, a treat for younglings, doth bring joy,
No crab legs, alas, but sushi, a poor employ.
Mexican, salads, American, doth make up the rest,
Drinks, the highlight, food, a middling quest.

Thirty-six, the sum, or eighteen per head,
A fair price, for victuals and potions, so dread.
Tis true, the food, not bad, but average, we find,
Yet, drinks, most satisfying, the mind doth unwind."

"Went to this place with a Bosnian buddy. He ordered for me. Sterile joint, like a bakery but not. Different, not cozy. 

Got a plate with a big-ass round bread, hot and oiled. Cut in half like a burger bun, but packed with seasoned sausage meat. Called cevapi. 

Bread was great, sausage tasty. Couldn't finish it, even with an empty belly. Unique experience, but I'd do it again. Next time, I'll save room for those Bosnian pastries. 

Owners were cool, service was chill. You tell 'em what you want, they bring it, you pay. No fuss, no muss. I liked it."

"Hark, what speedy service doth this place possess!
The atmosphere, it doth delight and bless.
A sandwich named Leo's, I didst partake,
And found it to be a most excellent choice, by my troth.
Even the water, it doth taste most fine and sweet.
But alas, a wait list, they have not mastered yet,
It seemeth unorganized, and caused some discontent.
Thus, four stars, I do give, for now, I pray,
That they may learn, and their wait list, arrange in array."

"Hark! This grocery store doth please me well,
With customer service that doth excel.
The cashier lines, they doth move apace,
Never more than two, in this place.

Organic veggies, they doth have in store,
Though few in number, quality doth soar.
A fine selection of beer, they doth proffer,
Beyond the common brands, a true treasure trove.

And baking supplies, they doth abound,
As good as any, in this fair town.
So, I shall make a point, to come hither,
To shop and savor, in this grocery ether."
"Four stars, no question. Staff's top-notch. Had their sandwiches and pizza. Decent grub."

"Verily, the service here doth please me well,
Though prices be steep, 'twill not deter me still.
Two omelets for eighty coins, and drinks beside,
No ale, but juice and coffee, shall be my guide.

In Las Vegas, all things come with a cost,
Yet food, oh food, doth make my heart feel lost.
By the pool we did dine, and lingered long,
For outside seats, a short stroll did take us throng.
The patio, alas, doth not always stay open wide,
But still, 'twas worth it, to bask in sunshine's pride."

"A bustling, vibrant tavern, full of cheer and delight,  
With flavorsome Mexican dishes, priced just right.  
The working class, in droves, do come to dine,  
For they know well the value of a hearty meal divine."

"Sushi Style, I stopped by for lunch today. Not too busy, even at peak hour. Waitress was great, brought me a refreshing glass of iced tea with lemon right away. Had a tootsie roll, eel sauce with crunchy crab California roll, and an Arizona roll. All were damn good. Will definitely be back soon for more."

"Hark, good sir! I do confess,
This place doth hold a special charm,
For Tina, she who doth possess
The skill to make my nails disarm.

A little out of my way, 'tis true,
But still, the best place I've found anew,
She doth make them even, thin and neat,
As I desire, her skills to greet.

Three weeks, alas! That's all I can,
Betwixt each fill, her art to scan,
But still, her work doth please me well,
And prices, fair, that doth compel.

So, gentle reader, take my word,
And visit this place, thou art implored,
For Tina's touch doth make it divine,
And thou shalt leave, in love, entwined."

"A feast most wondrous, fit for royalty,
Their lunch buffet, a steal, a verity!
For just a few coins, a meal most fair,
With choices many, to satisfy thy glare.

Vegetarian dishes, for those who abstain,
And meat, for those who do not refrain,
Chicken, pork, and beef, all make an appearance,
A spread most generous, without reluctance.

But wait, there's more! The Naan bread, oh so fine,
Fresh from the oven, straight to thine,
A taste so sweet, it doth astound,
Leaving thee in awe, and quite profound.

Yet, beware, dear friend, for this repast,
Doth bring a curse, a woeful past,
For after consumption, a nap thou shalt require,
A rest most needed, to quench the fire."

"A hearty welcome didst we receive, with service most kind and true. A tour of the premises didst they provide, most informative and new. Alas, the beer garden lay dormant, locked in winter's chill, yet still we savored brews of finest quality, our thirst to fulfill."

"Verily, 'tis a place most wondrous, where bagels doth reign supreme. A breakfast haven, by my troth, with challah that doth please, save when 'tis a tad suspect, as my Jewish friend doth say. But fear not, fair maiden, for Chompies bagels thou mayst find at yonder market, an added boon indeed."

"Hark, good sir, to Los Dos's grand delight,  
A Chimichanga most wondrous in sight.  
Deep-fried and garnished with verdant green,  
Guacamole, sour cream, and chili serene.  
A feast fit for monarchs, a treat for the taste,  
Worthy of praise, and a dish of great haste.  
Alas, if they offered refills of chips and salsa,  
Their fame would spread far, like a mighty river's pulse.  
But still, their margaritas and brews are fine,  
A drink to savor, a pleasure divine."

"In fair Chicago, this chain didst reign,
My go-to place, a culinary gain.
Now in Pittsburgh's downtown, it doth please,
A familiar taste, that doth never cease.

Consistency, a franchise's aim,
In quality and taste, they doth proclaim.
I knew what to expect, 'twas no surprise,
Their affordability, a welcome prize.

Swift service, a bonus, indeed,
A trifecta, hard to find, with speed.
Four stars, I give, for its nearness to my work,
A convenient spot, that doth save me from the murk."
"Tough to locate, but worth the effort. Solid tacos, hospitable cook."

"We swung by the Wendy's, freshly renovated. My gal and I were curious about the new digs. Place looked sharp, modern. Ordering's been streamlined, pick-up's efficient. Dining area's been revamped, new tables, fresh vibe, even a tiny section for the little ones. And, hell yeah, they got Wi-Fi now."
"Lunch spot's almost okay. Not too pricey, nice ambiance. Limited menu options though."

St. Francis, a swell spot for brunch in Phoenix. Classy joint with a pinch of trendiness. American grub with a mix of flavors. Nice selection of brews, and mimosas and Bloody Marys with brunch. Kids under 10 eat free, too.

Friendly staff, always. No slow service here. Food takes a bit, but that's not the server's fault. They're on top of your drink, asking when it's running low.

Eggs benedict with salmon, my go-to. Hollandaise sauce, tangy and buttery perfection. Used to come with fingerling potatoes, now just a few on the plate. Pork chile verde, spicy and seasoned just right. Served with corn bread for the stew. Cioppino, a spicy seafood stew, big enough to share. Great for happy hour, too, with apps and drinks by the fire on the patio. A real treat.

"Hark! Switch doth offer diverse victuals, ranging from wholesome fare to hearty indulgence. Their menu, a true potpourri, hath ne'er failed to impress. Generous portions, at a fair cost, doth satisfy my hunger. Service, too, doth please, with nary a frown or scowl. My favorites? Mac and cheese, rich and creamy, with penne pasta; caprese sandwich, with fresh pesto vinaigrette; and a classic burger, unpretentious, yet full of flavor. And should thou seek to quaff a few, their drink specials, on Sundays, are most excellent. Carafes of mimosas and bloody marys, for a mere $3, doth make merry thy day!"

"Been coming here for five years. Love the grub and drinks. This spot's pretty new, busy too. Weekends, staff's all over the place. Sometimes it's a twenty-minute wait. Usually less than five though. 

Food and drinks, top-notch. Cleanliness? Not so much. Bathrooms, especially. Never properly cleaned. Got three kids, don't even let 'em use it unless it's an emergency. 

Shame, 'cause the staff's friendly, manager seems capable. Don't know how they miss the bathroom thing. 

Still, a fave spot. Here multiple times a week."

Hark! 'Tis a tale of Pho Viet Nam, a place most fair,
Where soups and servings do delight beyond compare.
A weekly visit, give or take, doth prove their worth,
For consistency, a virtue, doth forever birth.

The pho, a soup of note, doth please the taste,
Improved, yet still, above all others in haste.
In busy times or slow, the service doth shine,
A testament to crew and staff, most divine.

Chandler's gem, this Vietnamese delight,
Doth bring us joy, with each passing night.
So here's to thee, Pho Viet Nam, and all thy kin,
May your endeavors flourish, as doth your pho within.

"Hark! If thou dost seek familiar spices and groceries,
Ask any Asian, and they shall reveal,
A place where cultures meet, in aisles so neat,
With labels clear, for all to conceive.

Not just for Asians, but all may come,
And find their need, in this vast domain,
Of 'water animals', fresh baked treats,
And bubble tea, to quench thy thirst and heat.

A small dining space, with Chinese fare,
Doth serve, and make thy taste buds aware,
That this place, though far, is worth the quest,
For all thy Asian cuisine requests."

"Marry, how strange it doth seem to mine eyes,
That any soul would hold In-N-Out in higher esteem,
Than Lenny's, where the patties be plump and full of life,
The cheese, a rich and creamy delight, doth make me swoon,
And fries, oh fries, so crispy and golden brown,
Do leave In-N-Out's offering in the dust, I do avow.

For though the burger of In-N-Out may taste fair,
'Tis naught but a shadow of Lenny's finest fare,
Whose patties beefy, cheese a noble wheel,
And fries, a hundredfold better, doth reveal.

So, nay, I do not think In-N-Out doth reign supreme,
For Lenny's, in my heart, doth hold the crown, it doth seem."

"No health insurance, so I paid outta pocket for my dental work. Prices weren't bad, though. Comparable to others in the area. Plus, they had a discount coupon online. That sold me. Good reviews on Google too. Called 'em up at 8, got an appointment at 9. Maybe I was lucky, or maybe it was the economy. Who knows? Doc Balestrino did the fillings. Took his time to explain everything, answered all my questions. Overall, a good experience. I'll be back in six months for a cleaning."
"Good eatery for a quick bite. Consistent flavors, friendly staff. Haven't found a dud on the menu yet."

"Methinks I am a fan of Yoforia, indeed,
These yogurt shops spring up like weeds in seed,
A clever concept, self-serve, then weigh,
The price and flavor, a wondrous array.

At times, the queue doth stretch and wind,
But fear not, for it moveth swiftly, kind,
And if thou art impatient, take a stroll,
Around the mall, and let the line dwindle, whole."

"Methinks 'tis a grand gymnasium indeed,
With facilities most fair and ample space.
But alas, I didst encounter a slight quirk,
When I, a member, could not gain entrance,
For want of my I.D., a woeful mistake.
I voiced my discontent, and all was well,
The issue resolved, my grief didst quickly flee.
Yet, mark this well, good sirs and madams,
The customer service, a trifle lacking,
And some employees, their courtesy not always apt.
But fear not, for the rest, all doth excel,
E'en at midnight, when the crowds doth dwindle,
And lo, 'tis open twenty-four hours, a boon most bountiful."

"Friendly staff, clean digs. Portions? Huge. Mexican grub? Not the best I've had, but it'll do when I'm hankerin'. I tell myself I'll only eat half, save the rest for later. Doesn't work. I stuff my face 'til it's all gone. That stuff's like crack."

"Hark, my love and I do bide our time at Cosmpolitan's halls,
Where we have dined upon their bounteous brunch, with naught but praise for all.
The victuals, fresh and varied, do please our taste,
And leave us sated, save for sweets, which we do crave with haste.

But lo, the wait to sit, doth prove a vexing woe,
For though the tables lie in wait, empty and aglow,
The staff, they dally, and do keep us in suspense,
Leaving us to pine, in eager expectation's tense.

Yet still, the fare, it doth delight, and worth the wait,
So heed my words, and save a space, for sweet dessert's treat."

"People bitch about this joint being too fancy. That's exactly why I come here. Love the layout, always spotless, and they let you taste the goods before you buy. Weekends, the line's a bitch, so come during the week to avoid the chaos. Bring back the capsules for recycling, and they got all your info on file, so you don't gotta remember shit. Nespresso's made me a better man in the mornin', so I'm a fan of this place and their product."

"This Starbucks' layout doth please mine eyes,
With ample space for all to sit and sip.
But, alas! On our visit, the team didst not
Keep the place clean, as it should be.
The trash can o'erflowed, and tables unwipe,
A sight most foul, and displeasing to mine sight.
Yet, the staff were friendly, and that doth count,
For friendliness doth weigh heavy in mine book.
So, four stars doth this Starbucks receive,
But, methinks they should attend to the environment with greater zeal,
And ensure that food items be stocked aright,
That they may earn the full five stars, anon."

"A feast most wondrous, fit for royalty,
The buffet's spread, a true delight.
Some dishes, bold and full of zest,
Others, mild, yet still a joy to taste.
Mango ice cream, sweet and pure,
But mango lassi, oh, how it's obscured!
Whipped cream, a needless addition,
Detracts from the drink's true sensation.
Staff, attentive and most kind,
Eager to serve, their guests they find.
Curry, not fiery hot, but still,
A blend of spices, skillfully wrought."

"Bandera's where I head for a night out. Had some solid dinners there, but their Dip Duo with tortilla chips and Mojitos? Unforgettable. It's a great spot to kick things off with a good snack and a stiff drink."

"Methinks my dearest friend didst come to Vegas for a day,
To visit me and see the wondrous sights,
We went to dine and have a drink or two,
At one of the new hotels, with grand delight.

We shared a pizza, grilled with veggies galore,
And I didst order a cocktail, special and more,
With Grey Goose, lime, mint, and water, a fine blend,
'Twas truly yummy, my taste buds didst attend.

My friend didst have a margarita, on the rocks,
And didst enjoy it so much, she had three, no shocks,
For she was on holiday, and didst wish to play,
And the service was good, with nary a fray.

The views outside were stunning, a true sight to behold,
A fitting end to our merry day, so bold."

In fair Montreal, where China Town doth meet the eye,
A Dim Sum place doth lie, within a mall's embrace.
The food, though greasy, doth please the palate well,
And atmosphere, fitting for a Dim Sum spell.

Many have compared this place to others far and wide,
But I, who've had Dim Sum in Shanghai's streets, do find
It comparable, in its own humble, modest way,
To those in cities grand, where Chinese cuisine doth sway.

Yet, in my search for xiaolongbao, steamed with care,
I seek a place, like Din Tai Fung, beyond compare.
For though Shanghai may boast both good and bad,
I crave a taste that's truly authentic, not so sad.

"In this fair establishment, the setting doth please,
With ample space for rest and relaxation's ease.
The service, too, doth shine with friendliness and grace,
Eager to guide thy choices with a smile on their face.

The food, oh how divine! A steak of such quality,
Thy taste buds shall dance with joy and revelry.
But, alas, the mushrooms, they didst not impress,
For they upon my tongue didst leave a foul mess.

Yet still, this place doth earn my highest praise,
For steak and service, both doth bring delight.
So, gentle reader, heed my words of cheer,
And visit here, thou shalt not regret, I swear."

"Methinks I do adore Thai victuals, my dear. 'Tis a place of great renown, hath won acclaim in years past, a true delight for the taste buds, by Jove! Two things doth please me well, good sir. Firstly, 'tis a popular haunt, full of merriment and cheer. Secondly, the cuisine, authentic Thai, doth tickle mine fancy, with dishes such as Pad Thai, red curry, numba 10 spicy, and mint beef, all delectable, by the stars! Their Thai Iced tea, a refreshing draught, doth complement the feast, with nary a trace of oversweetness, praise the heavens! The staff, a friendly bunch, doth attend to thy needs with grace and aplomb. The price, quite reasonable, doth fit within thy means, good sir. In conclusion, 'tis an establishment of elegance, a true gem, worthy of thy patronage."

"Good to see a joint do it right and get paid for it. This place, Toast, knows what's up. Had the Cobb Salad with the missus for lunch - damn good. 

This spot's seen some turnover, but Toast's showin' it ain't the location's fault. It's the product, like it usually is. 

Solid. Didn't give 'em five stars though, 'cause it got too loud to chat across the table. Might just be a side effect of their popularity, but still a problem."

"Methinks I've visited this fair store ten times in two years past,
And each time, good service have I found, and cheerful chat,
Their wares of women's running gear and yoga attire, most vast,
Have brought me joy, and made my heart feel light and free.

If e'er a return or exchange didst need to be made,
'Twas done with haste and smiles, and no ill will displayed.
I do confess, my dear, this shop doth hold a special place,
In my heart, for its kind folk and their gentle grace."

"Kobe sliders, crave 'em all the time. Best I've had, comes with BBQ dipping sauce. Mmmm. Weekend lunch, wait's ridiculous. Don't bother sitting outside, pretty to look at though - pool, fountains. Full bar, yeah, Vegas. Had the cobb salad, giant, shareable. Chili, turkey club, cheese burger, all good. Prices high, but worth it."

Vdara, a tranquil escape from the Strip's chaos. Spacious rooms, excellent service, and pleasant amenities. I've stayed here twice, enjoying the peaceful atmosphere each time. The rooms are generously sized, accommodating three people comfortably. Non-smoking throughout, and no casino noise, creating a serene environment. Located at the southern end of the Strip, slightly removed from the bustle, yet still accessible to Bellagio. While I prefer a livelier Vegas experience, Vdara's calm vibe appeals to those seeking relaxation. The pool, too, exudes tranquility. I'll gladly return to Vdara, especially since it's a great value on Hotwire. Look for a five-star, non-casino hotel on the south Strip, and chances are it'll be Vdara. Until next time, Las Vegas!

"Hark, fair friends! Last week, I chanced upon AAP,
For luncheon, and oh, what joy didst it bring!
The hour was late, and few didst dine within,
So I, a hostess, didst choose my seat with ease.
A comfy booth, so large and plush, didst beckon me,
And thus, I sat, with nary a soul to trouble thee.

My server, swift and kind, didst tend to me,
And asked if I had questions, as well as my decree.
The soft pretzel, with beer cheese, didst catch mine eye,
And thus, I ordered it, with haste, didst not deny.
'Twas large, indeed, and hot, with crunch outside,
And soft within, a treat, most satisfying, I avow.

Still, hunger pangs didst plague me, so I didst add,
A spinach salad, with tomato, cranberries, and feta, not bad.
A nut, perhaps, to change the texture, might be nice,
But overall, 'twas a salad, most pleasant, and quite nice.

They have, it seems, drink specials, through the week,
A place, so grand, where one might watch a game, with ease.
Four stars, I gave, for more lunch options, they shouldst seek,
Beyond salads, sandwiches, and entrees, which start at five, I do beseech.

Yet, verily, 'twas great, and I shall return, anon,
To AAP, where food, and drink, didst make my day, so bright and sun."

"O, how glad we were to find this place ere we did depart from Vegas! Our garb was grimy, yet the folk within were similarly attired. 'Tis nigh the Strip, thou see, and thus the proprietors must be aware of its appeal.

The lady of the house, most kind and fair, didst offer us additional victuals, for none of us didst desire the meatballs. Praised be her name! Though, alack, she didst forget my comrade's order, and 'twas somewhat awry.

The pho, it didst taste of authenticity, or so I thought, for I am not well-versed in such culinary delights. Yet, I didst enjoy it heartily, mayhap due to mine hangover, which didst make me feel most dire.

But lo, the path to the privy didst lead through the kitchen, and that didst cause me some dismay. Alas, I do not relish such proximity to the cooking domain."

"Hark, my friends, let me share with thee  
My thoughts on Teharu, a place to be  
A revolving sushi bar, a curious sight  
But fear not, for the food doth ignite  

The skeptic within me didst rear its head  
But Yelp's reviews didst ease my doubts instead  
I found myself in love with the place  
Where food doth roll by, and laughter doth embrace  

A pennywise man, I do adore  
Well-made food, that doth taste divine, and more  
At Teharu, such treasures doth abound  
Plates of wonder, priced but a few pounds  

Beer floweth freely, in great quantity  
Fresh fish, a must, for health's sweet clarity  
So heed my words, dear friends, and take a seat  
At Teharu, where sushi doth meet thy feet."

"Hark, my dearest friend, to this most wondrous place,
Where steaks of finest quality do grace the plate.
The staff, so friendly, doth attend to our needs,
And keep the premises in neatness and good deeds.

We opt for steak, sans butter, a wise choice indeed,
For calories, it doth cut, and taste, it doth not impede.
The veggies, fresh and crisp, do complement the dish,
With seasonings that doth make our taste buds thrill and wish.

The brown bread, warm and savory, doth start the feast,
A perfect pairing for the steak, a true delight.
The ambiance, cozy and intimate, doth make for love,
In booths around the bar, a date night, sent from above.

Verily, a place of excellence, in every way,
A culinary delight, that doth make our day."

"Methinks 'tis fortunate indeed to have this eatery nigh my dwelling place! Aye, what doth make it even more desirable, good sirs, were it to possess a patio, whereupon mine own canine companion might join me. A fair price, I say, and verily, the red curry didst please mine taste buds."

Halt! Good sir or madam, prithee tarry awhile,
And purchase yonder dill Havarti, 'tis worth thine while.
Taste a morsel, nay, taste many, forsooth,
Thou shalt find others that please thee, in truth.

"Hark, what wondrous feast doth lie before mine eyes!
A veritable cornucopia of greasy delights,
Fried to a golden crisp, most delectable and fine.
The white trash burger, with its fried pickle and onions,
Doth tempt my taste buds, and the sweet potato fries,
A culinary marvel, doth complete this gastronomic symphony.
I highly recommend these dishes, for they doth satisfy
And fill mine belly with delightful, savory joy."

"SLS, Lux tower wing. Easy access to train. Bought 24-hour passes. Fast, convenient ride to The Linq. Sunday, barely anyone around. I prefer trains during the day. Enjoyable experience, just remember to wear flats."

"In sooth, a bright and airy space doth call thee in,
At corner of Saint-Laurent and Fairmount, 'twain doth spin.
At lunch, a mix of moms and babes, of power and grace,
Do gather, savoring each bite with joyous face.

The menu, brief and fair, doth offer much delight,
Grilled cheese, salads, charcuterie, a feast for sight.
Pastas, stews, and hash, upon the larger side,
Do fill the belly, and doth satisfy the soul's desire.

My corned beef hash, with egg sunnyside up,
Doth please my taste, and doth my hunger quench.
The beef, so juicy, flaky, and tender too,
Doth melt in mouth, a flavor most true.
Though price doth seem a bit steep, the portion, just right,
With arugula salad, a perfect blend of spice and might.

My friend, with salad and fries, doth have her fill,
A meal of choice, her lunch, she doth fulfill.
The fries, with mayo, soft and fluffy, a delight,
I could not resist, and ate near half that night."

"Skip Starbucks.  Support local joints.  Beehive's got the best buzz, but Crazy Mocha's no slouch either.  Great coffee, teas, smoothies, and desserts.  Just watch out for the family-sized sweets if you're diabetic and solo.  Free Wi-Fi too.  Used to be Dancing Goats.  Name's changed a few times.  Sip, maybe?  Now they're all over Pittsburgh, even at the Carnegie Library."

"Parked the car and ducked into the cinema for a flick. Line was short, ticket lady was sweet. Lobby was tidy, ticket guy pointed us to the theater. Skipped the snacks, but the joint looked sharp from afar. Theater was cozy, seats were comfy, screen was clear. Good show."

In this swanky bar, with cocktails fine and folk of note,
I chanced to sit, and watch the revelers quote,
Their antics wild, their tales did unfold,
As they sipped their drinks, stories to be told.

A DB, with flair, and purse of gold,
Bought Cristal, for two fair maidens bold,
And shot it down, with haste and speed,
As if the liquid fire, his thirst did need.

Oh, the shots of Cristal, how they flowed,
Like a river wild, that could not be slowed,
And after, regular shots, he did command,
As if his thirst, could never be tamed.

But fear not, dear friends, for this place,
Hath cocktails, of the finest grace,
With maraschino liquor, vodka, and rose wine,
Garnished with raspberries, three in a line.

The bartenders, skilled and quick,
Did serve with grace, and gentle trick,
Their craft, they knew, and with a smile,
Did make our night, most worthwhile.
"Solid joint for a hearty breakfast. Red velvet pancakes, highly recommended. Wait wasn't too bad either."

"Hark! A tale of woe and sorrow doth unfold,
A store so grand, yet causes harm to others,
In this fair town, where commerce doth abound,
It doth destroy the small, and doth impound.

But fear not, dear reader, for all is not lost,
For within its walls, a treasure trove is found,
A selection vast, of all things outdoors,
Better than REI, in my humble opinion, found.

The staff, knowledgeable and kind, doth aid,
In finding what thou seekest, with speed and grace,
And though they lack the high-end gear, so fine,
For first-timers, 'tis a place divine.

So enter, dear stranger, and take a look,
For in this store, thy needs shall be fulfilled,
And though it doth harm others, do not fear,
For in its depths, thy heart shall be cheered."
"Good eatery. Sandwiches, reasonable. Try #2, triple decker turkey pastrami on rye. Fills you up."
"Not too shabby, given the alternatives at the airport. Friendly staff, efficient service, and hot, fresh grub. That's all a fella needs."
"Premium hotel, no doubt. Service top-notch. Meeting rooms, well-equipped. WiFi, fast and reliable. Prices, steep, but worth it for those who can afford it."
"Can't get what I need at Fresh & Easy? Head here instead. Better selection, good quality, fair prices. Would shop here exclusively, but some items I prefer from F&E—it's closer to home."

"Hark! What wondrous fish doth lie within this place?
Three of us didst partake in meals most fair,
Ono sandwich, tacos of fish, and chips of the sea.
A small venue, with ordering at the counter, 'twas,
Yet the atmosphere didst exude a Hawaiian glee.
The staff, so friendly and full of mirth, didst serve us well."

"Methinks my wife didst desire to dine at Macayo's,  
For their baja burritos, she didst have a great fondness.  
So off we went, to partake in their culinary delights,  
And sample their wares, in the hopes of a satisfying night.  

I ordered the poblano chile, stuffed full of chicken and cheese,  
In a crispy breading, that didst please mine eyes and taste.  
'Twas almost like a chile relleno, but crisper, and in my mind,  
Better than the rest, a true delight, so hard to find.  

My wife, her favorite dish, chile relleno, she didst crave,  
But my suggestion, she didst not take, and now she didst regret.  
She eyed my plate with longing, and I didst tease her so,  
Giving her a taste, of what she didst not know.  

We also had the green tamale bites, as an appetizer,  
With Baja sauce, they were a sweet and savory treat.  
Sweet masa balls, deep-fried, addictive, they were indeed,  
A pleasant surprise, the service, was good, our needs were met.  

The food, of high quality, the taste, didst satisfy,  
We shall return, to Macayo's, again, ere long, I do predict."

"This humble abode doth please mine eyes and taste,
With food of Hawaii, rich and of great haste.
The keepers here, kind souls they be,
And though the hall may lack finery, 'tis plain to see,
'Tis not their aim to serve luxurious feast,
But swift and savory meals, that do suffice.
For Chicken Katsu craving, this place doth hit,
A worthy stop, when hunger doth beset."

"Hark, good sirs, to my words of praise for Safeway,
A store most wondrous, where all needs are met in play.
This location, dear to me, doth hold a special place,
Where FnE and McDowell's Safeway cannot compare in grace.

One-stop shopping, indeed, it doth provide,
From US Bank to pharmacy, all necessities abide.
But alas, late night shoppers, take heed,
For slow checkout lines, a woeful deed.

Yet, fear not, for produce, fresh and fair,
Doth fill the shelves, a bounty beyond compare.
And certain products, always in stock,
A treasure trove, for which my heart doth knock."

"Upon our arrival at yon eatery, we were told 'twould be a brief wait ere our table was prepared. No bother, thought I, for my spouse and I did order potions at the bar, and waited patiently for our table to be readied. But lo, when our hostess did summon us to our table, she didst not proffer to convey our draughts thither. Alack, 'twas vexing indeed, for who doth wish to bear a martini glass, clad in heels and burdened with a purse, unto their seat? Yet, this aside, our repast did prove most delectable. The lobster bisque, which they did graciously partition for us, did taste divine, and we did share the rib eye, cooked to perfection, medium rare, and a side of risotto, lest we be o'erfilled.
