"No green tea yogurt, dammit. Girl at the counter, real sweet, told me they ain't bringing it to Vegas. Guess I gotta go back to LA for my fix. (Sad Face) But hey, got Jamba Juice, so it's not all bad. lol"

"Hark! What wondrous sights doth greet mine eyes?
A canine, garbed as bellhop, doth surprise!
And thus begins a show most marvellous and bright,
With creatures great and small, in wondrous plight.

A rabbit, wise guise, doth speak with glee,
Whilst cats, with graceful leaps, doth thrill and tease.
Dogs, in varied forms, doth entertain and delight,
And Russian family, with ancient circus might.

The best part, dear friends, doth lie in this,
That all these creatures, once astray, now find bliss.
And cheap, oh cheap, doth be the price to pay,
For Vegas show, so grand, doth dance and play.

So heed my words, and join this merry band,
For those who shun this fun, doth lack good hand."

"Methinks they vend bento boxes, a portable feast,
With choices of fish, fowl, or both, at thy behest.
A small repast doth cost but four silver pence,
Whiles a larger dish doth require sixpence, in sooth.
Yet, for the price, 'tis a meal most fair and bright,
With quality of victuals that doth please thine sight."

"Methinks 'twas a most wondrous chicken burrito,
With flavors so bold and aromas so sweet.
The fellow behind the counter, a merry old soul,
Didst proffer me samples of meat and cream cheese,
And lo, the salsas at the bar didst ignite,
My taste buds with fiery passion and delight.

But alack, the beef in red sauce didst pack a punch,
And the chicken, oh so tender and plump,
Didst fill my belly with joy and contentment,
As the cook didst expertly prepare my feast.

Now mark thou well, dear reader, these points of note,
A chipotle tortilla, roasted corn, horchata,
And free homemade chips, a veritable treat,
That doth set this tavern apart from the rest.

And the rolling of the burrito, a work of art,
Didst fill mine eyes with wonder and amaze,
For the ingredients, so fresh and fine,
Didst make mine mouth to water and mine heart to sing.

In conclusion, this humble taqueria,
Doth rival any chain, with its delicious fare,
And the price, a mere $8.18, a true bargain,
For a meal that doth surpass all others, beyond compare."

"Hark! To Hurricane I do repair,  
For Jamaican Jerk wings, beyond compare.  
The flavor, at first, doth seem strange,  
A sweet jerk sauce, with just a little change.  
But as I eat, my taste doth adapt,  
And soon, the wings, I do find attract.  
Meaty, they be, and a five-piece feast,  
For lunch, a fine and fair repast.  
And Pabst Blue Ribbon, all day long,  
Doth flow, like a river, with a song."

"Methinks 'tis folly for these reviewers to give lesser stars,
For lack of shrimp burritos or sit-down fare.
A pox upon their houses! Doth not take away,
The fact that this place doth make the best burritos e'er.
Fresh ingredients, a feast for mine eyes,
A fantastic place for luncheon, by my troth.
Pray, good sirs and madams, use your wits aright,
When penning reviews, lest ye be deemed a fool."

"Verily, I came hither upon the praise of many,
And found the servitors of this place most kind.
Their diligence in tending to my needs didst astound me,
For they didst treat me like a kin, with gentle mind.

The first time I didst step within these walls,
I didst but wait a scant ten minutes, ere they called
My name, and bade me enter, with a smile so bright.
The office staff, with courtesy and grace, didst greet me,
And made me feel most welcome, like a long-lost friend.

The doctor, too, didst show great heed unto my words,
And listened well, with patience and with thought.
I must confess, I didst have some doubts, at first,
About coming here, for medical offices do oft
Fill me with dread. But now, I do declare,
This place hath won my heart, and I do feel most cheer.

In truth, I didst enjoy my visit here,
And found the staff to be most comforting and dear.
So, if thou art in need of medical care,
Come hither, and thou shalt find solace and repair."

"A tiny, charming museum, nestled in Scottsdale's heart,
With staff so kind and wise, they'll steal thy part.
I couldst spend a day, in their company, so bright,
And thou, dear traveler, shouldst visit, 'tis in sight."

"Hark, what news is this? A place most fair,
Where happy hour drinks flow free and rare.
Midori sour, oh how sweet thy taste,
A steal, a bargain, at such low cost, in haste.

Tuna tartare, sliders of pork and beef,
Jambalaya, ribeye, all dishes most relief.
Fresh as the morning dew, delicious as can be,
A feast fit for a king, or so it seemed to me.

In VIP quarters, we were led with grace,
Curtains drawn, a private space, what a sight.
Our bartender, tall and cleanly shaven,
Like Iron Man, his likeness unshaven.

The chef himself, a gentleman of great renown,
Served us with care, and with a smile, crowned.
He doubted my ability to devour,
But I proved him wrong, my hunger to assure.

A fancy schmancy dining experience, indeed,
Yet affordable, a bargain, a noble deed.
This barstaurant, a gem, a find most rare,
A place to return, again and again, with care."

"Speedy and amiable attendance, sayeth they,  
These folk, their wish, thy purse to fatten doth lay,  
The cheapest rate, with coverage most fair,  
Insurance folk, of such a mind, who'd have thought, pray?"

"Hark! What luck doth bring me to this place so nigh my humble abode? Twice now, I've partaken of their morning fare, and by the stars, 'tis truly divine! In Scottsdale, there be no better spot for break of day repast, and blessedly, 'tis not o'errun with crowd, like others on that busy thoroughfare. The sauce of chimichurro and bread of toast, they do make this place stand forth, a true gem of the morn!"

"Marry! 'Tis a wondrous sight to behold,
Dr. Josh, with patients, doth take his time to unfold
The mysteries of their bodies, and with great care,
Doth impart his knowledge, leaving none to despair.
This is no hasty crack, a two-minute fray,
But a thorough examination, day by day.
And mark my words, fair friends, the ice therapy doth bring
Relief before and after, a most wondrous thing!"

"A haven for a hearty, wholesome feast,
Where courteous servers tend to each guest.
Their smoothies, too, are quite divine,
And nutritionists didst craft the menu with finesse.
Aptly named, this eatery doth beckon thee,
To sate thy hunger after exercise with glee."

"Hark! I entered this establishment seeking a precise nail style, and lo, didst receive a most excellent pedicure. Peter, skilled artisan that he is, wrought wonders upon mine stiletto nails, rendering them utterly fabulous! Verily, I doth recommend this shop to all my female acquaintances in fair Las Vegas, for I am but a traveler, and shall return anon. Fare thee well, kind nail technician, until we meet again!"

"Hot damn! Best donut I ever had. Made to order, choose your own toppings. Caramel and toasted coconut, amazing. They got coffee too, fresh beans every week. Espresso, iced tea, all that jazz. Gonna be a regular for sure. Cravin' it already, just got home."

Oh, how I adore Love Lish Nails, 'tis a place most divine,
Where staff and owners, kindness doth entwine.
My mother and I, do visit oft,
For their service, doth leave us in awe and thought.

Their tools, they open fresh, each time we come,
And for each pedi, a new liner, they've some.
Levi and Thao, owners of this den,
Do strive to please, and make our visits len.

Once, when we waited, Levi did extend,
A coupon, for ice cream, at Baskin's end.
Oh, what a joy, 'twas, on that day,
At Love Lish Nails, our love did sway.

"Hark! This bakery doth rock indeed,
Their staff, so diligent and speedy.
A week's notice, they did heed,
And made our wedding cake, so neat.

Sample cakes they sent, for us to taste,
And delivered the final product, with haste.
Gluten-free, it was, to our delight,
Oh, what a wondrous sight!

Stellar service, scrumptious cake,
Our gratitude, they did partake.
Thank you, good bakery, we say,
For making our special day, so gay."

"Verily, fairest Las Vegas doth provide  
The best of experiences, with service most kind  
And victuals most delectable, a feast for the taste  
With wines of the finest vintage, a true delight  
I do confess, my heart doth yearn for its return  
For there, my spirits are lifted, and all is well."

"A fine array of brews, a changing feast,
Rivaling Pittsburgh's best, in taste and zest.
Burgers diverse, with twists and turns,
And sandwiches, salads, to delight discerning urns.
Wine, aplenty, without breaking the bank,
Cocktails, too, for all to partake and rank.
I say, give it a go, and take a chance,
For this place, it doth dance, with flavors so grand."

"Hark! I've been a patron of this establishment since its inception, four winters past, and ne'er have I been treated with disrespect. Always prompt, and sometimes tardy, I've received excellent service, and sent friends, who've all departed in high spirits. Rarely seen, those one-star ratings; there must be cause why Emporium thrives, despite higher prices, in this economic climate. 'Tis true, Toby and his staff are a class above, and their dedication to their craft doth earn them the custom they receive. If thou seekest flattery, best look elsewhere, for Emporium doth provide honest, skilled work."

"Hark! A tale of woe, my friends, doth unfold,
Of pipes that leaked and waters cold,
A kitchen floor, so hot beneath our feet,
Didst signal danger, and a problem meet.

My wife, in haste, didst call upon my aid,
And I, in turn, didst seek a plumber's trade,
Copperline, on Yelp, didst catch mine eye,
And Gabe, the plumber, didst soon arrive.

He asked us to call a leak detector,
To find the source of the water's flow,
Then came himself, with tools in hand,
To fix the leak and make all well stand.

But lo! The locator didst not do his part,
And Gabe faced challenges, with a heavy heart,
Yet still he persevered, with skill and might,
And fixed the leak, with all his plumber's might.

I also needed a new water heater,
And Gabe, with ease, didst take care of this,
He replaced it swiftly, with a smile so bright,
And disposed of the old one, with all his might.

Gabe is a workhorse, a man of great worth,
With patience, understanding, and a gentle birth,
He doth his job with skill and grace,
And leaves no stone unturned, in his plumber's race.

My house, being old, didst pose a test,
But Gabe, with courage, didst pass the quest,
He rerouted pipes, with a steady hand,
And crawled through attics, like a plumber's band.

So here's to Gabe, a man of great renown,
Whose plumbing skills, doth leave us all astound,
We'll call him always, for any need,
For he is truly, a plumber of great deed."

"Oh, how my heart doth sing with joy and mirth,
For I have seen the Rubber Duck, a wondrous sight,
A symbol of childhood's whimsy and delight,
That doth bring a smile to mine own face, so bright.

In Pittsburgh's downtown, where events doth abound,
I chanced upon the duck, with PNC Park around,
A perfect evening, with boats paying their respects,
It was a moment that doth make my heart feel blessed.

Each morn, as I didst make my way to work,
The duck didst greet me, with a grin so quirk,
It doth bring me joy, and doth make my day,
A feeling that doth never fade away.

And so, when news didst spread of the duck's next stop,
In Norfolk, Virginia, I didst not hesitate,
To plan a trip, with nieces and nephews in tow,
To see the duck once more, and share in the glow.

And though I hadst seen him before,
The joy he brought me, didst still leave me poor,
For he doth have a magic, that doth never fade,
A symbol of childhood, that doth never be made.

So here's to thee, dear Rubber Duck,
May thou forever bring joy, and never lack,
For thou art a treasure, a true work of art,
A symbol of innocence, that shall forever be in my heart."

"Hark! A newfound haven for spirits I have chanced upon,
A liquor store of sorts, where fine brews are sold.
Long had I wished to venture forth and sample their wares,
But alas, fate had other plans, and thus I tarried.

Now, with the approaching fray of Super Bowl Sunday,
I sought a keg of finest ale to slake my guests' thirst.
And lo, this very place didst offer the best price,
Both for the keg itself and the deposit, in sooth.

Verily, I say unto thee, good sirs and madams,
This establishment shall be mine sole refuge,
For rare and exotic brews, and merriment besides,
In yonder cellar bar, where mirth doth reign supreme.

Huzzah! A fortuitous find, indeed, and one that doth delight."

"By th' heavens, what a wondrous sight doth greet mine eyes! A place so fair, it maketh my mouth to water merely by its presence. Methinks 'tis not mere fancy, for yonder air doth bear the scent of bacon, or so mine imagination would have me believe.

"The service here, I do confess, was swift and kind. A feast fit for a king didst they prepare for me, with porchetta as its crown jewel. Each morsel, a delight, with flavors and textures diverse and wondrous. The inner portion, spicy and bold, didst complement the outer, which didst resemble bacon, but with a finer grace. And let us not forget the pork tacos, with kimchi, a perfect blend of savory and sweet.

"But lo, the piece de resistance, a dessert most divine, didst steal the show. Nutella ice cream, a nectar of the gods, didst leave me in awe and wonder. My date, a sly devil, didst persuade me to partake, and verily, I didst find myself lost in thought, pining for that sweet treat once more.

"Thus, my heart doth sing with joy, for I have found a new abode, wherein I shall indulge in culinary delights, and revel in the splendor of Pig & Pickle."

"Morning at Prohibition, new sign up. Had deep-fried pain perdu, fried chicken. BF got breakfast poutine, fries, cheese curds, bacon, sausage gravy, fried egg, hollandaise. Scrumptious! \n\nLove the bottomless Joe, attentive service. Menu's creative, stuffed ricotta pancakes, banh mi breakfast, Bavarian benedict. One of my favorite breakfast spots in Montreal."

"Hark! What eatery is this? Grand Lux Cafe, thou sayest? Aye, 'tis true, my friends, for I have partaken of their delectable victuals, and by the stars, they be divine! Chicken and waffles, a dish most wondrous, didst fill mine belly with delight. And the chicken flautas, oh how they didst tickle mine taste buds! Verily, the green sauce didst make them a feast fit for the gods! But alack, the crowd, it didst throng, and the prices, they didst climb. Yet still, I say, 'tis worth the cost, for the service, it didst shine. Our server, a merry lad, didst attend to us with grace and cheer. So if thou find thyself in need of sustenance, after a night of revelry, look no further than Grand Lux Cafe, for 'twill satiate thy hunger and leave thee in high spirits!"

"Best beer bar in Vegas. Top-notch selection, always changing. Rare brews you won't find elsewhere. Greg Koch, Stone Brewing's own, stopped by a few times. They throw beer fests all year round. Try new brews, meet fellow enthusiasts. Must-visit for beer geeks."

"Best vet in town. My dog gets stoked when we pull up. My Jap Chin had some weird allergies, chewed his flesh raw. Been to a bunch of vets, couldn't fix it. Commonwealth, they fixed him up, no issues since. Friend had to put her cat down, vet came to the house, super caring, even mourned with us. Can't say enough good things, they're awesome."

"O, how I do adore this Pizza place,
For its affordable slices, a wondrous grace.
I visit oft, and with each bite,
My taste buds dance with joy and delight.
Their Chicken Wings, oh how divine,
A culinary marvel, truly sublime."

"This joint's not half bad for a strip hotel bar. Went here a few weeks back, lookin' for some decent brew prices and a place to kick back. It delivered. Friendly bartenders, reasonable prices, and a social atmosphere. They got TVs for sports, comfy seats, and the beer/cheese dip appetizer was a nice surprise. I'm from Wisconsin, so I know my cheese, and this stuff was top-notch. We just wanted a snack, but it filled us up good. If you're in the area, spendin' big bucks on entertainment, this place is a solid choice for a break. Down-to-earth vibe, highly recommend it. I don't give out five stars easy, but this spot earned 'em."
"Crust. Cheese. Yum. Two-year-old agrees."

"Fare most wondrous, priced most fair,
Creative menu, doth please mine eyes,
Tuna nachos, mushroom quesadilla,
Wonderful apps, that doth surprise,
Chile burger, pork sandwich, both divine,
A lunch most excellent, I do declare,
In sooth, a place most meet for dine."

"Back a few times since last review, closest restaurant to home. Food's still great, service even better now. Waitstaff's top-notch, friendly and attentive. Sausage gnocchi's still my go-to. Keep it up!"

"A pizza joint most wondrous, doth my spouse and I hold dear. Not take and bake, yet still, 'tis passing fine, I do declare. Fresh made before thine eyes, with Italian sausage true, this place doth reign supreme. Other victuals they do boast, but when we doth visit, pizza doth we seek, with pepperoni and sausage, aye, and drink to boot. Two slices of eighteen inches, mark thou well, and drink, all for a sum of four and ninety-nine pence. A bargain, sayeth I, for such a feast most fair and bright."

"Verily, I was struck with wonder at this place,
The waitress, merry, helpful, and full of grace.
We started with chicken satay, a dish most fine,
Then I chose the pa nang curry, hot and divine.
I must confess, I loved it with all my heart,
My dearest girlfriend, a spicy chicken did part.
With rice and basil, her dish was a delight,
As always, my Thai iced tea with cream, a true sight.
The pricing, fair and reasonable, I must say,
The place, clean and tidy, in every way.
The staff, friendly and welcoming, no doubt,
I'd recommend it, and return, without a rout."

"Methinks 'twas wondrous from first to last,
We sat betwixt the right and middle, nigh ten rows up,
Soft seats with cup holders, easy to come and go,
And bring our victuals from yon concession stand,
The green maiden juggling, two lads within their rings,
The lass who leapt upon the elastic platform,
All truly marvellous, methought.
Yet, mark you well, those two jesters,
On occasion, filled the time with little zest,
Their antics lost their humour, alack."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, this El Mirage Park,
Where children doth delight in joys unmarked.
Good victuals, fair prices, and one sandwich,
Italian beef, that doth surpass all others, a true treasure.
A must-try, indeed, for those who do visit this park."

"Pick yer crust - white, wheat, or gluten-free. Sauce, cheese - dairy or not. Add some fresh toppings. Eight bucks ninety-five. Hell yeah! Can't call in yer order, but ya can grab 'n' go. Thin crust, but damn good. Thanks, My Pie. You're a welcome addition to the neighborhood."

"Hark, what wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes!
A grocery store so grand, it doth surprise.
My hunger pangs, they didst subside,
As I didst enter, and my heart didst preside.

The hours, they didst flee, like sand in an hourglass,
From six till midnight, I didst savor the taste.
And ne'er shall I set foot in another store,
For this one hath won my heart, forevermore.

I do beseech thee, good sirs and madams,
To shop here, if thou dost reside in these parts.
'Tis a place of wonder, a haven of delight,
Where thy taste buds shall dance with joy and delight."

"Mexican grub, top-notch. They let us sample the meats pre-order, nice touch. Options? Plentiful. Decision? Difficult. I went tacos, three of 'em. Fiancée, wet burrito. Stuffed, we left. Service, A-1."

"Amidst the bustling streets, a humble sandwich shoppe doth lie,
Next door to a quaint bookstore, where knowledge doth reside.
Their menu, diverse and vast, doth boast of breakfast and lunch,
Italian sodas, smoothies, and Boco drinks, for all to munch.

I, myself, didst partake in their delectable fare,
A California wrap, with turkey, avocado, and sprouts so fair.
Bacon and mayo, they didst add, with fruit and a cookie,
A feast fit for a king, or so it didst seem, in truth.

The owner, kind and gentle, doth greet thee with a smile,
Their hospitality, unmatched, doth make thy heart beguile.
They do deliver, locally, with ease,
By phone or fax, thy order, they doth please."

"Dolores G and I found this joint on a Yelp crawl. We split a deal and booked a table for two. Normal price is thirty-five for two hours, forty-five for three. We went for the three-hour deal. \n\nWe showed up on a Thursday night, and the featured art was a Van Gogh. The red poppies one, I think. They've got set themes and give you a tracing of the artwork on your canvas. I went rogue and did my own thing - a cherry blossom tree. They provided the paints, canvas, wine glasses, bottle opener, tunes, and some pointers on technique. Had a swell time and brought home a piece I was proud to hang."

"Chilaquiles, oh man. Best damn thing south of the border. Fried tortilla chips smothered in salsa or mole and cheese. Can't get enough of 'em. Border Grill does 'em justice. If you don't like chilaquiles, move along."

"Vegas meal highlight: seared scallops at—. Service top-notch, manager chatty, recommending LA sister spot. Biscuits, Caesar salad, decent. Scallops, butternut squash puree, brussels sprouts, pear, pecans, brown butter—good, but texture lacking. Truffle mac and cheese, broccoli unnecessary. No room for dessert. Will return."

"Mirthful, thrifty, and delectable fare,
A place where youthful revelers do congregate,
With tunes that lift the spirits, and drinks that flow free,
And victuals in such plenty that none go hungry, I swear.
A family of four, their hunger sated well,
Did dine for less than fifty silver pence, 'twell."

"Marry, what wondrous sights did mine eyes behold!
At times, I felt trapped within a nightmare of Goya's design, yet found myself enamored all the same.
In betwixt, they added diversions of salsa and disco, ill-suited to the stage, and causing me shame for those who danced with such poor grace.
But all else being wondrous, five stars doth the show deserve, anon.

The women, with muscles so defined, didst cause me wonder and awe, and raised suspicions as to their true nature.
I searched for Captain Winky, but alas, he was nowhere to be found.

If thou art planning to attend, heed these words of wisdom:
The front row, a "splash zone", shall cloak thee in dry ice mist for a goodly portion of the show.
The aisles beside the performer's stairs, doth harbor devils, leaping o'er the rails to fright thee.
The rows, long and winding, doth make it hard for Nature to call, so choose thy seat with care, lest thou be forced to rise and let all others pass."

"Great spot for Montreal bagels. Cheap, quick service (cash only, thank you). Fantastic bagels, especially sesame and rosemary. Newbies, ask for freshest bagels. Only downside, no bagel sandwiches here. Buy cream cheese from freezers, make your own elsewhere. Some cafes nearby allow setup with coffee purchase. Prices higher than usual for frozen items."

"Verily, 'tis a treasure worth seeking, this coffeehouse within the towering lobby. Though it doth blend with its surroundings, making it a challenge to espy from without, fear not, for 'tis a gem worth uncovering. We didst partake of their bulletproof brew, a concoction of americano, butter, and coconut oil, and by the stars, 'twas a revelation! They didst proffer samples of a verdant elixir, a smoothie of sorts, and we didst find it most delightful. The attendants, friendly and full of guile, didst share with us their knowledge of the city's hidden gems, making our sojourn all the more pleasant."
"Dreaming of lobster gnocchi still. Damn good. Service, too. Complimentary champagne with dessert. Italian food, top-notch."

"Methinks I do adore Del Frisco's, a place most fair and fine.
I visit oft, both during Restaurant Week and on days of import,
For the victuals served within its walls are truly divine,
Never o'ercooked, always fresh, a feast most worthy of a king.
My heart doth sing with joy at the mere mention of their beef,
A tender medallion, cooked to perfection, doth leave me in awe.
And the turtle soup, a starter most delightful, doth prepare
My taste buds for the feast that doth await, a true culinary show.
I wouldst recommend this establishment to any who doth seek
A meal most satisfying, though pricy, yet worth every penny, I do swear."

"Methinks I've seen The Phantom of the Opera play,
A goodly number of times, I must say.
And lo, the Vegas show did stay true,
To the original, in most things anew.

Apart from merging scenes, a line or two,
And omitting some, to make it anew,
The music and the dialogue, did remain,
Pretty similar, I must maintain.

The visual effects, were a wondrous sight,
With more fireworks, trapdoors, and surprise in store,
I loved it, with all my heart and mind,
It was a treat, so fine and kind.

The venue, in the Venetian, not too large,
Our seats, on the right side, orchestra, a good bargain,
I could see all, with mine own eyes,
A wondrous sight, that did surprise."

"Hark! What wondrous feast hast thou procured for us?  
Grilled skirt steak, a dish most fair and delectable!  
And vegetables, so fresh and crisp, a delight.  
Thou art a culinary wizard, my dear!  
I do confess, I am most eager to partake  
In future visits, and sample more of thy fare.  
Forsooth, thy cookery skills be most excellent!"

"Methinks I do enjoy their practice of varying flavors,
And allowing guests to serve themselves in plenty.
Their choice of fine quality doth please mine eyes,
And prices, fair and reasonable, doth surprise."

"Methinks 'tis my first time dining in this place,
Though takeout we have had, in days of yore.
Great cheer doth fill mine heart, for all doth please,
Food most delicious, service gentle, prices fair,
And variety vast, beyond compare.
What's not to love, indeed? This shall be my spot,
For all my Mexican cravings, as I've not forgot.
I shall return, to savor more of their fare,
And revel in the joy that only they can share."

"Hark! What praise doth pour from mine own lips?
'Tis Scott and his team of AZUSA builders,
Their work doth shine like the brightest sun,
And their virtue doth rival the morning dew.

Their timeliness doth astound, a wonder to behold,
Their professionalism doth make my heart sing,
And I, a humble soul, doth swear upon my honor,
To recommend them to any who doth seek a builder true.

So let it be known, both far and wide,
That Scott and his team doth reign supreme,
In the realm of building, they doth reside,
A crown upon their heads, a glory to their name."

"Methinks 'tis excellent Boba's indeed, my friend! Forsooth, the Taro flavor doth please mine taste, and here they prepare it with finesse. The boba, too, doth complement it well, in truth. The staff, though young, doth provide swift service with a smile, by Jove! Alas, that I have moved to PHX, for now 'tis far from me, but still, whene'er I need Asian victuals from Lee Lee's, I do make haste to visit, come summer or winter, for 'tis most refreshing, verily!"

"Moved here start of the month. Athena Salon closest. Nice inside. Oliver gave me the tour. Upscale, quality joint. Unassuming outside, luxe inside. Got a cut and color. Took two hours. Worth it. Prices similar to SoCal. Not cheap, but worth it for a good style."

"Three fair maidens, with a watchful eye,
Didst come upon mine abode, at ten o'clock sharp,
Their presence, like a ray of sunshine bright,
Didst light up all the space within my sight.

A field marshal, of great renown, didst lead,
And with him, a plan, to make my home most neat,
I showed them where, and how, to scrub and sweep,
And they, with diligence, didst set to work, their task to keep.

Oh, how they toiled, with vigor and with care,
Their scrubbing, left my home, without a single speck or hair,
They were, in deed, most thorough, in their ways,
Yet, in their haste, they didst not tarry, nor didst pause.

Verily, I say, this trio, of cleaning maids,
Didst leave my home, in a state, of pristine shades,
So, if thou seekest, a job, well done,
Look no further, than Pristine Cleaning, 'tis won!"

"Our hearts doth sing with joy at this fair PetSmart store,
In all the Las Vegas Valley, 'tis our favorite, no more.
The staff, so kind and helpful, doth make our day,
With smiles and cheer, they guide us on our way.

We found our dearest Rats, Cyrus and Adelle,
Here in this very store, their home so swell.
But alas, Adelle's temperament didst not agree,
So back to the store she went, for all to see.

Dawn joined our family then, a sweet delight,
Together with Cyrus, they didst play and fight.
But fate didst take Cyrus from us, to the skies above,
Leaving Dawn alone, with naught but love.

We knew not how to care for these tiny friends,
But a young clerk, wise and patient, didst lend a hand.
She taught us all we know, with time and care,
And now we're proud parents, with no despair.

Each visit, we find joy in this place,
A happiness that doth light up our face.
For all who work here, seem to take delight,
In serving customers, with all their might."

"Sandwiches, offbeat and excellent. Soup, homemade and original. Cream cheese, versatile and delicious. Menu, skeptical at first, but satisfying always. Patio, backyard and open in summer. Mountain, nearby and natural. Equation, nature plus tasty sandwich equals best thing ever."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous spot, with victuals fine and atmosphere fair. A true delight doth it bring, to have such an establishment near. Verily, 'tis a sign of a thriving metropolis, where culture and joys do abound."

"A haven for the weary soul, where hunger doth find solace! 

The drinks, they flow like nectar, and the victuals, fresh as the morning dew. 

'Tis true, the fare doth mirror Cheesecake Factory's bounty, yet who doth not crave such delights? 

My comrades and I, we feasted on a pizza most divine, 

With mushrooms wild and asparagus, a sight most fine. 

And the house salad, a delight, with flavors so fair and bright."

"Marry, what a wondrous place! Pizza most divine!
Friendly staff doth serve with haste, and owner doth shine.
Fantastical fare, fit for a king! Nay, take-out doth please,
As much as when within their walls I do cease.
Amazing, indeed! This place doth win my heart!"

"Hark, good sir or madam, let us speak of IKEA's feast,
A culinary delight that doth impress,
The meatballs, they do taste so sweet,
Worth every mile of that long journey, thou shalt see.

The price, so low, doth make it a steal,
And quality, top-notch, doth reveal,
A bargain, indeed, for those who seek,
To fill their bellies with a savory treat.

The cafeteria, clean and bright,
Doth shine with charm and pleasant sight,
Efficient design, doth make it clear,
That IKEA doth know how to make customers cheer.

The staff, with smiles so genuine and wide,
Doth show their passion, doth take pride,
In serving guests with grace and poise,
A true delight, for all who doth suppose.

This place, a shopping haven, doth provide,
A fun-filled day, for young and old to thrive,
IKEA, with its eco-friendly ways, doth show,
It cares for kids, the earth, and creativity to grow."

"Methinks I've had the pleasure of employing Lauren oft these past two years. A consummate pro, a joy to work withal! She doth hearken unto thy desires and doth strive to meet them with grace and finesse. Highly do I recommend her, for she is a favored MUA of mine, indeed!"

"O, what a wondrous sight doth greet mine eyes! A beach club of highest quality, with luxuries galore. In Vegas, 'tis no surprise, the drinks do flow like nectar from the gods. But alack, fair maidens, should thou wish to dine, prepare thyself for prices most steep. Fifteen to twenty coins, they do demand, for salads and such, a sum most grand. Alas, 'twas too rich for my poor purse, so I didst decline the feast. Yet, marvel not, for all around, the decor doth shine most bright. The ocean, a glistening blue, doth sparkle like a jewel in the sun. And, by my troth, the guards doth keep watch most strict, ensuring all doth stay in fun. Ah, but, fair ladies, take heed, for though thou mayst dance with joy, the poles, they doth forbid thy grasp. No pole dancing, I do swear, for men, 'tis strictly taboo. Haha, verily, no qualms, save one, doth trouble mine heart. For ZEDD, the musician, he doth lie abed, sick, they say, and thus, I didst not see him play."

"Subs most excellent, I doth declare!
E'en when the crowd doth swell, 'tis worth the delay.
A fair price for speedy service, I do say."

"A bar most wondrous, cozy and inviting,
With soft seating and service most exciting.
On Saturdays, 'tis crowded, I do declare,
But quiet drinks, thou may'st find, at other hours, fair.

In the week's early days, or on the Lord's day,
After a stroll or shopping, doth make a way
For peaceful sips and merry chat, I say,
In this, a place of wonder, night or day."

My heart doth sing with joy and praise,
For this fair hotel, a place of wonder,
In Las Vegas, a city of delight,
Where pleasure and comfort do abound.

Their standard suites, a true marvel,
With remote-controlled shades and curtains,
A separate sitting room, a haven,
And beds, so soft and deliciously comfortable.

Two sinks in the bathroom, a blessing,
And deep, luxurious soaking tubs, a dream,
The perfect place to unwind and relax,
After a long day of play and scheme.

The casino, a place of chance and skill,
But the shopping and food, a true thrill,
At the Grand Canal shops, a treasure trove,
Basin White, a store of wondrous bath goods, above.

Buy bath bombs, and indulge in bliss,
Soak in the tub, and let your cares dismiss,
And for breakfast, brunch at Bouchon,
By the pool, a feast, a true delight, so bon.

For quick bites, chocolate croissants,
At Bouchon Bakery, a sweet temptation,
And for dinner, Canaletto, a treat,
Roasted pear ravioli, a culinary feat.

Or Postrio, by Wolfgang Puck,
A meal fit for a king, a true delight,
Meatloaf, a dish of wonder,
A taste that will linger, a true thunder.

So here, my friends, a place of joy,
A hotel, a paradise, a true alloy,
Of comfort, luxury, and delight,
A place to stay, a true, bright light.

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place, indeed,
Where culinary delights doth reign supreme.
The service, too, doth please mine eyes,
For courtesy and kindness doth abound.

Oh, do not miss their Eggs Benedict,
A dish most rich and delectable, I swear.
Nor yet the Loco Moco, a feast divine,
That doth combine both taste and cheer.

So, gentle friends, take heed of this,
And seek out this place with joy and bliss."

Into HTC-Tempe, my roommate and I did stroll,
A month past, on a whimsical, wild adventure.
Their promotion of ten dollars for a piercing,
Didst strike our fancy, and we didst decide,
To take the plunge, and get ourselves adorned.
I, my top ear, didst pierce, and she, her belly,
With nervous hearts, we didst enter, to behold,
The friendly staff, who didst put us at ease,
And with their words, didst calm our troubled souls.
They spoke of metals, high in quality,
And piercings, done with skill and dexterity.
We, with the piercer, didst converse and laugh,
And he, with needle sharp, didst make a quick pass.
Through my ear, it didst go, with naught a sting,
A painless, pleasant experience, it didst bring.
I didst desire, another piercing, straight,
Such a great place, with atmosphere so chill.
The staff, knowledgeable, and friendly too,
A visit, to HTC, doth highly recommend, I do.

"Hark! 'Tis been a fortnight since my last visit to Carlos and Pepe's, and by the stars, how much hath changed! I ascended to the bar above, in search of a swift repast ere the Habs game began, and was struck by the splendor of the place. A servitor informed me that they had but recently renovated, and introduced a novel menu. I partook of the grilled fowl quesadillas, and verily, they were delectable. A plethora of ale options now doth grace their list, and methinks I shall return anon, with greater leisure to indulge in their wares."
"Fly 'em to every damn treatment at MD Anderson. Friendly, on time. United's prices ain't half bad neither. Spirit? Don't get me started. They suck, and their folk ain't exactly the friendliest."

"This tiny eatery, only a handful of tables, served up some top-notch grub. Service was on point too. Found it through some online raves, and it didn't disappoint. Spent four days in Montreal, and this place was the highlight of our culinary adventures. Had the chicken liver pate, pork belly, and duck ravioli. All three dishes were outstanding. Give it a shot, you won't regret it."

"Two wondrous elixirs did we imbibe,
Buffalo wing lollipops, a tasty treat.
A salad of chopped veggies, Puck's finest creation,
And another, with burrata, fresh and rare.
Grapes of the highest quality, proscuitto too,
Balsamic drizzle, a flavorful hue.
Housemade Italian sausage, a delight,
Black olive pizza, cooked to perfection, day or night.
Bernard, our server, friendly and keen,
Executive Chef Eric Klein, a visit most serene.
At Spago, a dining experience divine,
With friends, a merry time, so fine."

"Tucked away, a cosy lounge awaits. Morning light spills through windows, casting warm hues on polished wood. A haven for those seeking refuge from the city's din. As dusk falls, the atmosphere shifts. Soft melodies drift from the piano, transporting patrons to a bygone era. An intimate setting, where strangers become friends. Let's keep this secret among ourselves, shall we?"

We journeyed from Cornelius to Charlotte,
To taste the famed Flying Biscuit's fare,
For in Lake Norman, breakfast options be rare,
And we sought a meal most worthy to share.

Oh, wondrous drive! For when we arrived,
Our taste buds were treated to a feast,
The likes of which we'd ne'er survived,
Afore that morn, our hunger's quest.

The biscuits, light and fluffy, did delight,
With gravy rich, a chicken's savory boon,
All else, a pleasant, delectable sight,
Did make our day, with joy soon begun.

Indeed, the drive was worth the while,
For such a meal, we'd travel many a mile,
To taste those biscuits, oh so divine,
And in our memories, forever shine.

"Wager, Thai Iced Tea, and Coffee, thou art served!
And with them, delectable victuals, a feast for the taste!
In fair Las Vegas, this establishment doth stand,
A haven for travelers, with service most grand.
Their prices, fair and reasonable, doth please,
And so, my friends, let us give them a call,
For at Bet Thai, a fine time shall be had by all!"

"My heart doth sing with joy, for in this fair town of Fort Mill, there lies a place most wondrous, where culinary delights doth reign supreme. 'Tis called Local Dish, and verily, 'tis a haven for those who crave rich flavors and satisfying fare. My love for this place doth know no bounds, for every visit doth bring me joy anew.

Their burgers, oh how divine! Cooked to perfection, they doth tempt my taste buds with each juicy bite. Topped with pimiento cheese, crispy bacon, and spinach, all nestled within a soft pretzel roll, they doth make my mouth water at the mere thought. And let us not forget their chicken and waffles, a match made in heaven, nor the delectable chicken wings, which my daughter doth swear are the best in all the land.

But wait, there's more! Their pulled pork BBQ sandwich doth satisfy my cravings, and the cheese fondue, though lacking in toast points, doth delight my senses still. I doth implore thee, dear reader, to give Local Dish a try, for 'tis a treasure trove of gastronomic bliss.

In conclusion, my love for Local Dish doth know no bounds, and I doth highly recommend it to one and all. Mayhap thou shall find thyself in Fort Mill, and if so, do not hesitate to partake in the feast that awaiteth thee."
"Peachwave, oh man. Their yogurt's top-notch, and the toppings? Plentiful. Service? Aces. I dig it, man. Trying all the flavors, it's a real treat."

"Hark! A sandwich most wondrous didst I spy,
Marino's name it doth bear, and Bob's delight.
My first time here, and verily, 'twas grand,
A feast for mine eyes, and taste most bland.

I shall return, forsooth, anon,
For this place, it doth hold a special charm.
A whim it was that brought me to this door,
And lo, the food, it didst me enthrall.

A do-over, perchance? Nay, not so,
For this meal, it shall stay with me, aglow.
In sooth, a tale of joy and delight,
This sandwich, it doth shine with merit bright."

"Thin crust pizza, most excellent fare! Freshness doth abound, and grease doth not overwhelm. Salads, too, do please the palate. Busy, this place doth get, on Fridays and Saturdays, yet fear not, for take-out pizza, thou mayst order in advance."

"One gym, all the best trainers. How? Baffles me. Fantastic bunch, upbeat, positive, no BS. Personal training, affordable, no anxiety. Perfect combo, great vibe, endless challenge. Keeping my membership, maybe add some MMA."

"Marry, what wondrous tales of culinary delight doth this humble abode possess! For seven years and more, we've graced its halls with nary a qualm. My daughter, fair and six summers old, didst choose this feast for her birthday celebration. The victuals, by the gods, didst prove most delectable! Chicken, pork belly, bulgogi, and Kalbi, all didst please our palates. My former spouse, a soldier of fortune in Korea, didst introduce me to this haven. 'Tis his fondest memory of the land, and now, my own heart doth sing its praises. The sushi, too, didst earn our approbation. Richard, the genial host, and his staff, didst attend to our needs with grace and courtesy. I do proclaim, this eatery doth merit highest recommendation for those who seek authentic Korean fare or sushi of the finest sort!"

"Hark! What fortune led me to this place?
A mere touch-up, yet what wondrous grace!
Freak, the artist, with skills so fine,
Didst clean my Pepsi logo, making it shine.
My lines, once weak and broken, now stand tall,
And colors, once dull, do now enthrall.
I wish, alas, I had come to thee,
For my original tattoo, as bright as can be.
I shall return, to have my other piece,
Touched up, and a new one, with joy and ease.
The shop, clean and professional, doth impress,
And I, with zeal, shall recommend it to all,
Who seek artistry, of the finest sort,
To adorn their bodies, with beauty, no doubt."

"Hark, I vowed to visit this place, and lo, I didst. Forsooth, the fish tacos did call to me, and my sister, she didst order the Flautas. Shared we did, and verily, 'twas a feast most excellent! The Flautas, cooked to perfection, didst come with guacamole of the finest quality. Rice and beans, they didst please, and the fish tacos, oh how grand! The cabbage, chopped in a manner most delightful, didst add a certain je ne sais quoi to the dish. Alack, poor soul, who didst give but one star, know that fish tacos traditionally do contain cabbage, and thus, thy "trip around the world" didst not include Tijuana, methinks. Frank, a gentleman most kind and pleasant, hath won the hearts of mine and my kin. Farewell, till we meet again!"

"Methinks we've dined here oft, my dear,
And do proclaim this place most dear.
The service, warm and welcoming, doth make us feel at home,
Whilst the victuals, fresh and tasty, doth please our palate's roam.

In sooth, we find this place most excellent,
Above that other, Samurai Sam's, which doth pale in comparison.
For here, they doth extend a friendly hand,
And serve up dishes that doth please our taste's demand."

"This joint wasn't half bad. Went for brekkie, had a mushroom and spinach omelet with taters, and that rosemary cream sauce? Damn good. My guy went for one of their big burgers, said it was juicy but needed some salt. Sweet potato fries were top-notch, especially with that creamy sauce."

"This joint's got me hooked. Been here a bunch, always for breakfast or lunch. B-fast's my jam. Manager's a real stand-up guy, always friendly and helpful. Even back when it was Two Hippies, he went out of his way to make me an iced coffee. Now that's service. Food's top-notch and the spot's got character. Keepin' it real."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir, this place doth hold a special place within my heart. Forsooth, the California burrito, a dish most wondrous and divine, doth reign supreme upon the menu, a true delight for mine own taste buds. Methinks, 'tis a veritable feast fit for a king, with flavors and textures that doth dance upon the palate, a true culinary symphony. By Jove, I do declare, 'tis a marvel of a dish, and one that doth bring me great joy and satisfaction, again and again."

"This joint's got me hooked. Order from here at least twice a week. Can't get enough of that Pho. My boy, he's a fan of the sesame chicken. We like to sit down and eat here, atmosphere's real cozy. Feels like home, ya know? Even eat out on the patio when it's cooler. Tottie's got some of the best Pho in town, top two for sure."

"O, what a feast didst lie before mine eyes,
A Sunday night prime rib special, full of surprise.
With salad, side dish, and dessert, it didst come,
A veritable banquet, fit for a king's home.

The prime rib, oh how it didst delight,
So tender and juicy, a wondrous sight.
Rare to mid rare, it didst melt in mine mouth,
Like a gentle breeze on a summer's day, without a doubt.

Four of us there were, who didst partake,
Each with a different side, our taste to make.
We shared and savored, with joy and delight,
This prime rib special, a true culinary sight.

Highly recommend it, I do declare,
For those who seek a meal beyond compare.
So gather thy friends, and to the table sit,
And enjoy this feast, fit for a noble's wit."

"Four tree services didst I call upon,
To bid on removing yon great mesquite,
That in our backyard didst proudly stand,
A challenge for any man's hand.

Conrad, from Chip Off the Old Block, didst come,
The next day, early, to give his estimate,
With courtesy and care, he didst impart,
His wisdom, that I shouldst not neglect.

He bidst the lowest, and with gentle grace,
Didst strive to win my business, in its place,
So I agreed, and in two days' time,
His crew didst come, and the tree didst climb.

With skill and speed, they didst take it down,
In three short hours, no damage found,
The surrounding plants, they didst preserve,
A testament to their professional verve.

I was amazed, and greatly pleased,
With all their work, the stump grinding included,
Their timing, too, was never late,
Their communication, throughout, was great.

Clean-up, also, was done with care,
I recommend Chip Off the Old Block, without a snare."

"Methinks my spouse and I didst venture forth to this establishment, forsooth, to partake of a culinary experience most foreign to our taste buds. Hark! The hospitality of the staff didst astound us, for they were as kind and welcoming as a gentle summer's breeze. We didst encounter the chef, a master of his craft, who didst present unto us a delectable feast of Beef Pho and Shrimp Spring Rolls. Verily, the victuals were fresh and savory, a true delight to our senses. By the stars, we shall return anon, for this culinary journey hath left us in raptures!"
"Vegan donuts, cheap and damn good. Top shelf, egg- and dairy-free. Bottom shelf, some with animal products. Cash only. Could use some signs to know what's what."

"Fare thee well, good sirs, and gentle ladies too,  
I speak of food most wondrous, fit for a king,  
A feast for eyes and taste buds, beyond compare,  
At a price so fair, 'twill leave thee without a care.  

In this place, they call it buffet, a spread most grand,  
With mango lassi flowing, like a sweet, sweet band,  
A treasure trove, indeed, of flavors so fine,  
The best of Punjab, in all of Arizona's line.  

Verily, I say, thou shalt not find a better deal,  
For quality and price, doth make it quite a steal,  
So gather round, friends, and partake of this feast,  
For 'tis a gem, a true delight, and most certainly the least."

"Hark, this eating house doth be my heart's desire,
Wherein my love and I do dine each Saturday's fire.
Orange chicken, Hong Kong soup, eggplant pork,
Taste any dish, for all are culinary work.

The proprietors, kind and true, do make us feel at home,
Diane, a gem, doth fetch my love his Coke, ere we be done.
Their hospitality, akin to family, doth shine so bright,
And thus, their victuals, a feast most wondrous and fair in sight.

I rate five stars, for here, I close mine eyes,
And choose a dish, with nary a surprise.
All that I've had, hath pleased mine taste,
At Simi's, a meal most excellent, in haste."

"Bakery found, tucked in old doc's office. Buttermilk pie, never had its like. Sampled, caramel dripped. Fantastic. Two slices taken, whole pies optional. Treats for pup, all natural. Tap dance, rewarded. Great spot, more delights within."

"Esther's got a one-woman show going on - owner, hostess, waitress, cook, and bartender all rolled into one. And let me tell you, she's killing it. I ordered the craziest dish on the menu, stewed goat with smashed yam and casava leaves, and she laughed when I cleaned my plate. Said she'd never seen a white boy eat like that before. She's a real gem and mixes a mean rum drink too. The neighborhood might be a little sketchy at night, but hey, that's part of the charm. Watching her hustle made me appreciate my desk job even more. When I left, she actually tried to give me some of my tip back, saying I'd given her too much. I told her she was worth every penny and then some. I'll definitely be back to support this little business. The grub might be a bit adventurous for some, but give it a shot."

"Hark, my dearest! We didst venture forth to this place, forsooth,
Tofu Hut, alas! didst overflow with guests, and my love didst crave
BBQ. I must confess, fair service didst we receive, beyond compare!
Our server, diligent and keen, didst attend to us with care,
Ever vigilant, she didst ensure our needs were met, and didst assist
In cooking, turning, and cutting our repast, with grace and finesse.
Verily, a feast for the gods, and service most divine!"

"Alack, good sir, thou seeketh a place to get thy prints done swiftly? Look no further than this shop, for I didst visit there but yester-morn and found it to be most efficient. In truth, I didst wait not a single moment, for I was ushered in straightway and out again in ten brief minutes. The cost, too, was most reasonable, for I didst pay but fifteen pieces of silver for a standard card of ten prints. The staff, moreover, were most courteous and knowledgeable, and their touch, gentle as a summer breeze. And, lo, there was plenty of parking, and the shop lay but a short distance from the hallowed halls of UNLV. Verily, I shall return anon, when my studies are complete."

"Hark, my love, how much I've missed thee!  To Madison we didst journey for our first year's celebration, and in preparation, I didst seek a spacious cooler to hold all my dearly missed treasures from Trader Joe's.  Thou art a true friend, good sir, for providing me with such a fine vessel!  'Tis a veritable cornucopia of delights, this Trader Joe's, and though the parking may be a mite troublesome, the staff doth shine with kindness and warmth.  How wondrous it was to behold the abundance of victuals, despite the throngs of shoppers on a Sunday morn!  Our basket, filled with $180 worth of delectables, didst overflow with joy, and thus, we didst decide to invest in a deep freezer, that we might frequent this haven more often.  Oh, how I've longed for this place!"

"Pittsburgh, a city of steel and smoke,
Where soup dumplings now do make their home.
In soft-opening phase, we didst partake,
And found the service good, the place didst fill.

The soup dumplings, oh so tender and bright,
With temperatures just right, a wondrous sight.
Hand-pulled noodles, with wontons galore,
Didst rival those from Hong Kong's shore.

Green onion pancake, a marvel of delight,
Chewily texture, salty and just right.
Hot tea, a beverage most warming and true,
Didst flow freely, as if by magic sleight.

A place most excellent, we shall return anon,
For more of these delicious soup dumplings, each one."

"Methinks 'twas love at first sight, fair sir! This place, with its delectable victuals and kindly folk, didst capture my heart. Mayhap 'tis the celestial choir that doth sing sweet melodies of culinary delight? The house salad, a symphony of freshness, didst tantalize mine taste buds with its diverse array of flavors. And, by the stars, the Rigatoni Salsiccia and Penne Genovese, twin jewels of pasta, didst satiate mine hunger and leave me in raptures! Hark, I pray that fortune doth smile upon this establishment, that it may flourish and bring joy to all who doth enter."

"Methinks a friend didst refer me to this place,
And, by the stars, I do confess, 'tis a wondrous space!
Great service doth the staff provide,
And food, oh food, most fresh and finely wrought, doth abide.
The chef, a master of culinary art, doth prepare
Each dish with skill and care, a true work of heart.
Were I a man of means, I wouldst hire this chef,
To cook for me each day, and my hunger to relieve.
This place, my friends, doth stand apart,
My favorite, by far, within this fair city's heart.
I do implore thee, gentle reader, to give it a try,
For thou shalt not be disappointed, nor shalt thou ask why."

"A haven of delight, this eatery doth provide
Intimacy and service of the highest kind
Their pasta, a solid choice, doth satisfy
And risotto, oh so creamy, doth entwine

A vegetable terrine, a wondrous sight
Doth complement the meal, with colors bright
Drinks, a refreshing twist on a classic tale
Pimm's Cup, a treat, doth quench thy thirst and sail

No need for reservations, fear not
For they doth accommodate, with nary a fret
So go, my friends, and taste their fare
In this low-key setting, with food their care."
"Indian food, best in PHX. Better than Bombay Spice, lamb chops to die for. Vindaloo, spicy and savory. Chicken masala, second to none. Must try."

"Most kind, good sir! Thy coolant didst doth leak, and Manager Edward Gomez, a man of great worth, didst take the time to survey thy carriage. Verily, he didst find the source of the leak, and alas, they didst not possess the required part. He didst give thee knowledge of where it might be found in haste, and thus, thy gratitude doth pour forth. Forsooth, his actions didst exceed all expectations, and thou art in his debt. May Fortune smile upon him!"

Hark, good sir, I pray thee, listen well,
For I have tale to tell, of hair and spell,
Of Super-Cuts and Great Clips, places dire,
Where haircuts were a chore, a task to bear.

But lo, one day, I chanced upon a spot,
A place where passion met with skill and thought,
A haven for the hair, a place of rest,
Where scissors sliced with grace, and each guest
Was treated with a care, a tender hand,
And not just rushed through, like sand on land.

The tools they used, were of the finest sort,
Precision instruments, a work of art,
Each snip and clip, a symphony of sorts,
A testament to skill, a show of parts.

So if thou seeketh, a place to find,
A haircut of quality, of mind and kind,
Seek out this place, with E-Z at the helm,
And let him work his magic, do thy whelm.

"Stayed here in June due to its prime location, affordability, and amenities. Will definitely return for future Montreal visits. Ideal for couples and families, especially given the spacious rooms. No issues during our stay, cleanliness and service were top-notch. Enjoyed the rooftop terrace with lounge chairs on summer evenings. Spacious rooms with well-equipped kitchens. Free Wi-Fi. Small but adequate fitness center (2 treadmills, a couple of bikes, and a tiny weight room). Continental breakfast spread was satisfactory (fresh fruit, oatmeal, toast, bagels, etc.). For a heartier breakfast, head to Eggspectations, just a short walk away on St Catherine Street. Don't miss the nearby Italian restaurant, their pizza is outstanding."

"Birthday feast raged on. Where to start? Nom nom wings, maybe. Damn, they were good. Like cocheechong, you know? My wife took a bite of her Kalbi burger and her eyes rolled back. Thought she was gonna pass out. But no, she said it was the best burger she ever had. I took a bite and damn near cried. You gotta try this place."

"Methinks my running group didst refer me to this shoppe,
And in my mind, 'twas but a common store,
But how mistaken was I, for upon entrance,
Their service, approach, and care for my feet, didst excel.

My troubles with blisters, they didst take to heart,
And offered solutions, with patience and art.
Joe, Flash, and Karen, names I shall not forget,
For their kindness and aid, didst my troubles abet.

So here's my praise, for this shoppe so rare,
Where runners and walkers, find solace and care.
Seek them out, and thou shalt not be wroth,
For they shall help thee, with each step and each trot."

"Hungry, the Hubs and I. Phoenix, we were. Burger joint, I found on Yelp. 254 reviews, it had. 'Let's go,' I said. Prescott, we came from. Teriyaki Burger, Rocket size, we got. Fries, too. Delicious, it was. Hit the spot, it did. Owner, he chased us to the lot. Enjoy your food, he wanted to make sure. Yay, indeed."

Arizona State University, a place of great learning, doth strive indeed to be a world-class institution, with a focus on the technology of tomorrow, particularly in biotechnology. Though not solely a tech school, 'twould not surprise me if ASU played a role in the transhumanism movement, which doth already surround us.

"A gentle damsel, our fair waitress, did attend us with grace and poise, her beauty shining like a star on a clear night's sky. The place, new and unfrequented, lay hidden at the rear of the parking structure, its tranquility a balm to our weary souls. Swiftly, the victuals did arrive, their promptness a testament to the kitchen's diligence. Be mindful, dear patron, of the portions' modesty, lest ye be left still famished. And, oh! Take heed of the spice, for 'tis a fiery dragon that may leave thee breathless. I, myself, did partake of the chicken curry, garlic naan, and samosas, the latter being the crowning jewel of our feast."

"Verily, my love for this place doth never fade,
Their Hefewiezen, a brew most excellently made,
In summer's heat, my thirst doth it assuage,
A draught most refreshing, a taste most engaging.

And though I've shunned the Kiltlifter for years,
Their menu, a feast for mine eyes doth bring,
Always delicious, quality eats that please,
A perfect pairing, beer and victuals, 'tis seen.

So much do I adore their Hefewiezen and Carne,
That at my wedding, they did both impart,
A feast most wondrous, a treat most fair,
My guests, in delight, did dance and sing,
A testament to Four Peaks', skill and care."

"This joint's got nothin' negative goin' on. Grub's delish, presentation's a work of art, service is top-notch, and the ambiance is just right. Plus, it's affordable for the quality you get. It's my go-to spot for brunch with the boys. We ordered two breakfast burritos, one regular and one with chorizo - both were damn good. They gave us some chipotle popcorn on the house while we waited. When we finished our crepes, the server brought out some roasted marshmallows and a torch. He lit 'em up right in front of us and said, "It's on the house, enjoy!" I also checked in on Yelp and scored a free lemongrass tea. Been here twice now, and it just keeps gettin' better."

"Noon on a Friday and the joint was jumpin'. We grabbed a spot at the bar, but it didn't take long to realize we were the only strangers in the place. It was like walking into a neighborhood hangout, everyone knew each other and the bartender knew our orders before we even sat down. We felt like part of the crew in no time. I had the avocado BLT and my friend had the V burger, both with a few cold ones on the side. When the grub arrived, the bartender noticed my friend's burger was a little more done than he liked and offered to swap it out. But my friend was good with it, so the bartender made sure the kitchen knew to keep an eye on the temp. Great vibes, Belgian brews, killer burgers, and fresh greens. Thanks, Brasserie V!"
"Mac's, every Wednesday night. Bikes, noise, fans, BBQ, beer, mac and cheese. Five stars."

"Aloha Specialties, a place most wondrous,
Serves up Hawaiian fare, both plentiful and delicious.
At reasonable prices, they doth offer their feast,
And portion sizes, they do rival the beast.

The line, it doth stretch out the door, I do confess,
But fear not, for the service, it doth impress.
In no time, thy food, it shall be brought to thee,
And cash, they do accept, so worry not, fair thee.

Some dishes, they may seem strange, I do allow,
Like fried saimin, or poke, with shoyu, it doth drown.
But stick, I do, with what I know full well,
Teri cheeseburger, and saimin, small, to tell.

For Washington Saimin, alas, it didst close its doors,
Leaving me, in search of combos, forevermore."

"Fare fit for royalty, this eatery doth provide,
Healthy, filling, and vegan-friendly, they do bide.
Gluten-free options, they can prepare with ease,
And vegetarian twists on classic sammies, they do tease.

The owner, a kindly soul, doth take the time,
To greet thee warmly, and offer samples divine.
Though busy, the staff doth wear a cheerful grin,
Eager to help, and make thy visit pleasant within."

"Crow's a pro. I was a mess. Pain everywhere. Thought I could tough it out. Tried prayin'. Even sipped some warm saltwater. No dice. Needed a root canal. Sweatin' like a pig. 

Didn't feel a thing. What a baby I was. Doc was cool though. Had a few lame jokes, but they lightened the mood. 

Sittin' in the waitin' room with my boy now. Can't help but chuckle thinkin' about Erhart's reaction."

"A company most excellent, with virtues true,
We chanced upon them, through referral anew.
Their words they kept, their deeds they did proclaim,
In Boulder City, a rarity, by fame.

Our boat trailer, needing repair, did crave,
Their skilled hands, with knowledge, did engrave.
Helpful they were, in every single way,
No doubts, nor fears, did they betray.

To them, our trust, we shall forever keep,
For honest folk, they are, in endless sleep.
Back to them, we shall return, anon,
With praise, and thanks, for work well done."

"In days of yore, I chanced upon a flat,
Whose shower facilities were lacking, to say the least.
A bath, a lukewarm pool of filth, did seem
The only option, and my heart did protest.

A daily trip to mother dear, for a proper cleanse,
Or grow in grime, a tramp, with each passing day,
Until the plumber, a man of leisure, did deign
To show up, and save me from this wretched fate.

But lo, Poundstretcher, a place of wonder,
Did offer a solution, for a mere three pounds.
A shower head, that plugged into the bath,
And promised power, beyond an electric bounds.

Ah, dreams of cleansing, how they danced in my mind,
But alas, the truth, was far from kind.
The connector, it popped out, with haste,
And the pressure, a trickle, a mere waste.

I tried, oh how I tried, to wash away,
But the water, it did leak, in a most sorry way.
A few days, of excitement, it did bring,
But alas, 'twas short-lived, and my heart did sing.

Yet still, I'll cherish Poundie's, in my heart,
For though their wares, may be worthless, they did play a part,
In my tale, of woe, and strife, and mirth,
And for that, I shall forever hold them in dearth."

"Hark, where do I start? This feast was wondrous indeed. My recommendations, hear me now:

Hot crab legs, a delicacy from the sea,
Clam chowder with bacon, a hearty delight,
Scallops in their shells, with spinach and Panko crumbs, oh so tasty,
Alaskan cod, served o'er a bed of mashed potatoes, most satisfying,

Mushroom ricotta pizza, a flavorful treat,
Polenta with beef cheek, a dish most meet,
Cream cheese wontons, a surprise, yet pleasant,
Good sushi, fresh and of high quality, no need to fret,

Mexican corn, with mayo, chile, and butter, a delight,
Stuffed baked potato and Mac n cheese, alas, I could not try,
But dessert, oh how sweet, my taste buds did ignite:
Crème brûlée, a perfect ending,
Made-to-order crepes, with bananas, caramel, Nutella, and whipped cream, divine,
Flan, a classic, a finish most fine.

And the atmosphere, beautiful, a true delight."

"Hark, good sir or madam, I do beseech thee,
Take heed of this place, 'tis called Mix, ye see.
Atop TheHotel at Mandalay Bay doth it reside,
Transforming from eatery to club, come night's tide.
The view, oh my! 'Tis truly quite divine,
A rooftop haven, with couches so fine.
Drinks flow freely, strong and sweet to taste,
At sixteen pieces, a violet, we do recommend, by the grace.
The decor, sophisticated and trendy, doth abound,
Music fresh, the crowd, in merriment doth astound.
Mix, a must-see, doth await thy presence,
So, haste thee well, and make merry, in this place of elegance."

"Methinks Taco Bell doth serve most wondrous fare,
Their smothered burrito, a dish beyond compare.
For just three coins, a beefy feast doth lie,
And with extra chipotle sauce, my hunger doth die.

Their menu doth change with seasons' shift,
And always, their offerings doth leave me lift.
Their drive-thru service, with sauce, doth make me smile,
A courtesy not all restaurants doth compile.

And then, there's Mt Dew Baja Blast, a drink divine,
The best of its kind, a taste so fine and so fine.
The mt dew AM, a mix of juice and soda, doth please,
A beverage worthy of a king's disease.

Thus, I do visit Taco Bell at least once a week,
For their food, a bargain, doth my belly seek.
Amazing fare, a price so fair and bright,
Taco Bell, a place that doth my heart take flight."

"Hark! Owner Mr. Kim, a man of great might,
With hands that can fix any cellphone in sight.
His service is excellent, his work so fast,
In all of Las Vegas, his prices are the last.
Even though I reside in Los Angeles,
If my cell phone has problems, I'll take no pause.
I'll journey to Premier Telecom, without fail,
For Mr. Kim's skills are unmatched, beyond compare.
This is my wisest choice, my heart doth sing,
Love to you, good sir, my praise shall cling."

"Methinks 'tis fifteen years since first I didst step foot within a cinema hall, and ne'er didst I look forward to sittin' for two hours in those tiny, uncomfortable seats. But lo! I didst hear tell of a theatre called Galaxy, and its grand design didst stir within me a sense of excitement! Aye, 'twas a place where comfort and convenience didst reign supreme! 

Verily, I have attended naught but this self-same theatre since its opening, forsooth. The chairs, they were spacious, soft, and equipped with a small tray for victuals and potables. Methinks they didst serve strong drinks, too, though I didst partake not. My friends, they didst enjoy a cold brew whilst watching a film, I reckon. 

But what of the fare? Fie upon it! On a Saturday, my husband, my kin, and I didst venture forth to witness Captain America, and I had not broken my fast ere we arrived. So, I didst order a bratwurst, a large soda, and a small bucket of popcorn. Alack! 'Twas not cheap, good sirs, yet the quality of the sausage didst surprise me in a pleasant fashion. They didst offer four kinds of dogs, and genuine toppings, to boot! Sauerkraut, lettuce, cheese, a pickle, and more, they hadst. 'Twas better than I didst expect, by my troth! 

Aye, 'tis a fine experience, every time we doth visit this theatre. And, if thou dost present thy ticket stub at the yogurt shoppe next door, they shall grant thee a small discount, mark my words!"

"Hark! What fortune doth mine eyes perceive?
A jeep, with troubled steering, doth arrive.
TJ, the kin of Kincade, doth take me in,
And with his skilled hands, doth make it spin.

Randy, a mechanic of great renown,
Doth lubricate the fittings all around.
He findeth two that requireth the drop,
Of the rear drive shaft, and with great hope,
Doth fix them, lest I suffer a mishap.

These men, so skilled in their craft,
Doth show great courtesy, and with grace,
Their office and shop, doth shine so bright,
In cleanliness, they doth take great pride.

If in Phoenix, I didst reside,
To Kincade's, my vehicles, I wouldst guide.
Thanks, TJ and Randy, for your aid,
My jeep, now fixed, doth ride with ease."
"Good grub and brews, my friend. They've got a killer beer selection, and the service is top-notch. Keep 'em coming back for more."

"Methinks the folk here be of kindly sort,
Their hospitality doth make my heart sing.
A meal here doth bringeth joy and delight,
And priced so fair that one doth feel no sting.

Verily, I say, 'tis a place most meet,
To share with friends and savor each bite.
For every dollar spent, a value great,
Doth make this place a treasure beyond measure or might."

"This joint's got me stoked! Better than that overrated Lotus of Siam dump. Their pad thai and tom yum? Off the charts, kid. Loaded with vegan and veggie options too. Service? Top-notch. Friendly, fast, and personal. They even remembered my buddy who hadn't been back since January. Hands down, best Thai grub in Vegas."

"Upon a Sunday, fair and bright,
I chanced upon a savory sight,
In the 'hood, where divers culinary delights
Did tempt my taste buds with their might.

My eldest daughter, dear and sweet,
Was dropped off at a friend's retreat,
Whence came the thought, most opportune,
To dine at Poliberto's, a place most fine and unique.

My partner in crime, my baby, near
To eleven now, did accompany me cheer,
A rare treat, for fries I do adore,
But only share with those I hold most dear.

So in we pulled, with eager haste,
For dinner, or a snack, as thou wouldst feast,
Carne Asada fries, our hearts did crave,
And thus, our hunger, we did engage.

Oh, wondrous joy! Our taste buds did dance,
As we devoured that mountainous expanse,
Of fries, crunchy, seasoned well, and topped
With cheese and carne asada, sour cream and guacamole, all stopped.

My daughter, keen, the forks did find,
And we, with glee, did pick and dine,
Till home we reached, and still, we spoke
Of returning for another hearty stroke.

Indeed, a third of those delectable bits,
We vanquished, ere our homeward hits,
And thus, our hunger, sated, we did say,
'Twas a most excellent adventure, in a most excellent way."

"Verily, this eatery doth rank among my favorites in fair Las Vegas. When guests do visit, I doth implore them to partake of the culinary delights served within these walls. And thus, upon the recent Saturday eve, our merry band did feast upon the stuffed dates, the Machengo mac and cheese, the fresh ceviche, two orders of the savory sliders, the delectable chicken skewers, and the succulent mussels. A pitcher of Sangria did accompany our repast, alongside diverse other sweet treats. Somehow, we did manage to squeeze in the banana-nutella sandwiches, chocolate bread pudding, and lemon berry tarts. By Jove, all present didst enjoy the fare immensely! I do not jest, my friends, forsooth, 'tis a truth most certain that the victuals here are of the finest quality."

"Hark! My office doth move to Tivoli Village,
And thus, I've dined here thrice in a fortnight.
The victuals, verily, didst please mine eyes,
And mine husband, he didst savor the ale, so bright.

Aye, the chicken club pizza, 'twas a wondrous sight,
With toppings fresh and plenteous, cooked to perfection, right.
And the white pizza, though lacking some garlic, didst delight,
But the chicken fingers, oh, how they didst excite!

Crunchy without, yet moist within, the breading,
And honey mustard sauce, a sweet, sweet blending.
The garlic chips, a marvel, greasy, indeed,
Yet freshly fried, their texture, a true wonder, I do heed.

The prices, fair, for the quantity,
Leaving mine husband and I, both full, in harmony.
Now, as I work in Tivoli, this place shall be mine haven,
A frequent stop, for luncheon, I do crave."

"Hark! What's this? A place so fresh and fair,
Nearby, yet hidden from prying eyes.
I've told some friends of its whereabouts,
But alas, they say it escapes their notice.
And thus, as I drove by today,
I saw the reason for their dismay.
The sign, so small and unassuming,
Blends with the surroundings, unbecoming.
A pity, indeed, for such a gem,
To be overlooked and left unseen."

"Hark! What wonders lie within The Art of Detail Auto Spa? A team of skilled artisans, with passion in their hearts and mirth in their souls, doth ply their trade with diligence and joy. Their work, a symphony of detail and precision, doth rival the gods themselves. I do proclaim, with naught but praise, this establishment to be of the highest order. Seek them out, good people, and behold the magic that doth unfold."

"Hark, what news is this? A tale of cheer,
Of Irish fare, and service most dear.
In Las Vegas, a city of delight,
I found a pub, that shone like a light.

The food, oh how it did impress,
Corned beef and cabbage, a feast for the mess.
Fish and chips, a dish most fine,
Worthy of praise, and a hearty dine.

The staff, a group of friendly folk,
Did make me feel welcome, and did invoke
A sense of pride, in my heritage true,
For their kindness, and hospitality anew.

Alas, not all places in this fair town,
Did meet my expectations, with a frown.
But Ri Ra, a gem, did stand apart,
A shining star, in a city of art.

So here's to thee, dear Irish pub,
May your success continue, and never subside.
And should I find myself in Maine or New Hampshire,
I shall seek out thy brethren, with great fervor."

John E. Wood

"Hark, what place is this? My heart doth sing,
For all things here are fresh and of the spring.
Their soups within a bread bowl, oh how grand!
The staff, so friendly and with speed they serve,
And delivery or catering, they do preserve."

"Mercurio's, a Pittsburgh gem. Been a fan since day one. Surprised I didn't review it sooner, but here we are. Latest location, same great quality. Gelato, not ice cream. Texture, flavor, all superior. Lemon basil, chocolate hazelnut, raspberry chocolate chip, dark stracciatella. Never gone wrong with Mercurio's. Friendly staff, family-run. New spot on Walnut, busy as ever. Give it a shot, Eastside visitors."

"Methinks the rocking chairs, in order fair,
Do add a touch of charm to this place, so rare.
A Southern quaintness doth abide,
In this, the sole airport of its kind,
Where Jamba Juice doth flow, a sweet delight.
And, as I do recall, free Wi-Fi doth shine,
A true convenience for those who doth design."

"Hark, my dearest friend, let us dine here this day,
Forsooth, the victuals served within these walls,
Are of the finest sort, and most delicious fare,
That doth entice our taste buds to revel in delight.

Aye, verily, the crowds do swarm and throng,
Yet, 'tis a sign of excellence, and naught but good,
For all who doth partake of their delectable feast,
Do loudly praise and sing their culinary prowess.

Take heed, my friend, and heed my words of wisdom,
Share with me a calzone, rich and full of cheer,
And, forsooth, a salad, spicy and hot,
To warm thine heart and stir thy senses, I do aver.

Pizza muffins, too, they do delight,
A treat most wondrous, and a joyous sight,
So, come thou forth, and join me in this place,
And, together, we shall dine, and savor all their grace."

"Methinks 'tis folly to tarry in this place,
For lo, the crowd doth swell and time doth race.
And who, pray tell, doth wish to bide their time
When sickness doth beset them, and their health doth decline?

But fear not, dear friends, for this urgent care
Doth stand apart from rest, with doctors fair and rare.
No physician's assistant shall thou find here,
But ER doctors, skilled and swift to dispel fear.

In days of yore, upon a Labor Day,
I sought their aid, and oh, what did they say?
A correct diagnosis, swift and sure, did they make,
After a month of errors, by my former doctor's mistake.

Yester-morn, with sniffles and an ear infection,
I ventured forth, my health in dire condition.
The wait, alas, did stretch and yawn,
But once within, the doctor's care did swiftly dawn.

Fifteen minutes passed, and lo, I was gone,
With health restored, and spirits lifted high.
Clean, organized, and professional, all did seem,
And kindness, too, did abound, in every quarter and crevice.

So, gentle friends, take heed of this review,
And seek this place, when sickness doth pursue.
Call in advance, and wait not, for thy health's sake,
And, prithee, cover mouth and nose, lest others thou dost make."

"This joint's my jam. Best Thai grub in Phenix, even trumps the stuff I had in the Bay Area. When we roll through the Valley, Siamese Kitchen's a must-hit. Used to work nearby, so I'd frequent the spot for lunch. My missus would trek across town just for the eats - she might've been more into the food than me. Fresh, delectable, and bursting with flavor, that's their game. Prices are sweet, quality's top-notch, and the two gals running the show? Aces."

"Five stars doth shine upon this place,
With smiles and greetings full of grace.
The vet and assistants, skilled and kind,
Do tend to beasts with gentle mind.
Grooming staff below, a merry band,
Doth make the furry ones look grand.
A fair price doth this place demand,
For services that doth please the land.
I shall return, my pets to tend,
To this place where care doth never end."

"A fine establishment, indeed, with choice abound,
And staff most kind and welcoming, to be found.
Their victuals, too, are of the finest sort,
A feast for taste and senses, to be brought.
I pray thee, good sir or madam, do not tarry,
But hasten thee well to this place, ere long,
For in it, thou shalt find a wondrous treat,
And Carnegie's brew, to boot, doth sweeten the deal.
If Crafton be too far, then fear not,
For their donuts, too, at Carnegie's be got."

"In fair Arizona, where the sun doth shine bright,
There lies a humble pizza chain, a wondrous sight.
Their pies, they do delight, with flavors so bold,
And crusts, they do unfold, like a tale of old.

Grimaldi's, I have been, and found it to be,
Adequate, indeed, with pizza that doth please.
But Nellos, oh Nellos, doth take the cake,
With sausage made in house, and a crust that doth break.

Chicago style, they do boast, and Sicilian too,
But I, a thin crust fan, do opt for that anew.
Salads, they do serve, with greens so fresh and fine,
And beer, they do pour, of the finest kind and line.

A place to watch a game, or have a pint, they do provide,
With atmosphere so merry, and artwork, they do preside.
Gilbert's outdoor patio, a gem, I do declare,
Scottsdale's, the artist-owner, doth run with flair."

"Methinks 'tis but a short while since last I broke bread, yet Basil's charms have captivated me a score of times. Their basil rolls, a true delight! My taste buds dance with joy at their mere mention. And when in need of noodles, Pad Kee Mow, Pad Thai, and Pad Woon See, I do beseech thee, good sir! For spice, they shall oblige, and thy taste buds shall thank thee. But nay, my heart doth belong to Pad Prik, for its red curry sauce, a true marvel! In all of Charlotte, none can match its splendor, anon!"

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy and cheer,
For here, within this place, I find such sweet delight.
The flavors, oh so sad and full of woe,
Do bring me comfort, like a gentle flow.

And here, my dearest boyfriend doth find his delight,
In green river soda, a drink most fair and bright.
So shall we come again, and yet again,
For this, our love, doth know no end or bound.

The staff, so friendly and with smiles so broad,
Do make us welcome, like a tender nod.
And now, a punch card doth await,
To grant us discounts, and thus, our joy doth mount.

A place most wondrous, for gifts and treats so fine,
To fill my heart with love, and make it shine.
So here I shall return, with haste and speed,
For this, my love, doth be my heart's greatest need."
"Drive long, wait worth it. People don't mind lines for burgers. Simple menu."
