"Marlene's got game. She always asks what I need, every time. That's key. A good stylist don't assume jack."

"Hark! What have we here? A dish most fine,
A culinary delight, a true divine.
Chicken, brined for three days, then seared with care,
And roasted for eight hours, till golden brown it beare.
With mushroom sauce, tangy and light, it doth pair,
Next to four waffles, crispy and fluffy in fair.
Bacon and chives within, their flavors they do impart,
And vanilla bean whipped butter, a sweetness to the heart.
Honey syrup, an option, for those who desire,
To sweeten their meal, with a taste that doth conspire.
I would eat here again, indeed I would,
For this dish, it doth please, my taste buds so good."

"Hark! What news is this? A grocery store so fine,
It doth make my heart sing with joy divine.
'Tis Hy-Vee, a place where healthy food doth abound,
And friendly staff doth greet thee with a smile profound.

A vegetarian myself, I find solace in their fare,
For they possess a lengthy list of dishes most rare.
Frozen entrees, fresh juices, and smoothies galore,
And yogurt, oh yogurt, with fig and walnut, my heart doth adore.

But wait, there's more! Wine, glorious wine, doth flow,
At prices most reasonable, thy purse doth know.
So, gentle folk, take heed of my words,
And hasten thee to Hy-Vee, where health and happiness doth reside."

"Verily, I say unto thee, this pizza place doth please me well! Twice have I partaken of their savory pies, and I do declare, I shall return for more!  Their packaging, clever; ingredients, fresh; preparation, made to order, before thine eyes.  'Tis true, actions speak louder than words, and their dedication to customer satisfaction doth show!  Gluten-free options, a bonus! Though I have not tried them, 'tis a sign of their commitment to catering to all.  The New Yorker, my choice, twice; garlic knots, a delight! Methinks, a mouthgasm!  Four meals, a boon! Sauce, generous; cold, still delicious.  Ice cream cups, a treat for another day, perchance.  Bring a friend, a challenge; decide, I must.  Friendly, courteous, outgoing, helpful, nice; their staff, a joy to behold!  Live long and prosper, a mantra, fitting for this place."

Two Hispanic artists didst spend three days in my humble abode,
With brushes and paint, they didst work with great skill and speed.
Their preparation was meticulous, their craftsmanship supreme,
In every way, they didst show themselves to be truly professional.
I do highly recommend them, without any hesitation or doubt,
For their work was perfect, a true masterpiece, beyond compare.
A good price for such excellence, I say with great conviction,
These two artists, they are worth their weight in pure gold, no question.

"Hark! What place is this? A haven, fit for kings!
Conveniently located, 'tis a sight to behold,
With access easy, and a patio grand,
Whereon to sip, and revel in the autumn's gold.

The brew, of finest quality, doth please mine taste,
And baristas, friendly, with a smile so bright,
Do serve with grace, and make each guest feel blessed.

Amidst the wood and metal, urban, yet rustic,
Doth Royal stand, a haven, cozy and snug,
Where one may come, with book in hand, and read,
Or bring their device, and toil, with mind so keen.

Whate'er thy want, this place doth sure provide,
A refuge, fit for royalty, to reside."

"This joint? Heaven on earth, kid. Ate here, felt like I was on TV, ya know? Good Eats, Food Network, one of those shows. Fatty menu? Nostalgia and sensory overload, man. Taste buds went boom! Skinny menu? Just as good, made me feel like I was cheatin', but I wasn't, you know? Atmosphere? Top-notch. Staff? Friendly. Even had healthy grub for my two-year-old, who's got allergies. Impressed, I was. \n\nChicken and waffles on the fatty menu? Get 'em. Mango chutney and basil yogurt dip on the skinny menu? Don't miss it. But honestly, you can't go wrong here. Something for everyone. Patio? Comfortable, dog-friendly. I'll be back, and I'll bring my friends."

"Methinks 'tis a quaint and cozy eatery,
Which hath been my pleasure since childhood's hour.
Some may disparage, calling it old-fashioned,
But to me, 'tis a haven of comfort and devotion.
Their fare, though plain, doth satisfy and delight,
With hearty portions, a feast for the sight.
And though 'tis not grand, nor doth it boast
Affectations of luxury or ostentation,
Here thou shalt find warmth, kindness, and good cheer,
A place where families gather, year by year."

"O, how I do adore this place, my heart doth sing! In days of yore, when dwelling in the northwest, we did frequent this establishment, and oh, the joy it did bring! The Almond Milk Tea, with boba, a drink most divine, doth rival any other, I do declare. But alas, we have since moved to the southwest, and find naught but sorrow, for none can compare, I do implore. When my beloved doth play golf at Painted Desert, I do entreat him, 'Bring me tea, my love, from this wondrous place.' O, wouldst thou, kind sirs, consider opening a new location, in Henderson, perchance? My heart doth yearn, my soul doth pine, for but a sip of that sweet, sweet tea, once more."

"Hark! What burgers be these, made in heaven above? With cheese curds, a delicacy I've ne'er known, And onion rings, so thin and crispy, sent from the gods. My hunger, unrelenting, didst devour them with haste, Forsooth, I cared not for manners, nor the feast to waste."

"Get your hair done quick and right by Michael. No time wasted, just like me. I drove four hours to LA for a good stylist, but my sister said try Michael in Vegas. Glad I did. Best decision. He knew my color, did it fast, and it looked better than my LA stylist who had been doing it for 15 years. Normally I sit for 4-5 hours, not with Michael. Great guy, great stylist, and quick. Love the guy. Miss him since moving back to LA. Next visit, I'm getting my hair done by Michael."

"Five stars, rarely given. But for the grub we ordered, five stars earned. Salmon, pan-seared, crispy on one side, rare within. Perfection on a plate. Green chile pork pot pie, crust crispy and doughy, comforting. Sauce, flavorful and tasty. House chardonnay, affordable. Coffee house vibes, casual, hipster. Great drink selection, craft cocktails, full coffee menu. Convenient downtown spot, affordable, delicious. Free Yelp check-in cookie, peanut butter, smore. Hemingway would approve."

"Methinks 'tis my wont to vent my spleen on Yelp,
But for Sunchain, my words shall be naught but praise.
A year hath passed since first I didst set foot within,
And still, their service doth excel, in truth, 'tis no sin.
Friendly faces doth greet mine eyes, full of cheer,
Cleanliness doth reign supreme, and prices, quite dear.
Thus, I say, give Sunchain a try, ere thou dost depart,
For they shall leave thee satisfied, in body and in heart."

"If thou dost seek the finest gel or glitter, look no further than Lynn's abode. Forsooth, I have been a patron of her artistry since she first graced our fair city with her presence, and by the stars, she is a master of her craft! Thou dost not merely pay for the sparkles and shine, but for the very essence of quality itself. In brief, thou dost indeed get that which thou dost pay for. Alas, though I find myself in straitened circumstances at present, I shall return to Lynn anon, for her skills are most assuredly worth the coin. And Dawn, her comrade in beauty, is likewise a paragon of excellence, tho' I have not personally experienced her ministrations."

"Verily, when an experience doth please me well,  
Five stars, I say, doth it deserve, and no less.  
The hostess, waitress, and chef, all didst play  
Their parts with grace and friendliness, in sooth.  
A caprese sandwich, fresh and fair, didst they  
Prepare for me, with bread, baked daily, methinks.  
'Tis a winner, this dish, and worth the cost,  
For it didst satisfy my hunger and my soul."

"Amidst the splendor of Las Vegas, there lies a hotel most fair,
Whose charm doth captivate, and whose beauty doth declare.
My chamber, neat and tidy, didst boast a wondrous sight,
A view so grand, it didst leave me in pure delight.
The check-in process, swift and smooth, didst grant me ease,
And at the desk, an upgrade didst await, with grace.
Its site, most prime, doth offer much, in amenities and deeds,
A stay most pleasant, doth this hotel indeed provide, with speed."

"Hark! What's this? A chili dog, all the way,
In Carolina style, a sight to stay.
With slaw added, a twist indeed,
A burger, too, that doth succeed."

"Sunday morning, 11:30 am. My friends and I stumbled out of our room, barely making check-out time. We made our way to the 2nd floor of the Imperial Palace, where the Hash House Harriers resided. A sea of people waited outside, but we were seated within 10 minutes. We scoped out other tables, and the portions were massive. Split a meal, and you'll still leave full. Our table of three ordered the tractor driver combo, corned beef hash, and eggs benedict. Everything was delicious. I added a Bloody Maria to my French toast breakfast, and it hit the spot. First time having one, and it was a game-changer. Tequila instead of vodka, and it settled my stomach and cured my hangover. The French toast was enormous, two thick slices, five inches square, grilled banana included. Service was top-notch, attentive and friendly. Coffee refills flowed like water. Only downside? No dedicated bathrooms. You'll have to venture into the casino for that."
"Foodie? You'll love this joint. My wife and I did. We left with a few treats from the antique store, too. Phenomenal burgers and chicken sandwiches. Sweet potato chips and tater tots? To die for."

"Hark! This mall, so grand and fair, doth show its age with grace and poise. A costly venture, indeed, for stores do come and go, like actors on a stage. Yet, within its halls, a diverse array of shops doth thrive, and eateries, too, where one may find sustenance and respite. A playground, also, doth delight the young ones, and nearby, a snack shop doth offer treats, with nary a tax to pay. A double-decker carousel, a marvel to behold, doth bring joy to children's hearts, two rides for five silver coins, and adults, free, as if by magic. A refuge from the summer sun, this mall doth provide, but alas, upon returning to thy carriage, 'twill be as hot as fiery coals."

"Dreamin' of Kona beach, cravin' Da Poke Shack. But, alas, it's just a dream. Or so I thought. Then, like a miracle, Poke Express appears, servin' up the real deal. Score! Worth the drive, for sure. Only bummer? No rice. Maybe next time."

"Salon Faith, good joint for hair care. Friendly folks, too. My daughter, 14, gets the royal treatment there. Always makes honor roll, so she gets the full monty every time. Hasn't missed a roll yet."

"Been by this joint a few times. Noticed it 'cause I'm more conscious of what I eat these days. Decided to check it out today. Been around for ten years, this place. Bakery and eat-in/take-out spot. Lots to choose from - bread, cookies, bagels, pizza dough, muffins, and more. Like that you can buy mixes and make your own too. Menu's solid, and they supply a bunch of other places. Sell all kinds of cakes, even custom jobs with decorations. Not the cheapest, but worth it, I reckon. Changing your diet can do wonders. I'll be back."

"My maiden voyage to a Vegas spectacle,
A feast for eyes and ears, a merry masquerade,
With colors bright, music, mirth, and play,
A night of wonder, full of joyous shade.

I chose the poncho section, wise decision,
For cheap it was, and free from paint's obsession,
The actors' faces, full of life and glee,
A treasure trove of emotions, plain to see.

Drums beat loud, paint flew, and dancers swayed,
A sight to behold, a true display,
Toilet paper, too, played its part,
A comical touch, a joyful start.

Though English words were scarce, no fear,
For non-English speakers, still quite clear,
And children, too, with delight,
Enjoyed this show, a wondrous sight."

"Five stars, I say, for atmosphere, victuals, and mood,
A most excellent experience didst I have, in truth.
A humble dish of rice and orange chicken, I didst order,
And note, they do possess a fine selection of sushi, insooth.
The decor, modern and sleek, with lighting dim, yet refined,
Didst set the tone, most appropriately, for my request divine.
For here, I asked my love, to be mine own,
And thus, this place shall ever be, a spot most dear, and dearly remembered."

"Hark! What tidings bring thee to this place?
A haven for thy garments, fair and bright.
The washers and dryers, they do gleam,
But, alack! The men, they doth outshine them.

Their visages, so comely and fair,
Do make my heart sing with joy and cheer.
And, pray tell, what magic doth confer
Such radiant skin upon yon boss, I pray?
Methinks 'tis a secret, hidden from view,
A treasure kept, that only he doth know."

"Hark! What fortune brings me to this place?
A culinary haven, full of grace.
Jeff, the chef, a man of great renown,
His dishes, a feast for the crown.

His hospitality, a virtue so rare,
Makes one feel welcome, without a care.
The food, a symphony of delight,
Leaves one in awe, with each bite so bright.

I shall return, for more of this treat,
When dinner is served, my heart doth beat.
For Jeff's kitchen, a true work of art,
Shall bring joy to my gastronomic heart."

"Hark, what luck! Our journey's end didst bring us to The Keg,
Where Paul, with service swift and kind, didst attend our every need.
We entered ere the throng of folk, at six o'clock's stroke,
And straightaway ordered, mindful of my fungus-fearing soul.
The kitchen's master, hearing of my plight, didst come forth,
Assuring me that naught but salad greens and chicken, free from mushroom's birth,
Would grace my plate. And lo, their words didst prove most true,
For not a single mushroom doth my meal now pursue.
Great praise to The Keg, whose fare and service doth excel,
A place most worthy of return, in Montreal's historic cell.
Indeed, the location, on Saint Paul Street so fair,
Didst add to our delight, in this quaint and ancient quarter there."

"O Yelp, thou art my trusty guide,
A beacon in the night, a shining light.
In Pittsburgh, where good sushi doth reside,
Thou hast led me to a place most bright.

The service there, it doth excel,
With staff who doth attend thee well.
Their kindness doth abound, a joy to behold,
Their aim, to please, doth never grow old.

A full bar, oh wondrous sight,
Where sake doth flow, a pure delight.
Five dollars, a small price to pay,
For such a drink, doth make my day.

Gyoza, crispy fried, a tasty treat,
Though greasy, still a dish most meet.
Miso soup, a flavorful delight,
Not burning hot, a pleasure to bite.

Nigiri, huge chunks of fish,
A feast for eyes, a treat most rich.
Rolls, tasty, a joy to consume,
A meal most satisfying, no need to assume.

Ambiance, pleasant, a nice surprise,
A couple's date, a joyous guise.
Price, affordable, a happy find,
My search, at last, doth come to mind.

In short, this place, a gem most true,
A treasure trove, for me and you.
Specialty rolls, a wish, a dream,
But still, their menu, a culinary scheme."
"Place is incredible. Aroma hits you as soon as you walk in. First bite, pork melts in your mouth. Mac and cheese, damn good. Best I've had. I'll be back."

"Hark, what news is this? A feast most fair and fine,
With friendly greetings, and a Martini divine.
The food, a culinary delight, did please,
And wine, not overpriced, did quench our thirst with ease.
The service, top-notch, did make our evening bright,
And we shall return, to dine with all our might.
A word of advice, dear friends, do share,
For portions generous, invite us to partake with glee."

"Methinks my comrade and I didst dine here,
And found the victuals to be most divine.
Our dishes, both of them, didst please our taste,
Beyond compare, they were a feast.

The younglings, too, didst fare well,
Despite no menu for them to choose.
The staff, kind and accommodating, didst attend,
To their needs, with nary a fuss or pretend.

I didst peruse the evening's bill of fare,
And found it wanting, price-wise, fair.
But still, my heart doth yearn for more,
Of their seafood dishes, aplenty to devour.

The service, good, and atmosphere, fine,
Didst make our visit most enjoyable, in truth.
So, shall I say, this place doth win,
In my esteem, a worthy spot to dine."

"A party of six, we didst make our way,
To celebrate my parents' fortieth year,
With OpenTable, the reservation made,
I noted in the comments, their special day.

Our server, with a smile so bright,
Didst greet my parents with a joyful sight,
"Happy Anniversary," he didst say,
And thus, the evening didst begin in play.

The Grand Concourse, a place of renown,
We ventured forth, despite the whispers down,
But fear not, dear friends, for we didst find,
A lovely setting, with a view so kind.

The river dining room, cozy and neat,
With a skyline view, most wondrous to greet,
Our waiter, friendly and full of cheer,
Didst serve us well, without a speck of fear.

The food, quite good, with portions fair,
We dined and laughed, without a single care,
So here's to thee, dear Grand Concourse,
We shall return, with joy and persistence."

INGOS, a place most wondrous, doth serve
Food that doth please, and atmosphere most fair.
Their burgers, made from grass-fed beef, doth reign
Supreme, in both taste and nutrition's bounty.
And other dishes, too, doth please the palate,
Beers, apps, and more, a feast most elate.
But one thing, dear INGOS, doth trouble me,
Thy "to-go" burgers, how they doth become soggy,
A problem, perchance, with the bun or cooking,
For when I dine within, such trouble doth not beset.
Yet still, a great place, INGOS doth remain,
Worthy of praise, and visits most frequent.
"PeiWei, we get 'em at work. They're swell. Love their Viet wraps, veggie pad thai. Fast take-out, grub's top-notch."

"Hark! A word of praise I sing for this fair place,
Which lies in Phoenix, where my sisters dwell,
A city bright, with sunshine in its face,
And warmth that doth my heart with joy doth swell.

A tavern, 'tis, with bartenders skilled and fine,
Who pour forth drinks of flavor rich and rare,
And food, oh food! Doth satisfy my hunger's pine,
With dishes diverse, and savory beyond compare.

The service, too, doth please mine eyes and ears,
For courteous folk, with smiles and cheer, do serve,
And thus, this place, a gem within the desert's fears,
Doth stand, a beacon, for all travelers to preserve.

So, if thou art in Peoria, or nearby the 17,
Do stop and taste the treats that here are given,
For in this tavern, thou shalt find no sin,
But joy and mirth, and memories to be lived."
"Fremont Street, comedy show, brilliant, hysterical, must-see, worth every penny."

"Tammy and Shelly, servers most divine,
Their service, swift and their smiles, so fine.
I've oft picked up orders, 'tis true,
But once, with coworkers, I did dine anew.

Their steak fries, oh how they delight,
And burgers, homemade in taste, a wondrous sight.
I do not oft indulge in such fare,
But for a cheat meal, it's beyond compare.

If I am to be bad, 'twill be with glee,
For this food, it doth make my heart sing with glee."

"Verily, I must confess, my heart didst harbor doubts regarding the chilly garnishes, yet, upon sampling them, my fears were laid to rest. Forsooth, I have partaken of the culinary delights of New York and Chicago, but this, my friends, was a far cry from the usual fare. 'Twas a pleasant departure from the standard issue, with nary a drop of grease to sully the pie."

"Fantastic. Family-run joint. Been here 8-9 times. Friendly staff, top-notch service. Food? Phenomenal. Veal, pasta, all fresh and delicious. Wine list? Unbelievable. Drooling just thinking about it. Can't wait to go back. Off the strip, but worth it."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous place indeed,
My friend, a native of this fair land, did lead
Me to this Thai food paradise, and lo,
I was struck by its beauty, like a bolt from above.
The menu, a veritable feast for the eyes,
Didst boast of dishes most clever and wise.
I, a humble vegetarian, didst inquire,
And the waiter, a gentle soul, didst assure,
That nigh ninety percent of the dishes, they couldst prepare,
Without the use of beef broth or fish sauce, a rare find, indeed.
A noodle dish, most delectable and fine,
Didst grace my table, and now, doth haunt my mind.
My comrade, a connoisseur of culinary delight,
Didst opt for peanut chicken, sticky rice, and mango, a feast for the senses,
All of which, didst appear most appetizing and bright.
Verily, I say, this place doth earn my highest praise,
And to all who seek a gastronomic adventure, I do recommend it with ease."

"In fair Edinburgh, my love and I did spend our honey moon,
Where we did meet Treacle, by local Yelpers shown.
Their style, anime and modern romance doth blend,
A bit too much for my taste, yet I could wink.
For their drinks menu, oh how grand and fine,
Did tempt my palate with Pear and Violet's twine.
Silver Fern and Elderflower Fix, I did imbibe,
All delectable, with flavors so unique and rife.
We did not partake in their culinary fare,
But by the sights and scents, 'twas clear they did prepare."

"As we journeyed forth from Phoenix's walls,
Our stomachs grumbled, and we sought repast,
In Vegas' streets, where lights and sounds enthrall,
We searched for sustenance, and thus did find
A place named Old School, where pizza doth reign,
And with its mix of cheese, tomato, and date,
Did please our taste buds, and we did exclaim,
'Tis good! And thus, on our return, we shall
Make haste to visit this fair eatery again."

"Hark, fair readers, listen well, for I have tale to tell,
Of Tipton Orthodontics, where I didst prepare to dwell,
In surgery's clutches, my jaw to mend,
A cutting, sliding, shifting, to amend.

The Tipton team, so kind and fair,
Didst ready me, with care,
For that great day, when surgery would be nigh,
And I, with courage, didst take flight.

Thanks, Tipton Orthodontics, thou art divine,
For making me whole, and surgery to design.
-Stephanie Lauk, with gratitude doth say."

"Hark, what praise doth reach mine ears from yonder Facebook friends?  A seafood joint, they say, that doth impress.  Yet, being from the east, I do confess, my doubts did runneth deep.  But lo, we did decide to give it a go, and by the stars, what wonders lay within!  The fare, it doth astound, and Will, the server, he doth make our night most merry and bright.  His service, it doth excel, and doth enhance the feast.  We shall return, anon, forsooth, and pray that Sunday, too, they shall be blessed."

"Oh, fairest Community Florist, how dearly I do love thee! Thy blooms so bright and colorful, doth grace my humble salon with beauty and glee. A fortnightly treat, thy petals doth adorn my space, and for my nuptials, thou didst create a bouquet most fair and lovely, matching my gown and personality with ease. Thy prices, so reasonable and kind, doth make it possible for me to purchase arrangements for all occasions, be it birth, love, mishap or death. And, with a brief tale of the recipient, thou doth craft a personalized arrangement, unique and wondrous, a true work of art. Additionally, thy terrariums, a marvel of nature and skill, doth bring a touch of greenery and life to any room. And, for those who wish to learn, thy classes on floral arranging, a gift indeed. Oh, thank thee, Community Florist, for bringing such joy and splendor to my life!"

"Verily, I doth not scribe of every victualer whereat I partake, merely those which doth exhibit a certain je ne sais quoi. 'Tis a quintessential, old-fashioned Italian restaurant, five stars without a doubt. Any who doth give it less, doth but play the fool with ratings, forsooth. 'Twas recommended by the concierge at yonder Marriott, and well done, for finding it sans carriage, a feat indeed! A humble exterior, nondescript, yet descend the stair and pass through the industrial portal, and lo! A bustling establishment, wherein good cheer doth abound. The bill of fare, in Italian, extensive and staff, most willing to interpret. Wine list, likewise, aplenty and all Italian, sugars too, from Italy, a true pattern doth emerge. They doth not fear to shout old Italy, for they doth it with finesse. Soup of the day, stingray, a surprise, noodles in seafood broth, with shredded stingray fin, straight from Italy's coast. Many a delectable dish didst grace the menu, my choice, Osso bucco, excellent! My spouse, fettuccine with fungi, fantastical! Shall I return? Aye, without a doubt, and, might I add, I did request they summon a hackney coach to convey me back to mine hotel, for 'tis near old town, though somewhat off the beaten path."

"Hark! A Brazilian wax didst I seek, and thus, my nerves were frayed. But lo! The lady who didst tend to me, didst put my fears to rest with her gentle ways. Her skilled hands didst move with haste, and her expertise didst show. I do confess, I am most eager now to make another appointment, that I might enjoy a facial and massage at her able hands. My thanks to her, for a most pleasant experience indeed!"

"Verily, this eating house doth merit a WOW,
For its dishes of China, most authentic and true,
Porc enrobé de farine de riz, steamed with care,
A culinary delight beyond compare.

The owner, a kind soul, doth ensure a warm welcome,
Whilst his staff, most helpful, doth make one feel at home,
They strive for service, as well as flavorsome fare,
A rare find, indeed, in this fair city of Montreal.

I asked for a take-out, and behold,
Their packing skills, most impressive to behold,
The flavors, they didst retain,
A true testament to their skill and dedication.

Huzzah! A BYOW restaurant, of great renown,
May it continue, this noble tradition,
In this fair land of Canada,
A beacon of hope, for those who doth seek a fine repast."

"Marry, what a wondrous place! So vast and grand,
With facilities that doth please the eye.
An indoor track, a court for basketball,
Tennis courts, a pool, and racquetball,
All within these walls, a veritable treat.
And for the young ones, Kids World be,
A place of wonder, full of glee.
Do visit, and follow me,
On Twitter, where my words doth flow free."

"Methinks I doth concur with fair Stephanie B,
In this, the tale of urgent care most speedy.
Two sprites I hath raised, and many a care hast seen,
Yet this, the best, doth stand out from the rest, I ween.

The staff, so friendly, doth greet us at the door,
Nurses and physician, with smiles they doth adore.
My spouse, in haste, doth receive most prompt attention,
Whilst others, four in number, doth await their turn, in patience.

Thirty minutes, a mere trifle, doth pass in no time,
And lo, my husband, now well, doth emerge from the shrine.
The others, all treated, doth depart with cheer,
And I, in praise, doth highly recommend this place, my dear."
"Charlie's your man. Knows his stuff, he does. Diagnosed the problem quick and fixed it fast. Top-notch customer service. Highly recommend."
"Valley's best view from our patio. Kick back with your favorite drink and take it all in. Food's top-notch, crafted with care. Staff's always on the ball."

"Hark! L'Atelier, doth it mean 'the best butter'? Verily, I say unto thee, 'tis true. Forsooth, the finest butter of all, Echir, didst shine with pride upon any dish. In faith, we didst partake of one Prix Fix, and many carte items didst accompany. A wise decision, indeed, for all was well. 

Every morsel was divine, my friends. Langoustine fritters, tuna belly, gelee, suckling pig (oh, how fine!), mashed potatoes (with butter, by the ton), and more didst grace our table. The beef rib eye didst please, but lo, the Poached baby Kussi oysters with French butter, twain orders didst steal the show. 

Thus, a merry feast we didst enjoy, with naught but laughter and delight."

"A wondrous shoppe of tea, my dear friend, doth lie within this city's bounds. The proprietor, a man of vast knowledge and wit, doth keep watch o'er his wares at all times. He doth proffer samples of his finest brews, that thou mayst savour their sweet aroma ere thou doth make thy purchase. A clever notion, indeed! His shop, besides, doth brim with curious knick-knacks and trinkets, worthy of thy attention and pursue."

"O, what a charming confectionery doth lie within this tiny store!
Treats for thy sweet tooth, they do abound, and service most divine.
Gummy bears of milk chocolate, my heart doth sing with joy!
And see, they have cotton candy, glittered, a wondrous sight.
Aye, happy am I, that work doth lie so nigh, I shall return anon."

"This joint did the trick. Stopped by pre-flick, grabbed grub at the bar. Got what we needed: prompt service, solid chow. \n\nFried green beans with aioli, hell yeah! Never knew I dug 'em so much. Also tried some sushi, spicy tuna roll. Fresh as hell, didn't care it wasn't a work of art."

"Methinks 'twas a feast most wondrous and fair,
With steaks of Kobe, skirt and ribeye both there.
The buffalo mozzarella, topped with red pepper,
Didst taste like the gods' own ambrosia, I reckon.

The Brussels sprouts, they were cooked to perfection,
But the potato puree, I couldst have done without a flaw.
The restaurant, warm as a summer's day,
Didst make us sweat, but the food didst make us stay.

A lady, with camera in hand, didst offer to take
Our picture, and for a price, didst make us partake.
But this, I say, didst mar the dining experience,
For 'twas a fee most outrageous, and didst leave a stain.

Yet, all in all, the food didst please,
And we didst dine, with nary a cause to freeze."

"A friend recommended Danielle after I griped about a bad haircut. Glad I took their advice. Danielle nailed it - color and cut, perfect. She asked about my routine, how I wanted it to look, what I wanted different. Color's amazing, just like I wanted - like nothing happened! Shine's incredible, too. Got plenty of compliments. Even treated my mom to a cut/color when she visited. If you're looking for a good stylist in Vegas (I've tried plenty without luck), Danielle's your girl."

"Yardhouse, we love it. Great grub, great service, never a letdown. Their chocolate soufflé, a tiny delight, pure heaven. Three bucks, worth every penny. Sick of restaurants serving up mediocre chocolate cakes? This is the real deal. Warm, rich, decadent. Can't go wrong with their Southern Fried chicken or Enchilada Stack. Always happy with our orders, even when they don't sound like much. Their Mac & Cheese, a surprise, loaded with different cheeses, mushrooms, chicken. Denver location, same great quality as Las Vegas. And let's not forget their impressive beer selection. Yardhouse, a winner."

"Classy, dim, convenient, LCD TVs galore,
Great food, I must confess, I'm smitten once more.
Teriyaki chicken, twenty-five dollars, a steal,
Sushisamba's prep, unique, beyond belief, no deal.

Expecting skimpy, cookie-cutter, a surprise,
Purple mashed potatoes, chicken on top, what a prize!
Flavorsome, juicy, tender, oh so sweet,
Melting in my mouth, a culinary treat.

Sushi, a good option, lightly wrapped in rice,
Accentuating other ingredients, a nice device.
Kobe beef, caviar, variety, a delight,
Though the kobe beef, bland, not quite right.

Oysters, ordinary, not worth the fuss,
Avoid them, my friend, save your palate, dismiss."

"Love the Marquee. Great time, no booze needed. Danced all night, just holding my water glass. 

Monday night, guest list, ladies free. Door staff, security, bartenders - all friendly. 

DJ Dirty South, fun times. Crowded dance floor. Vegas guys, looking sharp in suits and slacks. Classy vibes. Light show, confetti, glow sticks, glow tubes - all part of the fun. Dance, dance, dance! 

Woot! Woot! Can't wait to return."

"Upon this night, we chanced upon a place,
Where Elvis' spirit did abide and reign,
A contest held, with pomp and circumstance,
Did draw us near, with mirth and joy in train.

By yonder bar, we gathered, merry souls,
And ordered drinks, with laughter and with glee,
I chose a margarita, simple and plain,
But then, a voice did cry, 'Look, special drinks be here!'

In large cups, they served them, oh so fine,
We drank and laughed, and felt most divine,
The cost, dear friend, was sixteen shillings, fair,
And thirteen more, for refills, without a care.

At other bars, we'd sipped, with little cheer,
But here, on Fremont Street, our spirits now do clear.
So henceforth, here shall be our drinking place,
With mirth and joy, in this blessed space."

"O, how I adore Zinc Bistro! 'Tis where I go to sate my longing for all things French. The fare they serve, my dear, is of the highest quality, fit for a king or queen. The waiters, too, are quite the charmers, attentive and quick with a smile. The atmosphere, oh so très chic, transports me straight to the City of Light itself. Methinks the soup, the salad, and the main course, all delightful and artfully presented, doth make my heart sing with joy! Verily, I have tasted naught but excellence at this most excellent establishment!"

I hit up D's every Wednesday night for a cold one and a veggie dog after bouldering at the Wall. Their beer selection is always changing, and I've yet to be let down. If I'm unsure, they'll usually bring a sample over to make sure I'm good with it. The veggie dogs are solid, the cheese fries are great, and the service has always been top-notch. It can get packed when there's a game on, but grab a beer and wait for a table. Pros: fun menu, killer draft beer selection, beer cave! Cons: sometimes crowded and loud.

"Hark! What eatery is this? Deliciousness doth abound!  My friend Eric, wise guiding light, didst suggest we partake of their culinary delight. Pork tenderloin, cooked to perfection, tender and savory, didst please mine taste buds. Brussels sprouts, a tasty accompaniment, didst complement the main course. And, oh! The banana creme pie, a sweet and satisfying ending. Their signature cocktail, a refreshing delight. The decor, a cool and trendy ambiance, didst add to the experience. A must-try, this restaurant, in Las Vegas!"

In days of yore, this place didst bear a name
For grumpiness and scowls, a woeful fame.
But lo! In recent times, a change doth come,
And friendliness doth now beckon thee home.
Their wares, aplenty, doth await thy glance,
And speedy service doth ensure thy chance.
Amidst the wilds, this shop doth stand,
A boon for thee, who dost reside near hand.

"Methinks we've visited these two locations oft,
In Surprise and Arrowhead, our hearts aloft.
The freebie bread and oil, a wondrous sight,
A meal in itself, with wine, a true delight.

Bruschetta Romana, goodness in a bite,
Firecracker Rolls, my husband doth excite.
Roasted Brussels Sprout Beet Salad, my heart's desire,
Calzone, my husband's love, a culinary fire.

Kid's calzone, our son's choice, ne'er a miss,
Italiano Sandwich, my daughters' kiss.
Buffalo Chicken Ceasar Sandwich, their delight,
A feast most satisfying, with wine, a gentle flight.

My own fond meal, bread, salad, pizza, and wine,
A symphony of flavors, a culinary shrine.
Pasta dishes, too, have graced my lips,
All good, but spaghetti and meatballs, I do skip.

For Italian Sodas, the kiddos do adore,
A drink most refreshing, forevermore."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, do thou hasten to partake of this most exquisite delight, 'tis velvet, a luxury beyond compare! So enamored be I with its rich, smooth texture and sumptuous hue, methinks 'twill be worth breaking all rules and conventions to savor its sweetness. Nay, more, I shall entreat thee, let us make a pact, a bond most sacred and true, to indulge in this lavish treat, and, by Jove, I vow to bring sufficient quantity for all, lest any soul be left wanting. By my honor, 'tis no jest, but a promise most solemn and sincere."

A haven for sweet treats, this place doth be,
Where my friend and I do often visit, ye see.
We partake in Thai tea, a brew most fine,
With cream and sweetness, in perfect harmony divine.

The decor, modern and chic, doth please the eye,
With artwork, HD TVs, and lighting, oh my!
A haven for all, from young to old,
Hippies, hipsters, all are welcome, bold.

My newfound love, a flavor most rare,
Cream milk tea, with red velvet, oh so fair.
Strawberries abound, a treat for Valentine's Day,
A photo, I shall share, come what may.

"Methinks 'tis a fortnight since last I dined
Here, where the servitors are e'er so kind
And victuals of such quality do abound
That nowhere else have I found its like
In sooth, their noontide offerings be
A bargain, and my purse doth sing with glee."

"O, how we do adore Paul Martin's American Grill,
Where salmon, grilled on cedar plank, doth thrill.
And short ribs, oh so tender and sweet,
Do make our taste buds sing and dance with glee.

On Mondays, they do offer a fine deal,
A wine dinner, with two salads and entrees,
For just $49, a price most fair and kind,
With a good selection of vintages to find.

Their Happy Hour, too, doth bring us cheer,
With staff most cordial and friendly, my dear.
And local ingredients, they do employ,
In Scottsdale, a place of sun and joy."

"Thai House, a place most dear to me,
Where I doth frequent, at least once a month, ye see.
For over a year, my heart doth sing its praise,
And with each visit, my love doth never wane.

Other Thai eateries have I tried,
But none compare, my friends, to this place.
The Pho and Green Curry, oh how grand,
My taste buds dance, at the mere thought of them.

The service, swift and kind, doth make me smile,
They treat me like family, in a most gentle style.
I do recommend, this house of Thai,
To all who seek, a culinary delight."

A Rue Duluth eatery most fair,
With service that doth strive to be rare.
Though staff did seem a mite thin,
Their efforts did our hunger win.
Mushrooms, first course, a delight,
And guinea hen, a savory sight.
All told, a night most pleasant,
At this, Rue Duluth's finest tenant.
Pro tip: seek out the depanneur near,
For vintages of red wine most clear.
(This place, BYO, doth make it so.)

Walked into the gorgeous shopping palace, felt like royalty. Too bad I didn't have enough cash to buy anything. The statues and water features brought back memories of my first visit as a kid. It's still the same. Variety of shops, eateries, clubs, etc.

"I am a skeptic, by nature's grace,
A lawsuit funder, in this world's space.
Andre, the owner of Toyoworks, I met,
In 2006, when my Land Cruiser was beat.
Stripped spark plugs, two quotes did say,
Over $2,000, a price to pay.
But Andre, a problem solver, indeed,
Removed all spark plugs, without a deed.
For just over $200, a fair price,
My car, he fixed, without a vice.
Since then, to Andre, I've gone,
Exclusively, my car, he's shown.
Recently, he said, repairs were due,
Another mechanic, I thought to pursue.
The same issues, a higher price,
Integrity, Andre does entice.
Rare, in a mechanic, and man,
His moral code, a true plan."
"Chawla's got a sharp eye, that one. Picky patient like me, needs a good doc. Worked out just fine, first time around. Enjoyed the visit, even the office manager's a character."

"Hark, what gem doth lie within this humble place? A haven for those who seek delicious fare at reasonable cost, without the pomp and circumstance of fancier establishments. My comrades, who have long frequented this spot, didst finally persuade me to partake in their culinary delights. And verily, I was not disappointed. The Philly steak, oh how it doth excel! A cut above the rest, it doth rival any other in all of Las Vegas.

Their specialty, a sandwich of renown, doth feature a choice of beef or chicken, both cooked to perfection. And for a mere $7.95, thou shalt receive a hearty portion, with the option to add cheese, bacon, or both. The toppings, aplenty, doth include onions, marinara sauce, mushrooms, and green peppers. A feast fit for a king, and all for a pittance!

I have sampled both the steak and chicken versions, and I must confess, they doth satisfy my hunger and delight my taste buds. The chicken, with marinara and green peppers, doth ascend to new heights of flavor. And the curly fries, oh how they doth complement the meal! A veritable treat, and a bargain at under $5 for the lot.

This place, a true gem, doth reign supreme as my go-to destination for bar food in Las Vegas. Hie thee hence, and partake in the splendor that lies within!"

"Oh, fairest heaven, how sweetly doth thy crepes delight!  Berry-filled, they dance upon mine tastebuds with grace and finesse.  And yonder chocolate fountain, a wondrous sight indeed, doth spark my curiosity.  Methinks 'tis a novelty most charming, yet doth it rival Alaska's Wild Berry Products' watery cascade?  Verily, I know not, but shall ponder this query anon. 

Desserts most delectable, a feast for mine eyes, didst tempt me sorely.  Yet, alas, my waistline doth protest such indulgence.  Thus, I didst capture their splendor with mine camera, a more frugal and lasting delight, I do declare. 

And oh, their mochas!  How they doth surpass those peddled by Starbucks, in flavor and in quality!  Methinks, were I to dwell within the Bellagio's halls, 'twould be my daily haunt, this wondrous cafe of sweet delights."

"A marvelous spectacle, with a most wondrous set,
Built specifically for this grand display, no doubt.
The seats, though comfortable, left me wishing for more,
A few rows back, to better view the action, I did implore.

The show, a compact ninety minutes, full of delight,
With actors skilled and talented, a true pleasure to behold at night.
Yet, the Phantom's voice, a tad weaker than expected,
Left me pondering, was it an off day, or perhaps neglected?

Despite this minor flaw, the experience, I do declare,
Is worth the price, a memory to forever hold dear.
So, go and see it, thou shalt not be disappointed,
For this production, a true masterpiece, hath been invented."

"Hark! Mundo, a place most wondrous and fair,
A modern twist on Mexican fare,
The decor, dishes, service, all so fine,
A step above the rest, yet still divine.

In jeans and t-shirt, thou shalt not feel amiss,
For though it be modern, 'tis not too dismissive,
A bit of flair, yet not too avant-garde,
A happy medium, for all to enjoy, yea, verily.

I've visited oft, a dozen times or more,
And each time, satisfaction did I find,
Sea bass tacos, oh how they do enthrall,
A third of my visits, they did entwine.

A connoisseur, I, of fish tacos, 'tis true,
And Mundo's, the best, my vote doth accrue,
Brimming with flavor, spicy, yet not too hot,
Thy belly, good sir, shall thank thee, I wot."

"Chelsea's Kitchen, oh man. Love it. Start with the chicken nachos, can't go wrong there. Salad's good too, especially after all that fried goodness. Fish tacos, solid choice. Patio's where it's at, nice and relaxed. Staff's on it, service is quick without being pushy. Wish they'd open up shop down south, we're starving for some real food."

"A leak of hot water did our household afflict,
In pipes beneath our humble abode, 'twas hid.
No signs of moisture on the walls or floor,
Yet tiles in laundry room did heat up more.
Dave, man from West Coast, did come to aid,
With gadgets of great tech, he did survey.
The spot, he found with ease, then fixed with speed,
New pipe did replace old one, indeed.
Service and skill, both top-notch, I say,
My wife, now happy, hot showers can enjoy."

"Spiedini, delish. Half-and-half Rosa and Wiseguy, amazing. New York pizza, ignore. Busy having love affair with pizza. Still thinking about it. Not creepy, foodie. Ended with amazing cappuccinos. Wait, 15 minutes. Mentioned twice."

"Big Gooey Scrambled Mess, huh? That's what I got. Eggs, meat, veggies, all mixed up. Made me feel like a big ol' bear, stuffin' my face with all that food. And the preserves? Homemade, no doubt. Can't get that kind of quality from a jar. But the real star of the show? Fresh squeezed OJ. Now, I'm a bit of an OJ snob myself, but this stuff? It's like liquid gold, son. Worth doin' backflips for. And the best part? You get a refill with every order. No need to ration it, just drink up and enjoy."

"Love the name, love the place.  Little Miss Sunshine, a bright spot in an industrial area.  Shining star for BBQ in AZ and TX.  Yelp fans rave about the brisket, but I'm not a fan.  Give me the pork ribs, delicious with just the right amount of pepper.  Sauce optional, but I tried it anyway.  If they poured sauce on eggplant, it'd be my fave.  Coke establishment with limited seating, wish they had mac & cheese.  Definitely bringing my Texas in-laws here.  Can stand toe to toe with any Texas BBQ.  Friendly service, rounding up to 5 stars."

Upon my word, what wondrous sight doth meet mine eyes?
A martini bar, where friends may gather, free from fright.
The floor, no sticky mess, didst welcome us with grace,
And thus, our merry band didst take their places.

Oh, how the dirty martini doth please mine taste,
With vodka strong, and olives, a wondrous feast.
Basic martinis, bold and harsh, do oft astound,
But this, the best, with sweetness all around.

The bartender, skilled in art of mix and pour,
Didst claim her rightful boast, and we, our thirst devour.
Round upon round, we didst imbibe with glee,
And vowed, this place, again to visit, would we.

Alas, fair Pittsburgh, when shall thou banish smoke?
That we, within thy walls, may freely joke.

"Hark! All who enter here, be thou my friend,
For Teddy, yonder proprietor, doth attend
To every guest, as if they were his dearest mate,
And striveth to ensure they leave in joyous state.

A decade past, I chanced upon his place,
Whilst driving home from work, in haste,
And found his pies, both hot and savory,
Did please my taste, and thus, I did impart
My custom, frequent, to him and his dear wife.

Their pizza, hot dogs, pasta, subs, and wings,
Are all quite good, and worth thy while,
But seek not, here, gourmet fare,
With goat cheese, pesto, or sun-dried tomatoes rare.

Yet, for his craft, Teddy is the best,
In this, our neighborhood, at thy behest.
Thin crust, with extra pepperoni, doth please,
And thus, my order, doth always freeze."

"Back, after a spell. Cravin' beet salad, of all things. Jasper's got a killer one, with fresh mango, orange, candied pecans, and pear vinaigrette. Like a dessert, it is. Also, tried the shrimp and ancho tacos. Hooked, I am. Just the right amount of remoulade, corn tortilla, cabbage, gulf shrimp, ancho chili sauce, and a squeeze of lime. Mouthwatering, it is. Sear AHI tuna, they do. Perfectly prepared and fresh, it is. Top two, it's in. Something for everyone, Jasper's got. Crab stuff filet, for a good steak. Petite filet, crab and herb stuffed crosscut center, cabernet reduction bordelaise sauce, garlic roasted mash potatoes, and broccoli. Heavenly, it is. Heading to Jasper's, I am. Half off bottle wine night, on Tuesdays."

"Verily, good sirs and madams, 'twas a pleasing sight to behold,
Their customer service, most excellent, I doth unfold.
Attentive were they, to my each and every need,
No frills, nor pressure, did they upon me impose.
A tune-up for my steed, they did perform with grace,
But, alack, the splash guard, didst suffer a slight disgrace.
'Twas but a small blemish, upon an otherwise fair face,
For I shall return, to this place of wonder and grace."

"Wife and I were damn glad they opened this place up on our side of town. We joined right away. \nFacility's top-notch, staff's friendly and helpful. Had a blast on the range, great experience all around. \nKeep it up."

"Hark! A word of praise for My T., who with his fair wife Thao T., didst bring me to this place for the first time. 'Tis true, Alcatraz doth cater to locals as well, so let none despise the playa! 

A favorite haunt of mine, for brunch upon the strip. In truth, I've spent but little time in Las Vegas, a month or less, and thus my knowledge of such places is limited. Yet still, this spot doth hold a special place within my heart. 

A helpful hint: Whilst waiting for thy table, repair to the bar in the outer courtyard, where thou mayst quaff a drink and observe the passing throng. Forsooth, 'tis an essential portion of the experience here, methinks. 

Tip the second: Seek a table without, for within, 'tis somewhat dull, and youthful crowds doth congregate without. 

Fare of quality (alack! The prices, they do sting), and pleasant views of fountains, etc. Doth make this place most cool. E'en were the victuals somewhat dear, I'd still accord it five stars, an it please thee. 

For those who wish to order wisely: Salmon salad, if thou art one of those who doth shun grease, like unto me at times. Or, if thou wouldst go grand, then steak frites, with crispy fries, which doth annoy me sore. 

As yet, I have not tried the onion soup, of which all men do speak in raptures."

Hark, what news is this? A place in Vegas, they say,
That doth defy belief, and doth astound the mind.
I, too, didst doubt its worth, but now I find
It to be true, and my thoughts are thus entwined.

Amazed I am, at the wondrous sights I saw,
And the joys that didst fill my heart and soul.
I shall return, ere long, to this place anew,
For it doth hold a special place within my heart, I do avow.

In March, I shall make haste, straight from the air,
To visit this place once more, and partake of its delight.
For it doth seem, that in this city of sin,
There lies a gem, that doth shine bright and win.
"Pizza joint near UNLV, first time I'd been. Damn good pie. Pepperoni and spinach, tomato, ricotta. Friendly staff, fair prices. Love pizza by the slice, this place delivers. Be back."

"Hark! In this vale of tears, where health doth reign,
We sought with haste good dentists of renown.
And lo! Our quest did end with Cheyenne's gain,
A group most skilled, their art they did proclaim.
Their office, clean and bright, did shine so fair,
The staff, kind hearts, did welcome us with cheer.
Dr. Tran, a man of skill and gentle grace,
Did tend our teeth with care and gentle pace.
In times of need, they did not hesitate,
To see us swiftly, and our pain alleviate.
Our thanks to Dr. Tran and all his crew,
For being there in times of dental woe."

"Las Vegas folk talk funny. Maybe they need a taste cleansing. Sorry, but it's true. Naked Fish, though. Off the hook. San Fran native, tried plenty sushi joints. This place has vibe, authentic Asian flair. Open late, good for midnight cravings. Friend brought me here last year, now I come whenever I'm in town. Last few visits, had the Japanese Lasagna roll - like a cheeseburger roll, sounds strange, but damn good. Taking my SF pals here this week. Definitely looking forward to it."

"Vintage, repurposed, recycled, and new,
COLAB's a sight to behold, I do declare,
A shock it is, upon entering the door,
So much stuff, it's hard to navigate, by jove!

It's amazing, indeed, a treasure trove,
Gerber Onsies, silk-screened, a work of art,
Older clothes, re-sewn, a modern twist,
Retaining retro charm, a true work of heart.

C.O.L.A.B., a name that speaks its mind,
Collectively operated, local artists combined,
A boutique, unique, one of a kind,
Why hasn't this been done, before, in my mind?

Rent, a challenge, no doubt, a hurdle to cross,
But hope remains, with their cozy anti-space,
Their hours, Wednesday to Sunday, evening till late,
Saturday, afternoon, till the night's early date.

Go, shop, support, we must, for our arts to thrive,
In Phoenix, a haven, for fashion to revive."

"This Apple store stands out from the rest, a true flagship. Its architecture is bold, unique. Some may complain, but that's why it's worth a visit. It's well-stocked, staffed with friendly faces eager to help. There's a Genius bar and creatives for projects. A top-notch store."

"Justin and Steve, those noble gents,
Do work of such quality, it doth impress.
Their truck, red as blood, doth carry them,
To places where their skills are put to test.
And there, they doth perform their duties,
With diligence and care, they doth discharge.
So if thou art in need of aid,
And dost require a worthy trade,
Call upon these men, so brave and true,
For they shall help thee, as they wouldst do."

"A haven for all tailoring needs, indeed!
I moved from Chicago to Madison, and required aid
In fitting a bridesmaid's gown, adorned with lace.
A task not simple, yet Darlene's skill prevailed,
The dress now fits like a glove, my joy unveiled.
I shall return, should further alterations be sought,
For Darlene's artistry, my heart doth sing aloud."

"Alack, fair Pittsburgh, thou art not my home,
But now, 'tis where my heart doth most reside.
The Manor, once a humble cinema, now doth shine,
In splendor, rivaling even yonder Waterfront's pride.

Their tickets, priced fair, do draw me in,
As doth their victuals, of a modest fee.
The staff, with smiles and courtesy, doth win,
My praise, for their dedication, plain to see.

And, lo, the films they show, of highest worth,
With clarity of image, and sound, of great truth.
So, henceforth, shall I shun the crowded halls,
Of big box theaters, save when needs must call."

"We got top-notch care from Dr. Bennett and her crew. Found a stray pup at work, took it in, and they checked it out, no charge. Gentle, kind, and professional, just like Hemingway. Even got a thank-you note and a chew toy for our little girl. They went above and beyond. We're grateful."

"Dr. Archambault gives top-notch, personalized care. Holistic approach. Knows when to use other meds. Been a patient for near two years. Referred friends and family. Many already part of West Valley Naturopathic Family. 

Comprehensive, preventative, or autoimmune care? Go to West Valley Naturopathic. Never had better control over allergies. Homeopathic remedies that work. Seen Dr. Jennifer Elton too. Excellent care. 

Family atmosphere, top-notch care. Look no further."

"Hark! A word of praise for Michael at Red7,
Whose wisdom on computers doth shine so bright.
He took one glance at my old machine,
And deemed it naught but junk, with no need to gleam.
Others had sought to mend it with great cost,
But Michael's honesty did my heart enlist.
For not only did he save me gold and time,
But also introduced me to UBUNTU's rhyme.
A free software, that doth bring relief,
To my girlfriend's purse, with its thrifty belief.
So here's to Michael and his skilled hand,
At Red7, where computers doth take a stand."

"Methought I searched for vegan fare in Las Vegas, and lo! All manner of establishments didst appear in the search. Among them, Prime Rib Loft didst catch mine eye, a place wherein both vegetarians and vegans couldst find sustenance. The victuals didst please mine taste, and I didst partake of them with great relish. My wife and I didst sample many dishes, and all were good, save two which didst not conform to mine liking. Yet, I didst endeavour to consume them, and wouldst try others anon. Some folk didst express discontent with certain dishes, yet I say, 'Talk to the waiters, fair sirs!' Forsooth, the interior of the establishment didst bear an old-fashioned hippie air, and I shall return anon."

"A lunch buffet of ten dollars, with naan most fair,
And service, that doth rival the gods in care.
Four stars, I say, for this place of delight,
Where food most wondrous, doth dance on the sight.
I came alone, two days past, to find this gem,
A treasure trove of flavors, a feast for a king.
The lentils with rice, a dish most divine,
And chicken tikka masala, a taste most fine.
Lamb there was, but my heart didst not desire,
But still, 'twas good, and worth thy burning fire.
This place, good sirs, doth merit thy visit,
For price and food, most excellent, thou shalt witness."
"Best cupcakes in town. Period. Get the Drumstick. Worth the drive, even if you don't live nearby. Delicious."

"Dr. Boothe, a man of virtue and skill,
Hath eased my pain and given me peace.
With child, and hip discomfort that did plague me,
He hath tried various remedies, and found the key.
His care, most excellent, doth make me sleep,
And now, I do enjoy sweet restfulness.
In his presence, one doth feel most welcome,
For he doth possess a passion and wisdom, unmatched.
If thou dost seek a chiropractor, most fine,
Call upon PROCARE, and thou shalt be divine."

"Hark, what delight! The dipped Italian Beef doth please,
With peppers, a savory treat that ne'er ceases.
The onion rings, in light batter dressed,
Do make a merry meal, and cheese sauce, a worthy guest.
Strawberry shortcake, a sweet delight,
To take home, and savor, with all thy might.
A busy place, yet staff, with efficiency and grace,
Do serve the guests, with nary a trace of disgrace."

"Hark! In Las Vegas, there doth lie  
A hall of fame, where pinball doth reign supreme,  
A place of wonder, where thou shalt find  
Endless delight, and pass the time most serene.  

Aisles upon aisles, filled with machines of old,  
Where quarters doth flow, and fun doth unfold,  
Classic arcades, brought back to life,  
To stir thy soul, and ignite thy strife.  

Oh, fan of video games, how thy heart  
Shall swell with joy, at this wondrous sight,  
Vintage and new, side by side they stand,  
A testament to times long past, and fond.  

Here, spend an hour, or two, and lose thyself,  
In yonder games, that bring forth mirth and wealth,  
And shouldst thou bring thy children, fear not,  
For they shall learn, and joy shall be their lot."

"Best damn biscuits and cinnamon rolls I've ever had. Service is top-notch, too. Feels like home, ya know? Don't let the outside fool you, this place is a gem. Better than all that fancy stuff, you hear me? Get your Iowa Cafe on, folks!"

"Hark! Emily's doth reside within the selfsame edifice where I do toil, how fortunate a circumstance! Their victuals, ever fresh and delectable, doth satiate my hunger and delight mine taste buds. Shouldst thou require aught not listed upon their bill of fare, fear not, for they shall accommodate thy request with alacrity. In truth, I have partaken of diverse dishes from their menu, including the Salmon BLT, grilled cheese, and Ahi Tuna salad. By my troth, naught but excellence doth emanate from this establishment!"

"Methought 'twas fortunate fate didst guide us hither,
To partake of supper on a Friday eve,
Forsooth, the servitors were most kind and gentle,
And their wines, aplenty, didst our spirits lift.

The atmosphere, so tranquil and inviting,
Didst make us feel most welcome and at ease,
And thus we savored each dish they didst present,
With gusto and delight, our hunger to appease.

Aye, the cheese fondue, a dish most delectable,
Didst surpass our expectations, by my troth,
And the deli meats, a platter most bounteous,
Didst fill our bellies with joy and mirth.

My crepe, a culinary marvel, fair and bright,
Was presented with flair, a feast for mine eyes,
And the flavors, oh so subtle and refined,
Didst dance upon my palate, a true delight.

My spouse, his filet, cooked at the table,
A spectacle most entertaining, I must confess,
And the taste, a symphony of flavors,
Didst leave him in raptures, and in want of more.

Alack, that this place, so dear and cherished,
Were not closer to our humble abode,
For we wouldst return, again and again,
To partake of their fare, and their hospitality.

But still, we shall not forget this night,
So filled with joy, and love, and light,
And thus, we shall return, anon,
To revel in their culinary might."

"Methinks 'tis true, fair friends, these bagels be
The best I've e'er had, by my troth! 'Tis a fact,
No other bakery doth compare, I do aver,
To St. Viateur, where bagels be made with love and care.

Their plain bagel, oh so humble, doth steal the show,
With flavors unique, that doth make it stand,
Apart from others, that doth require some cheese,
This one doth shine, on its own, with ease.

And though they offer many a topping, my friend,
Cream cheese, drinks, and more, to make amend,
I say, go plain, and thou shalt see,
The true taste of this bagel, fit for a king, 'twill be!"
"Wild mushroom carpaccio, delicate and sweet. Sushi fresh, decor wonderful, view of the strip nice. Service good. People watching, a bonus."

"Hark! This library, once drab and worn,
Now shines anew, its mural reborn.
A youthful section, full of delight,
Boasts plasma screen and games to excite.
A children's corner, cozy and bright,
Beckons young minds to explore and ignite.
Books, magazines, and public computers abound,
Tended by staff, both helpful and profound.
Alas, their hours are limited, a shame,
For this library, now glorious, bears a worthy name."

"Marry, this toffee be the most divine confection e'er mine lips have savored! Neither hard nor sticky, 'tis soft and crumbly, doth melt within thy mouth, and that sweet flavor doth warm thine innards like a gentle embrace. At each grand gathering, I do present this delectable treat, and all who partake are smitten, by my troth!"

"Amidst the bustling streets, a haven doth lie,
A bookstore, where knowledge doth reside and thrive.
In silence, readers doth immerse themselves,
In tomes of wisdom, their minds doth unfold.

A place of solace, free from noise and strife,
Where scholars doth congregate, and share their life.
The shelves, they doth groan beneath the weight,
Of volumes ancient, and of wit so bright.

Here, one doth find respite from worldly cares,
And doth indulge in musings, both profound and rare.
The atmosphere, it doth invite and allure,
To linger, and to savor each page, with rapt attention sure."

"Verily, each time I enter this shop, I receive the finest service. Methinks 'tis due to mine own diminutive stature, struggling beneath a mountain of garments. The employees, in their haste, do approach me straightaway and convey my burden to a secluded chamber, designated for personal shopping. A place apart, with its own cashier, no less! I doth take my time within these hallowed walls, adding to my pile of finery without constraint. Forsooth, they do not restrict the number of items I may bring within the fitting room, as do many other shops, with their paltry limits of four or five. Nay, here I am free to indulge mine every whim, and the employees, in their kindness, do assist me with great zeal. 'Tis truly a most excellent establishment, one that doth hold a special place within mine heart!"

"Hark! My company doth employ Reliable Banner for most of our printing needs,
A truthful name indeed, for their work doth prove most trustworthy.
I've had large banners made, flip signs, and mission statements too,
Their craftsmanship, top-notch, and speedy service, I do avow.

Reach them by email or phone, a swift reply doth come,
Their prices fair, depending on the task at hand, nay, not a scam.
Alas, a mistake I made, a lack of proofreading, alack!
Spelling errors marred the banner, yet 'twas my own fault, I do confess.

Their location central, easy to find, a true convenience,
A small business, family-owned, a personal touch, they do dispense.
To all my kin, customers, and friends, I do recommend,
Reliable Banner, a choice most excellent, their worth doth transcend."

"A haven for fair maidens in need of guidance,
This place doth offer aid and support most plentiful.
Whether new to the valley or a long-time dweller,
They welcome all with open arms, no matter the hurdle.

Short-term programs abound, to ease life's transitions,
Counseling, learning, car repairs, and job preparations.
A refuge from worry, with childcare provided free,
To help women find stability, and their futures see.

In all the cities, none can compare,
To this haven of hope, so pure and fair.
A place of beauty, where hearts can heal,
And souls can find solace, without a peal."
"Fix, tried it for the first time. Not bad, not bad at all. Wings, mac and cheese, filet - all good. Recommend it to my peeps, I will."

"Hark! My business doth move, and thus I've hired three men of skill,
Larry, John, and B, and Adrian, to aid in this venture.
Their promptness was most impressive, their work most diligent,
A job well done, indeed! A word of advice, my friends,
For those who seek to move, prepare thee well in advance,
Lest chaos reign, and confusion doth take its toll.
But fear not, for these men, their patience and kindness did abound,
A pleasant experience, despite the stress of moving's plight."

"Hark! This place, 'tis true, doth hold its own,
A gem within the city's heart, a throne.
I chanced upon it, once, and oh, how grand!
The pastries, sweet and savory, did please my land.

The lady fair, who tended counter's space,
Was kind and wise, with knowledge of the place.
Her words, they flowed like honey, smooth and bright,
And made my visit, all the more delightful sight.

I shall return, forsooth, to this fair bakery,
For more of those delectable treats, so merry.
In Henderson's downtown, 'tis a must-see site,
A place of wonder, worth thy time and might."

"Hark! What news is this? A reason to imbibe  
Coffee, and that from Starbucks, too!  
A trenta sized cup, a wondrous sight,  
To hold within its depths, a steaming brew.  
  
A pot roast, rich and savory,  
Did fill my belly full of cheer,  
But then, alas! The morrow came,  
And with it, a dire need to proclaim,  
  
My gratitude for coffee's aid,  
In times of need, when all else fails,  
For in its warm embrace, I found relief,  
From the weight of my wife's culinary skill.  
  
And so, dear friends, let this be told,  
That coffee, though a bitter draught,  
Can bring us joy, and ease our plight,  
Even in the midst of a direful night."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, listen well,
For I have tale to tell, a story swell,
Of clinics veterinary, in Arcadia found,
Where pets are healed, their health profound.

A boxer, accident-prone, I do possess,
And thus, have visited many a place,
But one clinic stands out, in price most fair,
With staff great, doctor skilled, beyond compare.

My dog, a sweetheart, but fierce, alack,
Gets nervous round vets, and may attack,
But these kind souls, patient, calm, and true,
Treat her with care, as if their own anew.

Their honesty, a virtue, rare and bright,
No greed, no schemes, just plain good sight,
They told me, truthful, my dog's teeth clean,
No need for costly service, just a dream.

So, friends, take note, for pets in need,
This clinic, spay and neuter, indeed,
Unless, of course, your purse be deep,
In which case, choose where you will, and sleep.

But for us commoners, with budget tight,
This clinic, best, for pet's delight."

"Yelp, thou hast done it yet again, good sir! Our Sunday breakfast, a feast most fair and bright, didst thou provide, at this quaint, European-style cafe, so cozy and warm. Their scrambled eggs, the best in all the land, didst taste, and coffee, hot and fresh, didst flow, in abundance, 'twain. The staff, so kind and cheerful, didst attend, with smiles and grace, to our each and every need. A pleasant morn, indeed, didst we spend, in this charming place, thanks to thy guidance, Yelp, our trusted friend."

"Hark, my dear friends, gather 'round,
For I have news of Pho Phriday profound.
A place we've found, where pho flows free,
And Diet Pepsi, a sight to see.

We come each week, our hunger to assuage,
Our bellies to fill with noodles and pho in a cage.
The cost, a mere trifle, a small price to pay,
For the joy it brings, doth make our day.

No need for menus, we know what we seek,
A steaming bowl of pho, our hearts to speak.
So sit thyself down, and order with glee,
For the pho, it doth await thee.

And if thou art feeling sassy and bright,
A pressed coffee, a wondrous sight.
So come one, come all, let us dine and delight,
In this haven of pho, our spirits to ignite."

"Methinks 'tis naught but folly to extol the virtues of Pamela's, forsooth, yet cannot my pen cease its praise. For breakfast, that most sacred of meals, doth hold a special place within mine heart, and lo, I find myself in sore need of sustenance ere the day begin. And thus, my friends, I do declare that Pamela's doth reign supreme, a veritable haven of gastronomic delights.

Upon a weekday morn, at hour of nine and thirty, didst I and three companions grace the establishment with our presence, and, by the stars, didst the staff attend to us with haste and diligence. Our server, a man of wit and wisdom, didst guide us through the menu, recommending with precision those dishes most worthy of our attention.

And thus, my friends, didst we partake of Strawberry Crepe Hotcakes, a dish so divine that I shall ne'er forget its tender, fluffy texture and sweet, fruity embrace. Tex Mex Omelet with Chorizo, a savory delight, didst follow, its flavors blending in perfect harmony. And last, but not least, didst we indulge in Egg White, accompanied by a side of Ham and Lyonnaise potatoes, the latter of which didst boast a deft balance of moisture and crunch, its seasoning a testament to the kitchen's skill.

Oh, cruel fate, that doth keep Pamela's at such distance! Yet, fear not, for whenever fortune doth bring me to these fair shores, shall I make haste to partake once more of their culinary splendor."

"Methinks 'twas a feast most wondrous and fair,
The Beef Noodle Soup, a dish beyond compare.
My taste buds did sing with joy and delight,
And my love, a Thai maiden, did partake with great pleasure in sight.

Verily, I say, this eatery doth possess
A charm that doth entice and ne'er dismiss.
I shall return, and with haste, forsooth,
To savor once more their delectable broth."

"Methinks there be some charm in this place,
That doth make my heart sing and my taste buds dance.
The victuals here be always of the finest sort,
In quantity most generous, and served with good report.
The staff, too, be friendly and welcoming,
With smiles that doth light up the room, like the morning sun a-shining.
And the structure itself, a work of art,
Doth set it apart from all other eateries, a true work of the heart.

Mayhap 'tis the hunger, born of exercise,
That doth make my senses more keen, and my taste more nice.
Or mayhap 'tis the love, with which they doth prepare,
That doth make each morsel a joy beyond compare.
I'll drive a mile, or two, or three,
To partake of their feast, and revel in their glee.

Now, I am taken with their chicken salad,
A dish most wondrous, and worth every penny paid.
I be picky, I confess, about my toppings,
But they, with grace, do accommodate my hopings.
A side of rice, brown and fluffy, they do provide,
Two salsas, separate, they do not deny.
A sprinkle of cheese, a tiny bit, they do allow,
True Chipotle fashion, with a special touch, I do avow."

"Hark! What wondrous place is this? A haven of delight, where prices be fair and food doth please. Verily, they know me well, for straightaway upon mine entrance, a platter of spring rolls doth grace mine eyes. And, by the stars, what delectable pad-thai and seafood soup doth fill mine belly with joy!"

"Verily, 'twas awesome, as per usual, my friends! My fifth visit, and each time, 'twas a marvel! The service, top-notch, I must say! A bachelor party, we didst have, with twenty-three men, a rowdy bunch, indeed! Yet, they didst accommodate us, in a private room, with the finest of care! We arrived late, around ten o'clock, and though the kitchen closed at half past ten, they didst not rush us, nor leave us wanting! We departed at midnight, and the establishment, was empty, save for us, dear friends! If thou seeketh a fine meal, on the strip, look no further, 'tis the place to be!"

"Methinks 'tis pho most fair and delicious,
In Phoenix' metro, at least, thus far.
Tender beef within my bowl doth lie,
A feast fit for a king, or so it seem'd.

Bun bo hue, a dish of note, doth grace
Their menu, and I shall taste it soon,
With haste, forsooth.

The staff, most kind and welcoming,
Doth make me feel at home, anon.

Farewell, till we meet again,
In this, my favorite pho domain."

"Aye, fair maiden, I do frequent this place,
For dates, 'tis a wondrous spot, full of grace.
The service, kind and gentle, doth impress,
And within, the dining space, a true delight, doth bless.

The outdoor seat, by yonder mill, a treat,
With calzones, my heart doth sing, so neat.
Build thine own, with ingredients of thine choice,
A feast, fit for a king, with leftovers, to rejoice."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous sight, this aquarium of which I speak,
A marvel of the sea, with creatures grand and meek.
In Vegas, where the glamour doth abound,
Mandalay Bay doth stand, with its watery crown.

A sunken galleon, with sharks of sand,
Doth dwell within, a fearsome band.
And piranhas, too, with teeth so bright,
Do swim and play, in the dark of night.

Oh, how I wish, some foes of mine,
To drop within, and be devoured by the fine.
This place, it doth delight, with its treasure trove,
Of sea life, a wonder, sent from above."

"Thai Basil's grub is top-notch, whether you're dining in or taking it to go. Their fresh rolls are some of the best in Tempe, and their spring rolls are crispy and flavorful. If you're feeling adventurous, try the tom yum soup - it'll clear your head and your sinuses. The pad thai is a classic, with a tangy, sweet, and spicy sauce made with tamarind. Prices are fair, portions are generous, and the atmosphere is great. And if you're looking for a non-alcoholic drink, the green tea chai is a must-try - it's bold, refreshing, and will leave you wanting more."

"Hark, what news is this? A culinary delight,
Mexican fare, doth please mine appetite.
Arriba, a New Mexican styled eatery, doth reign,
With hatch green chilies, a feast for mine eyes, in vain.

Thirty times and more, I have partaken,
Of their delectable dishes, ne'er a mistake.
Fresh chips, warm and crispy, salsas two,
Bean dip, oh so tasty, for me and you.

Whitesands chimichanga, a spicy delight,
For those who crave heat, a wondrous sight.
Lunch specials daily, a bargain, indeed,
Chimis for $1.99, a price most reasonable, proceed.

Sundays, a treat for young ones, a clown,
Making balloon animals, a joyful sound.
Kids eat free, a merry time, a delight,
A microbrewery, for beer drinkers, in sight.

Alas, I know not of the beer's quality,
But margaritas, a refreshing libation, for all to see."

"Verily, 'tis worth the wait, my friends! The week doth bring a wait that's not too long, but, lo, they do text thee when thy table's ready! The site itself is fair, with shops to browse while thou dost wait, and coffee, free, to sip upon. The victuals, always of high quality, and, shouldst thou wish to mix things up, just ask! For they can fashion a platter to suit thy taste. The hashbrowns, oh, how divine! And, for those who partake of ale, the brewmosa, a fine choice indeed! In sooth, this place doth please me well, and I do eagerly await its growth in Arizona!"

In this shop, I didst feel a warmth of welcome,
They didst offer tips, and ne'er didst make me feel
As though a purchase were required, or that I
Must part with coin ere I couldst depart.
The folk who worked there were most knowledgeable,
And their kindness didst make my heart feel light.

"Hark! What fortune doth bestow upon mine eyes?
A vegan house, so near, that doth arouse
My taste buds with delight. 'Tis Nami's hand
That doth prepare these breakfast treats so grand.
If thou art nigh, whene'er I say, "Let's go,"
Thou know'st I speak of Nami, or her sister, Greens, anon.
Their culinary skills, a true divine,
Shall sate thy hunger and leave thee in bliss, I ween."

"A place most wondrous, where wings doth reign,
Sweet, savory, and delectable, they be.
In the mood for such fare, I do declare,
This place doth highly recommend itself, 'tis true.
With flavors diverse, and beer on tap,
It pleaseth all, from young to old, a family haunt.
Alas, the price, a bit steep, yet worth each penny,
For wings this tasty, 'tis a small amount to pay."

"Methinks my love and I didst stop here for luncheon.  'Twas our desire to obtain sustenance quickly, and later, indulge in finer fare.  But lo! The meal didst surpass our expectations.  Verily, they didst prepare the sandwich before our very eyes.  We didst choose the toppings of our fancy, and behold!  'Twas the most delectable sandwich I hadst ever devoured at this establishment.  The fries, too, were fresh and crispy, seasoned with just the right amount of salt.  My love and I were both amazed, and we wouldst certainly dine here again."

"A decade past, my first Cirque Du Soleil show didst grace mine eyes, And thus, a review doth follow, though long o'erdue. 

Within those ten years, I have become enamored of their art, 

And seen most of their shows, with "O" and "KA" standing apart. 

Not that I ponder plot or story while I watch, 

But simply bask in splendor of their grand performance, 

If thou find thyself in Las Vegas, do not miss this show, 

And sign up for their fan club, to reap benefits anon. 

Forsooth, enjoy it well, and let it fill thy soul."

"Verily, I say, Eye Candy doth possess  
A staff of artisans most skilled and blessed.  
Jason, a man of wit and charm, doth reign  
 Supreme, his passion for tattoos unfeigned.  
He showed me books of reference, and we spoke  
Of what I wished, and he did sketch a draft.  
The design was marvelous, a true delight  
But alas, my purse did lack the necessary might.  
Yet when my funds do permit, I shall return  
To Black Cat, for there my heart doth yearn."

"Verily, Mike doth prove himself a noble Attorney,
Whose care for his clients doth never wax thin.
He kept me informed of each step and every detail,
And with his honesty, my trust didst he win.
The outcome of my case didst far surpass my hopes,
And still, he doth assist me through the MVD's tangled scope."

"Hark, my dearest wife, what say you of this place?
A Groupon, didst thou purchase, with grace?
Indeed, 'twas a wise choice, for all was well,
And my stomach, didst it sing, with joy untold.

Steve's shrimp cocktail, a feast for mine eyes,
Large and luscious, with flavors that arise,
Like a woodland fairy, with magic so bright,
It doth stir my senses, with delight.

My rib eye, oh how grand, so tender and true,
Cooked to perfection, as if by the gods, anew.
Thy filet tips and lobster tail, a treat for thee,
Succulent and juicy, a taste of the sea.

The salad, a refreshing delight, with crisp greens,
And bread, freshly baked, from the local scene.
A special occasion place, indeed, it be,
For prices, a bit higher, than our usual spree.

Four large shrimp, for sixteen pieces of gold,
Filet tips and lobster tail, thirty-five, so bold.
Ribeye, fourteen ounces, twenty-eight, a steal,
With sides, a bargain, and bread, a generous deal.

So let us return, when a special day doth come,
And celebrate, with feasting, and merriment, some.
For this place, it doth please, with its charm and grace,
A culinary delight, in this fair town's space."

"Joyful was I to stop in at Jiffy Lube, Scottsdale,
Where I was met with warmth and hospitality most fair.
They took great care of me, as if my business mattered,
And did their work with cheer, as if 'twere a pleasure to serve.
In these days of woe, where customer service doth lack,
'Tis refreshing to find a place that doth take heed.
I shall return anon, for their kindness and skill,
Hath won my loyalty, and my heart doth fill.
Thank thee, good sirs, for thy diligence and grace,
May thy business flourish, and may thy name be blessed."

"Verily, upon mine travels to the western shore,
I have beheld a multitude of chiropractors galore.
Amongst them all, Dr. Infantino doth stand supreme,
A paragon of virtue, with a heart both kind and serene.
His touch, so gentle, doth imbue my frame with ease,
And his words, they doth bespeak a genuine desire to please.
E'en when I didst inquire, if an adjustment might aid,
He didst advise against, and freely didst impart his wisdom, unpaid.
Oh, seekers of health, and those who do aspire
To find a healer true, and not a mere hire,
Look no further than Platinum Wellness, 'tis a shrine,
Where Dr. Infantino, with his art divine, doth shine."
