With its old-fashioned charm and sweets in abundance, what a place!"

"Hark! What news is this? My heart doth sing,
A spa of wondrous worth, I do declare!
In yonder valley, fair and bright,
I chanced upon this haven of delight.

A scrub and facial, Ranee did impart,
And with such skill, she did win my heart.
I slept, enraptured by her gentle touch,
As masks of bliss did softly brush and clutch.

This facial, best of all, I do avow,
Ranee's artistry, my skin doth now allow.
Pampered, I felt, and still doth feel,
My visage, smooth and radiant, doth reveal.

The products used, of quality high,
Aveda, thou art surpassed, say I.
No gooeyness, my skin didst retain,
A true delight, this spa doth obtain.

Prices, fair and reasonable, they be,
I shall return, anon, 'tis plain to see.
My heart, doth dance with joy, indeed,
For this spa, my soul, doth take great heed."

"Hark! What eatery is this, that doth proclaim
Their macaroni and cheese, a culinary gem?
A place where steaks and ribs, do reign supreme,
And onion rings, a tasty delight, doth seem.

The staff, so friendly, doth make one feel at home,
And take-out, swift as lightning, doth roam.
A pint of mac and cheese, a mere four dollars buy,
With corn bread, the best in town, doth make one's eyes fly.
Laughter doth ensue, at such a wondrous sight,
For here, they doth serve, a true culinary delight."

"A mighty success didst our wedding make,
In Warren, New Jersey, a wondrous sight to partake.
The woman, a paragon of virtue and grace,
Didst arrive on time, with a smile on her face.
Her demeanor, most professional and kind,
Didst make the night, a true joy to find.
I do proclaim, with utmost sincerity,
This company, a gem, in photo booth rentality."

DOUG, thou art a craftsman of great skill,
Whose work doth rival that of the finest smith.
Thou didst install a pet door, most fair and bright,
In our home, with nary a moment's plight.
This was the second time thou hast graced our abode,
With thy expertise and most excellent mode.
Thou didst move an outlet and a cable box,
To the opposite wall, with minimal cost, I do suppose.
I wouldst recommend thee, without hesitation or doubt,
For thy work doth speak for itself, most loudly and devout.

"Verily, 'tis my most cherished taco shoppe in all the realm, for it doth remind me of Tacos El Gordo, that famed establishment in Tijuana. Oh, how I do adore their delectable tacos, so genuine and mouth-watering! And, by the stars, what a bargain! For the quantity of victuals thou dost receive, the price is most reasonable. In truth, I didst visit this place thrice within a fortnight, and I do confess, I shall purposely prolong my sojourn in Las Vegas, that I might partake of their culinary delights once more."

In sooth, a whimsical notion didst stir within our breasts,
To seek this place, when Mexican fare didst disappoint.
And lo, the pizza here didst prove most wondrous,
In square slices, not the usual wedges, what a delight!

The dessert, a crown of sweetness, didst complete our night,
Baked cookies, ice cream, a feast most fair and bright.
Five pounds heavier, yet with smiles on our faces,
Didst we depart, in joy and contentment's embrace.

"Fare was sumptuous, yet not so grand  
As he who served us, Anthony of old.  
His gentle grace and courteous mien  
Did make our feast most excellent, I ween.  
We shall return, and in his care  
Shall sit, that he may serve us fair."

"Hark! My review doth come, albeit late, yet 'tis here at last. And thus, my thoughts on this Walmart I shall share. 'Twas not crowded, I didst enter at one o'clock on a Thursday, and lo! They didst possess the Lactose Free Yoplait, a treasure I couldst not find elsewhere. The store was tidy, well-ordered, and the staff, most kind. Verily, I shall return to this place."

"Pita Jungle, a feast most wondrous and fair!   If only such a place did exist in the East,   'Twould be a treasure beyond compare.   Tuna, seared and seasoned to perfection,   Atop hummus, a dish of pure elation.   A combination, I confess, I would not have thought,   But the flavors, they do truly astound and besought.   And the gyro, oh so tender and tasty,   Not a morsel of street meat, I do swear.   My wife, she had hummus and beef tips,   And she, too, did find it quite delightful and hip.   A young vibe, with a bar scene most merry,   Open late, for those who do enjoy a night so very.   Quick sit down service, with nary a wait,   We shall return, and soon, I do predicate."

"Hark, what news is this? A salon most divine,
Where blowouts be had, and beauty doth shine.
I, in need of primping, didst seek their aid,
And Chris, a stylist skilled, didst not betray.

Amidst a space both clean and fair,
My appointment, prompt, didst they prepare.
The staff, with smiles and grace, didst tend,
To make my visit most pleasant, and my day didst mend.

Oh, Salon Sandoval, how blessed art thou,
For providing such a wondrous experience, anew.
I shall return, with haste, to partake,
In thy expertise, and beauty's gentle make."

"Hark! A tale of a visit most fair,
To a place where food and service do pair.
'Twas a first time venture, I do declare,
And friendly folk didst greet us there.

A customized order, they didst prepare,
With local, fresh ingredients they didst share.
Vegetarian options, they didst provide,
And meat dishes too, for those who do prescribe.

An outdoor space, perfect for a spring day,
Where one can dine and bask in the sun's ray.
Casual, indeed, a place for work or play,
For a quick lunch or a toddler's delightful sway.

Twists on classics, they didst present,
A broccoli, cheddar, and jalapeno bent.
Fresh, light, and housemade, a delicious treat,
A taste most wondrous, a culinary feat."

"This joint's a real treat for me and the missus. Soups on point, especially the potato cream cheese and broccoli cheese. Salads too, Mediterranean's the way to go. But let's be real, everything on the menu's a winner. BLT with avocado and cheese, ham sandwich, ravioli - it's all good. Now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna go grab a bite."

"Verily, I say, most excellent physician hast thou proven thyself to be! In days of yore, I didst seek medical counsel from one Kimberly Adams, yet she, in her wisdom, didst dismiss me from her care, demanding, as she didst, a costly follow-up mammogram. And lo, I didst find solace in the gentle ministrations of Dr. Harouni, whose praises have been sung by many a grateful patient. Intelligent, kind, and unhurried, she didst guide me to the capable hands of Dr. Schroeder, an eminent ENT, who, with skill and precision, didst remove my tonsils, a feat which two other doctors, including the aforementioned Kimberly Adams, didst decline to undertake."
